loans.name: Oscar  Benigno

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar P. tiene 53 años de edad esta casado con la Sra.  Mabel Benítez de 49 años de edad hace más de 20 años tienen juntos 2 hijos uno en edad escolar y el otro ya se recibió como profesor, viven en una de las compañía de Carepegua (Isla Ybyte). 
    	El señor Oscar hace 35 años que se dedica en fabricación de ladrillo  que comercializa en las casas  que venden  materiales de construcción mas grandes  de la ciudad,  tiene  clientela  formada, su señora  es artesana  teje las frazadas y vende por la zona y así se ayudan ambos. Gracias a este trabajo pudo comprarse una camioneta lo cual utiliza para repartir su mercadería y  la vez brinda a su familia una vivienda propia y digna. 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser la tierra, leña y otros.
texts.en:
Oscar P. is 53 years old and has been married more than 20 years to Mabel Benitez who is 49 years old. They have 2 children, one of school age and the other a teacher. They live in Isla Ybate, one of the neighborhoods near Carepegua. Oscar has worked for 35 years making bricks which he distributes through the largest stores that sell construction supplies in the city. He has a stable clientele. His wife, who is an artisan, weaves blankets which she sells in the area, helping them both. Thanks to their work he was able to buy a small truck which he uses to distribute their merchandise allowing him to provide the family with a proper and dignified house. He requests this loan for the purchase of basic materials like clay, firewood, other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic supplies such as firewood and clay.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., 65, resides in Dong Kor, near Phnom Penh city.  She is a widow and mother of one son, a truck driver who is married.  

With the palm-climbing season approaching, C. wants to take this opportunity to earn extra income by investing in the sugar trade.  Because C. doesn’t have capital, she decided to seek assistantance from HKL.  She will use her loan to buy palm sugar from palm climbers and retail the sugar at the market.

loans.use: Buying palm sugar and retail it at the market.

loans.name: Hilda Clarisa

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 51 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos ya independizados, vive en el cercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte.

La necesidad de salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos hizo que hace ocho años empezara un negocio de venta de comida en su domicilio, empezó con pocos utensilios e insumos y gracias a su esfuerzo el negocio ha ido creciendo, actualmente ya tiene un pequeño restaurante en donde atiende a sus clientes todos los dias, en su mayoría son trabajadores de la zona que acuden a almorzar durante la hora de almuerzo, su buena sazón y la amabilidad con la que trata a sus clientes han hecho que su negocio goce de muy buena preferencia.

La continua demanda por su negocio ha hecho que los insumos con los que cuenta no sean suficientes para brindar una buena atención, por ello Hilda desea ampliar su restaurante con la compra de mesas, sillas y algunos insumos para preparar más platos de comida, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen, las cuales la consideran una mujer de confianza y luchadora.
texts.en:
Hilda is 51 years old, divorced, and has 3 children who are independent. She lives near the city of Chiclayo, a city well known for its commercial and transport activity. The need to move ahead and help her children some 8 years ago led her to launch a business selling meals from her house. She began with few utensils and little supplies and thanks to her effort, the business has grown. At present, she already has a small restaurant where she waits on customers every day. The majority are workers from the zone who come for lunch around lunch time. The good flavors of her food and the amiability she displays towards her customers has resulted in the restaurant gaining favor. The rise in demand has resulted in short supplies, affecting her service. For that reason, Hilda wishes to buy more supplies and to expand her restaurant by buying tables and chairs. Then she will be able to prepare more plates of food. For that reason, she approached Edpyme Alternative for the first time, requesting a loan of 2,000 new sols that will help her achieve her objective. Hilda is an amiable woman who likes her work very much. Her great hope is to continue growing as an impresario. She is much admired by those who know her. They consider her a woman with confidence and fighting spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TABLES, CHAIRS, AND SUPPLIES TO IMPROVE SERVICES IN HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem J. is 27 years old and from Gaza. He is married with three members in his family. Hazem owns a perfume store. He is requesting a loan to help him enlarge his business. He will buy new perfumes for the store, which will increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy new perfumes for his store

loans.name: Nashon Odwuor

texts.en:
Nashon Odwuor O. is a businessman who sells rice in Migori town. He is also a matatu driver. While he is away driving, he leaves his wife behind to manage the rice business for him. He buys his stock in Sirare Migori twice a week, in small quantities, but due to the rising demand, he wants to start purchasing his stock in bulk.

He would like to get a loan worth KES10,000 to increase his stock that will boost his business. He is 30 years old, married man and a father of three (3) children. He lives with his family in Migori, Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost the business.

loans.name: Barshagul

texts.en:
Barshagul, is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayn-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic tent home. Barshagul has operated a meat trading business in her town since 1990 and has steadily expanded her business over the years. She purchases meat wholesale from herders in the surrounding countryside and resells to her customers. People in her province typically  prepare meat for the winter during October and November. One family will consume up to one ox and ten sheep through the course of the winter which will last them through March. 

As meat stocks are currently low, Barshagul's business is starting to pick up for the summer. Barshagul is a very hard-working person and has many plans for the future. She says, “I am working hard to support my children's future.” She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase meat at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to purchase meat at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 32 years old and a father of four.  He has been doing carpentry for four years in his O. Quality Furniture shop.  His Express Soweto group members in Faulu Kenya have guaranteed him a loan of Kes.30,000.  He plans to buy timber and nails for making furniture.  He wants to meet his customers’ needs by stocking his shop with different furniture designs. His desire is to open other outlets in 10 years.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails for making furniture

loans.name: Rafiqan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan bibi is very supportive of her family. She does embroidery work to help her husband fulfill the basic needs of their family. 


Her husband is a tailor and operates a tailor shop in the market. They live in a city called Vehari in Pakistan.They are both very hard working and manage their work efficiently. 


As inflation is increasing day by day, it is becoming hard for them to pay for utilities and manage their work. Therefore, Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her embroidery business. She will buy clothes in bulk and sell finished embroidered products rather than embroidering clothes supplied by her customers. She is hopeful that she can double her income and improve their financial situation.

Note: "In this photo, Sakina, a group member, is showing her chair filling business".

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk to embroider

loans.name: Adoté Novignon

texts.en:
Monsieur Adoté A. is 29 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. He is married to an accountant and they have one child.

Recently, Adoté purchased a motorcycle for his business as a motorcycle taxi driver in the city. Here in Lomé, this is a lucrative business. Moto-taxis, or Zemidjans as they are called here, are the most common form of transportation in the city. With this new motorcycle he will be able to attract more customers and provide a better service to his clients as well. He has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA for the purchase, insurance, and plates for this new motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle, insurance, and registration.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa y sus hijos. Esteban y su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes y un restaurante. El restaurante “El Descanso” estuvo cerrado por varios meses pero ahora por el mes de agosto lo abrirán de nuevo y contrataran una persona para que atienda el negocio. El motivo de la reapertura es que cerca de su casa están haciendo una obra y los trabajadores necesitaran comer. 
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Esteban espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para implementar el restaurante y comprar gaseosas e insumos.   

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Esteban participa desde que se abrió el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Esteban was born in Urubamba, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco and currently lives there with his wife and children. Esteban and his wife have a grocery shop and restaurant. “El Descanso” (Relaxation) has been closed for several months, but they will open it again in August and hire someone to assist with the business. The reason for reopening is that there is some work going on near his house, and the workers will need to eat.

Esteban hopes to receive 1500 new soles in with his next loan. At present, his restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. He would like to use the money from the loan to start up the restaurant and but sofy drinks and other materials.

The “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank opened in 1994. Esteban participated from the time it opened and things have gone well. The name given to the communal bank is in honor of the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to open his restaurant and purchase soft drinks and other materials.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Lolita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked foods "bihon," "pancit," and "sari-sari" for daily meals. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer trabajadora, siendo su medio de trabajo la venta de ropa, zapatos, y costura. Lo que para ella ha sido de mucho apoyar  a su esposo e hijos.
Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la costura, pero como hay meses que nadie llega a coser. Nace la iniciativa de comprar ropa nueva y hacer ropa de telas que ella cose,   compra así como encargos que le hacen los clientes en zapatos. Con las ganancias compra parte de los alimentos, abarca gastos básicos lo que está contenta por poder apoyar a su familia.
Con este financiamiento comprara: telas en cantidad y de diferente colores, hilos, bordados, así como ropa nueva y zapatos así  mejorando  las ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking woman who earns her living by sewing and selling clothing and shoes. She has tremendous support from her husband and children.

Teresa previously devoted herself to sewing alone, but after several months she was no longer receiving orders. She took the initiative to buy new clothing in addition to the garments that she sews. Teresa buys merchandise based on her customers’ orders, which also includes shoes. She is pleased with her earnings because she is able to buy food and pay for basic expenses to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy fabrics in quantity and of different colors, thread, embroideries, as well as new clothing and shoes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, shoes, fabrics, thread, and embroideries

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Nancy vende ropa variada en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 4 veces a la semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Nancy tiene un carro con la cual realizan transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección y solicita un crédito para la compra de conjuntos de niños y pantalones.
Los sueños de Nancy son tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her partner and has 2 children who study. Nancy sells assorted clothing in the markets in the region, to which she travels 4 times a week. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Nancy has a car for urban transportation to the city of Ayacucho. Nancy is a member of the Proyeccion Community Bank and is requesting a loan for the purchase of sets of children's clothing and pants. Nancy's dreams are to have her own home, since she lives in a rented house, and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of sets of children's clothing and pants.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Luzviminda is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a tailoring business, which provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials for the maintenance of her sewing machine. This will be the second loan taken by Luzviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the maintenance of her sewing machine

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosalia Antonio

texts.pt:
Rosália Antônio M. nasceu no Distrito de Xai-xai, província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 04 a 16 anos de idade somente o ultimo não vai a Escola. Não estudou porque os pais não deram oportunidade para tal. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que perdeu os pais e ainda menor de idade.

Saiu de Xai-xai para Maputo com o seu pai porque a mãe perdeu a vida apos o parto dela. Tem um negocio de produção e venda de blocos de construção civil ha mais de 15 anos, conta com ajuda do seu marido e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa.

Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de credito CCP e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material (cimento, areia, pó de pedra e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua produção.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este credito para poder aceder a outros e ampliar ainda mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Rosália Antônio M. was born in the district of Xai-Xai in the province of Gaz in southern Mozambique.  She is the mother of 6 children whose ages range from 4 to 16.  Only the youngest does not go to school.  Rosália didn't go to school because her parents didn't give her the opportunity.  She lives in her own home with her family and supports her niece who lost her parents and is still a minor.

She left Xai-Xai for Maputo with her father because her mother lost her life during childbirth.  She has had a business producing and selling bricks for residential construction for more than 15 years.  She has the help of her husband and makes a monthly income of 7,000 meticais.  She puts this towards her home's expenses and also saves some in her home.

She has had a loan in the past with the credit cooperative, CCP and decided not to continue with them.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the organization.  This is her first loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais which she will use to buy material (cement, sand, gravel, etc.) to increase her production.

She promises to pay back her credit to be able to request more in the future so she can expand her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase materials (cement, sand, gravel, etc.)

loans.name: Tukwatanise Women's Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: N. Venny is affliated with Tukwatanise Women’s group . She is 41 years old and has five kids. It is now six years since she began her photocopy business in Bushenyi. Venny was formerly a teacher. She describes herself as hard-working and self-driven. 200,000 shillings is what accrues to her business monthly. With this loan she says she is going to buy more printing paper and cartridges.

loans.use: The purchase of more printing paper and cartridges

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Raquilina es socia del bancomunal Unidas, que inicia su sexto ciclo con 14 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios.
Raquilina es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 12,11 y 9 años D. edasd, D. los caules 2 son mujeres y 1 varoncito.
Raquilina, antes trabajaba  fuera D. su casa, un día acordó con su esposo abrir una tienda en su casa porque quería estar más cerca D. sus hijos, tenían unos ahorros con eso comenzaron, ahora en su tienda venD. abarrotes surtidos como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, detergente, jabón, verduras surtidas y frutas.
Está en Finca hace dos ciclos, le gusta porque pueD. ahorrar les hablan mucho D. los valores, la familia y del negocio.
Raquilina solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio con la compra D. mercadería como son verduras, papa, frutas, arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El sueño D. Raquilina es ahcer crecer su negocio y que su familia se mantenga unida.
texts.en:
Raquilina is a member of the "Unidas" [United Women] communal bank. It is starting its sixth loan cycle, with 14 members who operate a range of businesses. 

Raquilina is married and has 3 children, two girls and a boy, aged 12, 11 and 9. 

Earlier, Raquilina worked outsiD. the home, but one day she and her husband decided that she would open a store in her home, because she wanted to be closer to her children. They had saved some money, which they used to get started. Now, she sells assorted groceries in her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, detergent, soap, and assorted fruits and vegetables. 

She has been working with FINCA for two loan cycles, and she likes it because she can save money, and people talk to the members about values, family and business. 

Raquilina is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise such as vegetables, potatoes, fruits, rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Raquilina's dream is to expand her business and to keep her family united.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, potatoes, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Dominic Mavindu

texts.en:
Dominic Mavindu, aged 37 years, is married to Josephine Mueni, aged 30 years, and together they have two children — Mutheu, age ten, in class five and Muema, age six, in class two. He lives and has his butcher business in Mlolongo. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Dominic has been in this business for six years and his monthly profit is Kshs 18,000. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is his second loan with KADET. The previous loan was paid back successfully. With this loan, Dominic plans to use Kshs 20,000 to buy an oven to roast meat, and Kshs 30,000 to increase the stock of meat in his butchery. If the loan boosts business he will buy a piece of land and build his own house.

Dominic describes himself as outgoing and dreams of becoming a prominent business man in the future.

loans.use: To buy an oven to roast meat and buy more meat to butcher

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. K. is a married lady with one child aged five years old. Her business is located at the busy Kongowea-Karama market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

She sells clothes to the local people. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is impassable roads during the rainy seasons, thus slowing her business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers, especially as we approach the Christmas festivities. She hopes to expand the buisness and move it to a more convenient place which is easily accessible, especially during the rainy seasons. She describes herself as hardworking, honest and goal oriented.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric to decorate premises where events take place

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 36 years old. Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & detergents. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & detergents

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socio también se dedica al transporte, el es chofer de servicio público, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y la tienda de abarrotes trabaja su esposa, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y leche para la tienda de abarrotes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 45, is a member of the “EL MOLINITO II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a live-in spouse and three children.  He alternates his daily chores with a grocery business.  He also is in transportation; he’s a driver in public transportation service.  He works from 7am until 9pm and the grocery store is tended to by his wife.  He wants to expand the grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar and milk for the grocery store.

He is happy about the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy products like rice, sugar and milk for his grocery store.

loans.name: Swaibu

texts.en: Thirty-year-old Swaibu would like a loan to purchase a motor vehicle. He is  involved in a transport business and phone charging. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and his desire is to put up a permanent residential house.

loans.use: Purchase of motor vehicle

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es:
CARLOS DAVID U. M., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO RESPONSABLE DE BODEGA, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDEN DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON  CARLOS DAVID ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO LO SOLICITA PARA COMPRA DE MEDICAMENTOS Y GASTOS MEDICOS PARA SU MAMA LA CUAL SE ENCUENTRA ENFERMA.
CARLOS DAVID AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO, YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTOS HOY EN DIA LE HAN SERVIDO DE MUCHO.
texts.en:
Carlos David U. M. is from Managua.  He works as a store manager and is a family man with two school-aged children.

Don Carlos David has requested through CEPRODEL a loan to buy medicine and cover medical expenses for his mother who is ill.

Carlos David is grateful to CEPRODEL for this financial assistance that has meant so much to him.

loans.use: For medical expenses

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
Maria Zoila R. S. tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

María  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Zoila R. S. is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys celebrating carnival festivities.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Mery Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta ella realiza lo que son almanaques, tarjetas para todo tipo de compromisos como bautizos,matrimonios,fiesta de 15 años entre otros, la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio el cual le llena de satisfacciones ya que mediante este su negocio ella saca a sus hijos adelante y esto es algo que la enorgullece, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de más mercadería como papeles, cartulinas entre otros para así poder trabajar mejor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Mery, 46, is a member of the SOL Y LUNA community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Mery is married and has 2 children.  She and her husband operate a printing business where she makes and sells cards for every kind of celebration from baptisms to weddings to quinceaneras.  She has earned her living from the business for years and is very happy with it because it has allowed her to give her children a leg up, something about which she is immensely proud.  She's a naturally happy woman with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  

Sra. Mery is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies such as paper and printer cartridges.

Sra. Mery is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for printing business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 43-year-old, single mother of two. She operates a cafeteria where she has employed two people. She runs her business in a very competitive environment, hence she puts extra effort in her business to attract more customers. She hopes to grow her cafeteria to a resort in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy beverages.

loans.use: to buy beverages for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 25 kilos of rice, 25 kilos of wheat flour, 1 bucket of cooking oil, and 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota lives in Zestaponi, West Georgia. He is 52 years old and lives with wife Nana, their 19-year-old daughter and their 15-year-old son. Shota’s daughter is a student at a high school and his son goes to school. 

Shota works in a local construction company. Besides his regular job he is involved in the family dairy farm activities. They have two milk cows. Nana produces cheese and sells it on local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

A small part of the requested credit (18%) will be used to cover Shota’s old loan. With the rest of the credit (82%), Shota and Nana will purchase an additional milk cow and feed for it. Nana will produce more cheese and sell it on the local market. Taking into account the existing demand for cheese on the market, she won’t have a problem selling more cheese. 

The increase in the family’s income will be used for financing the children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and feed.

loans.name: Dishoni

texts.en:
Dishoni is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Dishoni has been operating a green grocer business, selling retail to his neighbours and passersby. Dishoni faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season, the supply of vegetables for sale is higher and the demand is lower, while during dry hot season the demand is higher and supply is lower.  Jackson dreams of expanding his business and establishing a grocery shop in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Jackson wants to purchase sacks of onions, tomatoes, carrots and bananas for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes, carrots and bananas

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 36 years old, married, and has nine children. Six of them are boys and three are girls. Nazeeran couldn't provide an education to all of her children due to financial constraints. 

Her eldest son left his education after the ninth grade and started his business. He prepares and fits sofa covers to order. He is very skillful and provides good quality services to his clients. 

Nazeeran supports her family by doing tailoring. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn income. Her eldest daughter also helps her in completing the orders on time. 

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son's business. With the loan, he will purchase sofa covers and thread to expand his business. He has been operating this business for the past 13 years and Nazeeran is very hopeful that his business will be expanded further after the loan investment. 

She wants to marry her elder daughter who is 23 years old and is hopeful that she will be able to purchase a dowry with the help of her son's improved business.

loans.use: To buy sofa covers and thread

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making rugs. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making rugs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 28 years old and has been engaged in a charcoal-sales business for the past 3 years in Bushenyi, Uganda. A father of 3 children, he believes in a philosophy of diligence as a basis for success. While Moses has had this business for only 3 years, his attitude and belief in his own worth are stock-in-trade attributes that stand out and will probably work very much in his favor in the not-too-distant future.

It goes without saying that most households in most rural areas in Uganda use charcoal for all their cooking needs. This means if one painstakingly lays out an effective plan for running this kind of business not only in the short term but also in the long term, one can gain a lot monetarily.

Moses also has a modest retail shop that he operates on the side.

Monthly, his business returns a total profit of up to 250,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). Moses plans to use his Kiva loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase of more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 27 years old. He is married to Esleen who does some farming to help support the family. Mark and Esleen have three children between the ages of three years and two months. 

Mark runs a retail store; he has been in business for three years. His monthly income from the business is KES. 54,500. He is requesting a loan of KES. 40,000 to add more stock to his store. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the loan to expand his business. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

His dream and hope is to continue with his retail business and to do some farming. He also wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique es soltero pero tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus padres quienes ya son adultos mayores.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el materia para la construcción que es, arena, cemento y block, ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Enrique desea mejorar la casa donde vive sus padres y que estén seguras ya que todo el día están solo porque el tiene que ir a trabajar. 
Es empleado de una compañía de construcción como albañil, con una parte del sueldo pagara el crédito ya que es el fuente de ingreso que tiene para El y sus padres. 
Don Enrique ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP y sus pagos fueron puntuales.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique is single but he is responsible for caring for his elderly parents.

He is requesting a loan to buy constructions materials, specifically sand, cement, and concrete blocks. He will be responsible for making the improvements in addition to his work schedule. Enrique wants to improve the house where his parents live and to make sure it is secure, since they are alone all day when he has to go to work.

Enrique works for a construction company as a bricklayer. He will use part of his salary to repay the loan, as his job is the source of income for him and his parents.

Enrique previously had a loan with FVP [Fundacion para la Vividenda Progresiva, which merged with Credituyo in early 2010] and his repayments were on time.

loans.use: to build a fence around his parents' house

loans.name: Nejane

texts.en:
Nejane  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Nejane  has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & mainly retailing dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Nejane  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nejane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benita; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende caramelos, chicles, chupetes y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos y galletas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “IMASUMAC I” communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco province and department.

Sra. Benita is 53 years old and single. She has a business where she sells sweets every day: candy, gum, lollipops and cookies. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 pm. With this business, she has helped her children get ahead. She wants to expand and improve her 
business selling sweets. She is requesting this loan in order to buy sweets, such as lollipops, candy and cookies, wholesale.

Sra. Benita is pleased about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweets, such as lollipops, candy and cookies, wholesale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with five grown children. She is 51 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Rebecca plants and harvests crops to earn a living. She has been working on the land for over 20 years and has enjoyed doing this kind of work. At the end of the month, she is able to earn a total of PHP 20,400 from this along with other income sources. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to improve plant growth. 

Rebecca joined GDMPC earlier this year. This is her first loan from the cooperative. In the future, Rebecca hopes to till additional land to grow more crops and increase the family income. She also plans to repair her house roofs and walls to live comfortably, especially during rainy days.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 46 years old and married to a fisherman. For almost a month she has been selling fish in their community. She doesn’t feel tiredness in selling every day but she feels more exhausted when she sees her only child suffering from the poor living that they have.

So, she is working hard to provide a more comfortable life for her family. She wants to improve her business, and that’s why she is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fishes and a styrofoam crate to stock her fishes. She hopes this will provide a higher income and lift their poor living from the current hardship. She hopes especially that she can satisfy the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishes and even one Styrofoam where she stocks her fishes

loans.name: Anallely

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Anallely le está haciendo falta la losa en el patio trasero.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es (arena, cemento y varilla) ya que su esposo se encargara de realizar la mejorar en horario adicional a su empleo. 
Doña Anallely es quien se encarga del cuidado y atención de la familia, quien se encargas de los gastos y de pagar el crédito será su esposo el señor  Brayan Jesus con el sueldo que recibe de su empleo en una agencia aduanal. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeña hija y que tenga un patrimonio seguro.
texts.en:
Anallely's home needs a concrete slab in the rear patio area.  She is applying for a loan to buy materials (sand, cement, rebar), since her husband will look after carrying out the improvements, in his spare time outside of work. 

Anallely is the one who looks after and cares for the family. Her husband Brayan Jesús will be the one responsible for the expenditures and paying back the loan, with the salary that he receives from his job in a customs brokerage.

They want to improve the quality of life for their small daughter, and want her to have a secure inheritance.

loans.use: To install a concrete slab in the patio area of her home.

loans.name: Musavvar

texts.ru: Мусаввар замужем имеет четверых детей. Она имеет свою лавку по торговле продовольственных товаров. В бизнесе ей помогает дочь. Продовольственные товары следует пополнять ежедневно и в большом количестве. Для этого она хочет получить займ и расширить обороты своего бизнеса. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Musavvar is married and has four children.  She has her own store, where she sells grocery products.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Grocery products inventory has to be refilled daily and in large quantities.  Musavvar wants to obtain this loan for this purpose and increase product turnover in her business.  She very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en:
Jedida is 35 years-old and single.  She has one child who is 13 years-old. She operates a green grocer and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 30,000 from the business.

This is her forth loan term from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  She paid her previous loans successfully.  She will use the loan amount to buy vegetables ,tomatoes and onions in large quantities in order to stock her business.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her child. Her dream is to own a retail shop and have a stable income in order to raise her child.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and onions from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Khushrat

texts.ru: Хушрат трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж скотовод. Хушрат занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 7 лет и одновременно занимается скотоводством. Она хочет увеличить свое поле для посева, чтобы получить хороший урожай. С прибыли она хочет ремонтировать свой дом и создать хорошие условия дома. Ей в бизнесе помогают дети. Хушрат хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота и семена пшеницы.
texts.en: Khushrat is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband is involved in animal husbandry.  Khushrat has been growing wheat for over seven years and is also involved in animal husbandry.  She wants to increase the size of her field for sowing in order to get a good harvest.  She wants to use the profits to repair her house and create good living conditions.  Khushrat's children help her with the business.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy livestock and wheat seeds

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "SUMAC PURIRISUN"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Santiago en Tica Tica, en el Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marleny, es nueva en el banco ella fue invitada a formar parte de este encantador grupo por su hermana mayor; la socia tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12, 10 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de gelatinas y de manera ambulatoria lleva  a vender a todos los clientes, ella tambien se dedica  a la elaboracion de comidas caseras para la venta tambien en forma independiente en su stand rotatorio; la socia solicita el prestamo para poder tener un capital de trabajo e invertir el prestamo en la compra de ingredientes como son gelatina para sus postres, arroz, azucar, aceite, fideos al por mayor para la realizacion de sus diferentes comidas caseras y la venta de estas. La socia soliciate l prestamo para invertir en la compra de sus ingredientes.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de manera responsable y trabjar mucho para prosperar.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the communal bank "Sumac Puririsun," located in Tica Tica in the Santiago district of the department of Cusco.

Marleny is new to the bank.  She was invited to join this delightful group by her older sister.  She is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 10.  She has a business making gelatin treats that she takes to sell to all of her customers.  In addition, she produces homemade meals that she also sells on her own from a rolling stand.  She requests a loan so that she can have working capital to invest in the purchase of ingredients, such as gelatin, for her desserts, and rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles at wholesale so she can make her various homemade meals and sell them.  She requests a loan to buy ingredients for her business.

Marleny pledges to make her payments in a responsible manner, and to work very hard in order to prosper.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the various desserts and meals that she sells

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a hardworking businessman, aged 29. He is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are in school. 
Walter has been running a carpentry business for the last nine years to support his family. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 
Walter is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber and paint. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy timber and paint.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of seven children. All of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business selling bananas. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO, which she wants to use to buy more bunches of bananas. Rose works from her home and works seven days a week. She sells on a retail basis and doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. Her business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Rose aspires to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. She stays in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Norma;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 16, 15, 9, 6 años de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende animales menores como cuyes, pollos, , gallinas, la socia lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado en cjas; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de un total de 80 al mes de gallinas, la socia compra por semanas ella compra 40 a 60 gallinas a la semana;  y comprara 160 cuyes. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the ”Qori Orcco" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 35, and lives with her partner. She has 4 children, ages 16, 15, 9, and 6. 

She has a retail business, where she buys and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, roosters, and hens. She takes them to the city of Puerto Maldonado in crates to sell. 

On this occasion, she wishes to use the loan to buy a total of 80 hens a month. She buys weekly. She buys 40 to 60 hens a week. She will also buy 160 guinea pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and hens. 

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady aged 27 years and has one child aged 5 years.  She owns a boutique in Kapsabet town. It has been in operation for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000.

She is requesting her second loan of Kes 40,000 from KADET Ltd.  She intends to use the funds  to purchase more clothing for resale and the anticipated profit will be used to pay back the loan as well as provide for family upkeep.

She hopes to grow her business into a large-scale clothing store and live a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes De San José Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que se esfuerzan día a día por poder darle el sustento a sus hijos y familiares. Son mu trabajadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras. Ven en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso.
Una de estas laboriosas mujeres es Fulbia, quien trabaja en la costura, desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Ella ha trabajado en esto por un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le acerca muchos trabajos. Deseo poder seguir ampliando su negocio y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo, para poder lograr sus objetivos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cierres, botones, telas, gomas y demás insumos necesarios par poder abastecerse y tener materiales para poder cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from Ciudad del Este have come together with the goal of working together to be able to help each other through that work.  The women are heads of household who make the effort every day to be able to support their children and families.  They are very hardworking and entrepreneurial, and above all they all are fighters.  They see the Fundación Paraguaya program as a great opportunity for progress.

One of these hardworking women is Fulbia, who has worked in sewing for a long time.  She has a good clientele that brings her a lot of work because she has worked in this for a long time.  She wants to be able to continue expanding her business, so she always makes the maximum effort to be able to achieve her goals.

She is requesting the loan to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies necessary to be able to stock up and have materials to be able to satisfy the customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with five children  She lives at her own house that  has  no electricity but has  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rebecca dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans ,rice ,maize and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans ,rice ,maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya T. is married. She has a son and a daughter. She is a Technical school graduate. After the studies Nelya lacked work opportunities in her field since there was a problem with unemployment in Ukraine. She had to to sell homemade pastry at the markets to meet the needs of her family. In 2001 she got her first loan in Nadiya Ukraine and decided to start a small business selling coats and jackets. Nelya opened a kiosk at one of the local markets. She employed a lady who is currently working there selling clothing which provides a stable source of income for her family. Nelya also owns a kiosk and rents a store offering a great variety of food products at two different parts of the city. Nelya is very organized and full of energy. She always seeks to provide better service to her customers. She is very responsible and has been punctual with her past loans from Nadiya giving us confidence that she will repay this loan on time. Nelya needs $2,000 to improve her business and stock more clothing items. The loan will help her expand her business and clientele. Applying this additional capital to her business will have a positive impact not only on her trade profitability but will improve the economic and social situation of her employees and their families.

Товстоног Неля Іванівна – одружена. В неї є син і дочка. Неля Іванівна має середньо-технічну освіту. Закінчивши навчання, Неля Іванівна не могла влаштуватися на роботу за своєю спеціальністю, в країні на той час панувало безробіття. Вона була змушена продавати пиріжки на ринках міста для того, щоб задовольнити фінансові потреби родини. В 2001 році Неля Іванівна отримала першу позику в „Надії України” та відкрила власну справу, почавши продавати теплий зимній одяг, а саме, пальта та шуби. Неля Іванівна відкрила кіоск на одному з місцевих ринків. Вона взяла на роботу жінку, яка зараз працює реалізатором одягу, а отже, отримує стабільну зарплатню та забезпечує свою родину. Неля Іванівна є власницею продуктового кіоску, а також орендує приміщення для того, щоб продавати різноманітні продовольчі товари в іншій частині міста. Неля Іванівна – дуже організована, завжди сповнена енергії. Вона завжди намагається якомога краще обслуговувати своїх покупців. Вона – відповідальна, завжди дуже пунктуальна, особливо якщо це стосується сплати позик, які вона отримала в „Надії України”. Ці якості підтверджують, що вона спроможна сплатити позику вчасно. Неля Іванівна просить про суму в 2000 доларів для того, щоб покращити торгівлю та закупити більше одягу задля продажу. Позика сприятиме розвитку бізнесу та допоможе привабити більшу кількість клієнтів. Додатковий капітал позитивно впливатиме не тільки на прибутки з продажу товарів, але й підвищить економічне та соціальне становище її підлеглих та їхніх родин

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 3 sufurias (cooking pots), 2 plastic packing containers, & 1 jiko

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of four who started her business in 2002. It includes buying cereals, especially maize, from the farmers during harvest seasons and selling in retail at the local trading centre. She is a trained tailor and dress maker. At first she used to make dresses to sell at the trading centre, but quit when she saw there was stiff competition and turned to selling cereals.  She says the business is doing well.  She also molds bricks and sells them at construction sites. Through her businesses, she has been able to educate her children and support her family. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase on her cereals stock and also purchase some more brick molding tools.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals and buy brick-molding tools

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca sells breakfast to people in her neighborhood. She shares the establishment with someone else who serves at night.  She plans on using this loan to buy a freezer and more foodstuffs.  She has been working in this business for over one year.  She is married with 4 male children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver in the city of Santo Domingo. In her menu she serves spaghetti, bananas and eggs, among other things.  She buys the foodstuffs in the local market .

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more foodstuff

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha Alicia, who has lived all her life in Nuevo Leon, Monterrey, lives with her partner and has two children. Her partner is a bricklayer but his salary is very low. She and her family went through many difficult times, so in order to get ahead, Martha decided to open up her own business where she sells used clothing. One of her brother finds the clothing in traveling markets, and Martha's enthusiam and good service has allowed her business to grow since its inception 4 years ago.

Right now, Martha is requesting a loan of $250, which she would pay back in 3 months, and that will be used to buy additional merchandise to meet her customers' demands. She realizes that a good selling season is approaching and she would like to be prepared.

Martha is very grateful for the opportunity you offer which will help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Alicia es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, su pareja se desempeña como albañil pero su salario es muy bajo, ella y su familia pasaban por muchas necesidades y para poder salir adelante Martha decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada, uno de sus hermanos consigue la ropa que comercializan juntos en los mercados rodantes, el entusiasmo y el buen servicio que ofrecen les ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio desde hace cuatro años que iniciaron.

En estos momentos, Martha está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses y destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, ella sabe que se aproxima una buena temporada de ventas y quiere estar preparada. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Martha agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to help her business grow.

loans.name: Roda Luz

texts.es:
We find Roda Ramirez working diligently in her small store, in which she happily displays the diversity of her products, primarily those of basic needs (groceries, cleaning supplies, health products, etc.) She and her adored husband rent a their store space in a local commercial zone, and as the number of people near their own home is relatively low, it was not conducive to having a store in their own neighborhood. The rent for this store space has increased over time and has cut into their earnings considerably. And so, the family would like to increase the quantity of their products to increase their earnings. In this way, they could continue to pay rent for their store space and also save enough money to purchase their own store space in the future. Their ultimate goal is to give a better standard of life to their small son. Help us support this woman in her search for happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Encontramos a Roda Ramirez enfrascada diligentemente en su pequeña bodega, en el que expende animosamente diversidad de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes, artículos de limpieza, de salud, etc.)Ella y su querido esposo alquilan el local de su bodega en una zona comercial, ya que la afluencia de público por su vivienda es relativamente baja, lo que no permitiría tener un negocio de estas características en su casa. El pago por este alquiler con el tiempo se ha incrementado poco a poco y muchas veces este pago merma considerablemente sus ingresos, por lo que esta familia desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para aumentar sus ganancias.De esta manera podrán seguir pagando el alquiler de su local y ahorrar un poco de dinero para seguir proyectándose en el futuro a tener un local propio con el objetivo de seguir brindándole lo mejor a su pequeño niño.Ayudemos a esta mujer en la búsqueda de su felicidad.

loans.use: Investment to expand the quantity and variety of her products.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho P., 56, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together in their farm growing rice crops and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory in the city and the rest are unemployed. Mrs. Tho P. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business. She believes this business will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata J. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. She sells second-hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone and has been doing this business for the past 4 years.

She is requesting a $700 loan to expand her business. She has been with the SMT program for 3 years and has experienced considerable progress in her business.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business by purchasing additional bales of clothing to resell

loans.name: Stefka

texts.en: Stefka Z. lives in the village of Mighailovo near Vratza. For more than 20 years, she has had a farming business. Now she breeds 8 cows and 15 goats. Her husband works in a construction company and her son is grown up and lives in the city of Vratza. Stefka Z. applies for a loan to supply enough fodder for her farm.

loans.use: To supply enough fodder for her farm

loans.name: Selminaz

texts.en: Selminaz I. is a livestock breeder in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is married with three children and has been involved in this business for a number of years. She has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of 600 AZN (~$700) thus proving herself to be a trustworthy customer. She is currently looking for funding of $1200 in order to increase the size of her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
One of Esther’s friends encouraged her to invest in a business selling beauty products. To decided to go ahead, because at that time there were problems at home and she was looking for new ways to generate income. For a while she had been cleaning houses, washing clothes and kitchens of her various customers. Today, she only does this for short periods, one or two days, or on the weekends. Everything she earns goes towards her five children; since despite the fact that her husband also works as a driver, they often need more income. This is why, until she finds a more stable job she is going to continue to put all her efforts into developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una amiga de Esther la animó a invertir en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella decidió aceptar, porque en aquel momento pasaba por algunos problemas en su casa y buscaba otras formas de generar ingresos al hogar. Muy aparte, desde hace un tiempo ella ofrece servicios de limpieza a casas, de lavado de ropa y de cocina a diversos clientes. Actualmente, solo lo hace por temporadas pequeñas, un día dos días o los fines de semana. Las ganancias que ella obtiene de su arduo trabajo van dirigidas a sus cinco hijos; ya que, a pesar, de que su esposo también trabaja siendo chofer, muchas veces se necesita más de un ingreso en la familia; por ello, hasta que encuentre un trabajo más estable seguirá poniendo todo su empeño para crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: La Restauracion (Restoration) Group

texts.en:
Berty Cristóbal is a young woman who lives with her husband and three children, aged 14, 16 and 21 years old.  They all live in small farming town called Hato Mayor, and Berty has started a small business selling used and new clothing, as well as small home decorations.

She is asking for this loan so that she can increase the merchandise she is able to have on hand, and thus be able to sell more.  She would also like to buy some pots and pans to begin selling as well, for a little bit of variety.

Although life can often be challenging and difficult Berty is optimistic that this loan will help her improve her life and her family’s lives.  It is her goal to one day own her own home, and also have enough money to buy and build her own big store to sell her products from—and above all, it is her dream to have enough money to pay for her children to study at the local  university.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Berty and her entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise,  and expand the variety of products she is able to offer.

loans.name: Ake's Group

texts.en:
This group from Faala Palauli is a new group in which the members work individually on their businesses but, when it comes to the time of payments, they are very kind to each other. Most of them work on plantations and vegetable gardens because their land is fertile. Their husbands weed the grasses and plant the taro (called "taamu" in Samoa), while the women are responsible for marketing and sales. This is their first loan and also the first time for them to run their own businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of equipments, tools, chemicals and fertilizers for the businesses

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.en: G. Bibniso is 23 years old. She has been running her own business for six years to support her parents. Bibiniso sells a variety of accessories and hair products for women in the local market. She would like to expand her business, and open her own store to establish contacts with constant supplies of well known producers. Bibiniso would like a loan of $1000 to increase the range of goods she sells, and increase her profits to support her family.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of M. T. D.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 3 months old and her son is one year old. Shazia baji completed her education until the 10th standard grade. She runs a boutique independently. Her husband makes decorative scarves and sells them in the market. This is a very profitable business because Multan City is famous for its handmade items. Shazia baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, needles) to help expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy more supplies (lentils, cooking oil) for her grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Hussan Bano baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. (shown on the left in the photo with her group members) was selected to be the group leader by the five other members for a loan from Maxima.  The group participants live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Touch P., 39, was married in 1990 and has four daughters. She has been selling jasmine flowers for 18 years, while her husband works as a mason. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

2-Mrs. Sokunthea P., 28, married in 2000, has three children, one son and two daughters. She and her husband have been selling jasmine flowers and bananas since 2000, and now Sokunthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

3-Mrs. Dany S., 33, was married in 1999 and has three sons. Dany has been selling jasmine flowers since 1997, while her husband has worked in construction since 1999. Dany is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

4-Mrs. Vorn S., 42, was married in 1986 and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Vorn has been selling jasmine flowers for eight years, while her husband farms. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

5-Mrs. Voeun N., 49, is a widow with four children, two sons and two daughters. Voeun has been selling jasmine flowers since 1998 and is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

6-Mr. Phearin N., 21, was married in 2008. Phearin has been selling jasmine flowers since early this year, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Phearin is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride A. is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. She started her business because there was no other way to feed her family as she and her husband were unemployed. Now, she has been running her store for 10 years. She sells different kinds of goods, including kitchen equipment and accessories for girls. Feride is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children because she dreams that all of them will be well educated. Today, Feride wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. For this purpose, she requests a loan. She is borrowing money for the first time. Your help and support can make her closer to her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián tiene 44 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su hermana con su familia. Es un hombre muy carismático, esto le ha ayudado en su negocio de venta de productos Herbalife (productos alimenticios), donde se tiene que convencer a las personas para que le compren sus productos. Hasta ahora a Don Fabián le va muy bien, logrando buenos ingresos económicos, dedicándole gran parte de su tiempo al trabajo, pero no teniendo un horario fijo ya que trabaja por pedidos. Don Fabián quiere ayudar en la economía de su familia y colocar su granito de arena para lograr su bienestar. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más de sus productos Herbalife para distribuirlos a más personas y así lograr mejores ganancias.  En el futuro Don Fabián quiere subir en la escala de esta compañía, para lograr mejores ingresos económicos y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Fabián is 44-years-old, single, and lives in his sister's house with her family. He is a very charismatic man, and this has helped him in his business of selling Herbalife products (nutritional products) when he has to convince people to purchase his products. Until now it has gone very well for Don Fabián, as he has made a good income. He dedicates a large part of his time to his work, but he doesn't have a fixed schedule since he works by taking orders.

Don Fabián wants to help with his family's expenses and do his part to achieve their well-being. With the money from this loan, he will purchase more Herbalife products to distribute to more people and therefore obtain more products. In the future, Don Fabián wants to increase the scale of this company to obtain more income and to secure his retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of the products he sells

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente con su esposo y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de su suegra. Hace tres años puso un locutorio de llamadas telefónicas en servicio de la comunidad, en vista que por su barrio no había ese tipo de servicio. Años anteriores trabajaba en el cafetín de una escuela, pero dice que el locutorio le es más rentable y le permite estar en casa para cuidar  a sus hijos menores. Su deseo es  incrementar más cabinas, para así poder generarse más ingresos, ella muestra gratitud por haberle facilitado ese préstamo y hacer realidad su sueño de crecer. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va incrementar más cabinas para su negocio y generarse mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rocio is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and son in her mother-in-law's house. Three years ago, she created a "telephone shop" ** to serve her community, because before, her neighborhood did not have this type of service available. In years past, Rocio worked in a school cafeteria, but she says that the phone shop is more profitable, and it allows her to stay at home and care for her child. She wants to add more telephone booths to increase her revenue, and so she is grateful for this loan and the ability to realize her dream. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested loan, she will add more phone booths to her business and increase her revenues. ** Translator's note: A "locutorio" is a "telephone shop," and it appears to be a place filled with telephone booths, sometimes offering cheaper calling rates than are available by other means.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add booths to her phone shop

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
The married father of two children who are presently in school as well as a renowned photographer with 10 years of experience, 31-year-old Solomon B. is a very dynamic, innovative, and hardworking young man who attends to his work with professionalism and customer care.

Solomon takes pictures in a wide variety of settings, going to places such as churches, wedding programs, etc. in order to solicit business. He says photography is a lucrative activity that he very much enjoys doing. Because digital photography has become so popular, Solomon is requesting a loan to purchase a digital camera, batteries, photo printer etc. He believes this will help him to remain in business and expand his clientele. In the future he plans to open a photo studio so that potential customers will be able to locate him easily.

Solomon is part of the ‘Holiness’ Trust group, whose members agree to guarantee each others’ loans.

loans.use: To buy camera film, tents, a digital camera and a photo printer.

loans.name: Pras

texts.en: Pras S. is a 27-year-old grocery vendor in Siem Reap province. She earns US$ 4/day selling various kinds items and lives with her 30-year-old husband and their 2 children.
