Maximiana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximiana is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the first loan taken out by Maximiana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly K. is a mother of 13 children who are all adults. She is a dairy farmer in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for 20 years now. She sells her milk through Brookside Company in Litein town. She also earns income from the sale of tea and vegetables to the local market.

Her biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough funds to expand her farming.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. Selly is a hardworking farmer and would like to improve her dairy farming in the future by acquiring high-yielding dairy cows and building a modern dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sea

texts.en: Sea L., 42, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. L. and her husband sell rice and raise pigs, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 98 USD on food and 23 USD on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more rice and pigs to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more rice and pigs to expand the current business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr M. labora como agente de seguridad   es  acompañado, tiene tres hijos  a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar  cerámica, porcelana, boom y mano de obra, para  su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. M. works as a security guard.  He has a partner and has 3 dependent children.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he appreciates the support that they are providing him.  With this loan he will buy ceramic tiles, Boom (fast curing expanding foam used in construction), and labor to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La Sra. Teolith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto y Provincia de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 57 años y cuenta con estudios superiores en Costura, Corte y Confección.
Es madre de 02 hijos, ambos independientes.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante, Teolith emprendió su negocio de Costura,  poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con  clientela que a diario acuden a su casa a pedirle sus servicio, nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones de vestir y mucho más, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser, alfileres, y botones; así como también, invertirá en la compra de repuesto y mantenimiento de sus máquinas.
Teolith sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Teolith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II) in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 57 years old, married, and has received higher education in sewing and dressmaking. Teolith is the mother of two children, both of whom are independent.

Due to her efforts and desire to succeed, Teolith started a sewing business. She gradually became well-known and now has customers who come by her house to request her services. Teolith says she receives enough work during the school year, but she also produces suits for women, men, and children, trousers, and other types of garments. Her business is located in her home.

With this loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, sewing implements such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, needles, pins, and buttons. Teolith will also invest in the repair and maintenance of her machines. She dreams of having her own shop for her business.

Teolith feels like she is an accomplished woman and has great desire to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity she always wanted and helping other women who want to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies and pay for repair and maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Jhimmy Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhimmy; él tiene 34 años de edad y es separado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de fotocopiadora, su negocio se encuentra ubicado al frente de la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio abad del Cusco, el cual lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio él trabaja de lunes a sábado por las mañanas, a la vez el socio es profesor de música el cual trabaja en las fiestas patronales, cargos y compromisos , el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su fotocopiadora y para comprar algunos accesorios que le faltan.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Jhimmy, 34, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

He is separated and has a son.  He alternates his daily activities with a photocopy services business.  His business is located across from the San Antonio Abad del Cusco National University.  He’s been in business for quite some time now and is open mornings from Monday through Saturday.  At the same time, he’s a music teacher and works during patron saint festival days or on commission.  He is a cheerful and responsible person.

He needs the loan to service his photocopier and to buy some accessories he needs.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to service his photocopier and to buy some accessories he needs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 56 years old, married and with four children. He sells cereals to earn a living. Besides that, he sells doughnuts so as to boost his income. He also earns more income from employment. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of business growth. He sees himself expanding his business into wholesale in the future. He hopes to own rental houses in the future. He wants 50, 000 Kes to buy maize, beans and peas.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp, Ghada is a mother of one daughter, Ghada's husband Suhail is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns $330 per month. Ghada and her husband have very simple furniture, as their resources do not allow them to buy all the items they need, but since they have a daughter who is growing up, Ghada took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughter and fix the room they have by painting and installing windows in the room.

Ghada's husband Suhail appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman as are most of the Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture and fix one of the rooms in the house

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 9 years. She is 50 years old, married to Peter Nganga and they have three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for her daughters.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to pay her daughters' school fees.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 5 years, she has had a café business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she also has a real estate house which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business. 

With the KES 80,000, she wants to purchase and build a rental house, purchase 3 sacks of cement, 5 sacks of sand and stones. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase build rental house, purchase 3 sacks of cement, 5 sacks of sand and stones.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 35 years old and married, with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Suzette has been running a general store in the Philippines for 8 years. She also earns an income from pig fattening, buying and selling frozen products and farming rice.

Suzette has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. Suzette hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Otelia

texts.en:
Otelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and candies, which she has run for five years. 

Otelia has requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more products to sell in her store.

Otelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Otelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages.

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has eight children and seven go to school, 

She is currently in the business of selling dried fish. Now she wants to purchase more fish to sell.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin, who is in his early 60s, is married with 10 children and 8 grandchildren. Some of them go to school. He has a musical instruments studio, which he rents during celebrations e.g. weddings, send-off parties, etc. He has had this business for seven years now.  He normA. works at night from 8 p.m. up to the end of the function.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to service his music system for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy new CDs, pins and cables to maintain the system for better performance. His dream is to have a very big and international studio.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Royal", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy new CDs, pins and cables

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wenceslao; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, el socio junto con su esposa tienen el negocio de venta de ropa donde venden blusas, polos y pantalones y el socio también se dedica al negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de taxi desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo de transporte y negocio de venta de ropa el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y también mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos y también para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos para el carro.
                                               
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MANOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and department.

This member is Sr. Wenceslao, who is 32 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities between his business buying and selling clothes, which he runs with his wife and where they sell blouses, polo shirts and pants, and his transportation business: he offers taxi services from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. Through his work as a taxi driver and his business selling clothes, Sr. Wenceslao is helping his children get ahead. He wants to expand his taxi service and also his business buying and selling clothes. He requests a loan to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts and also to maintain his car through the purchase of needed spare parts.

Sr. Wenceslao is happy about the loan and is committed to making his loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts and also to maintain his car through the purchase of needed spare parts..

loans.name: Melinda Talisic Group

texts.en:
Melinda sells soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc., to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She is married with three children. Melinda is 39 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Each month, she earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.  In the future, Melinda hopes to have a bigger store with more sales. 

Melinda has been a member of PMPC for five months.She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia María; tiene 32 años de edad,  la socia es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 10, 9, 5 años de edad: la socia compra y vende productos ardiss los cuales compra de las mismas tiendas de venta permitida y los entrega a sus respectivos clientes, la socia vende estos productos naturales  para la salud y también se dedica  a la venta de  prendas de vestir, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos y ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios ella comprara productos de salud natural y prendas de vestir para damas, a caballeros y niños los cuales los vende de forma independiente a sus amistades.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Fuente de Vida" communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Maria is 32, single, and has 4 children ages 14, 10, 9 and 5. She buys and sells Ardiss products from authorized distributors and provides them to her customers. She sells these natural health products and also sells clothing. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of products and clothing. She is requesting this loan to invest in her businesses. She will purchase natural health products and items of clothing for women, men and children, which she sells independently to her friends.

She is grateful for the support that you are offering and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in her businesses. She will purchase natural health products and items of clothing for women, men and children to sell independently to her friends.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is 44 years old, married and has seven children aged between 3 and 18 living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a business of hides and skin and also trades in produce. He has been doing these businesses for 20 years and this has enabled him to buy land and a motorcycle. He hopes his business will improve in the future and will be able to generate more income. Rashid needs a loan to buy maize, hides and skin for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, hides and skin for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo que tiene desde hace 1 año, en una maquiladora desempeñando el oficio de operador. Hace ya mas de 3 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual necesita construir una barda al frente para que esta mejor protegida; de algún delincuente que quiera robar alguna pertenencia de Carlos que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido comprando. Para poder realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material para iniciar la construcción y pagarle a la persona  mano de obra, todo para que el tenga mas tranquilidad al irse a su trabajo y dejar a su madre sin cuidado de que le pase algo.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Arturo is a very responsible person who has been working for a year as a factory operator.  More than three years ago he acquired his subsidized house which is in need of a fence for greater protection against theft on the property that Carlos has worked hard to obtain.  In order to carry out his project he needs to buy material be begin construction and hire workers.  All of this is so he can go off to work and not have to worry about anything happening to his mother.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and rods, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 28 and married, with 2 children between the ages of  6 and 2.  She has 5 years experience in farming and currently employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk, maize and beans for the local markets.
 
Concepter has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and expand her dairy farm business.This is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.  She aspires to have five dairy cows and give her family better living standards.

She sees high costs of animal diseases during dry seasons as the major challenge

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells fried fish in Takoradi. She has five children. Her husband is a security man. She has been frying fish for sale for ten years now. As part of her responsibilities she pays utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional income she will earn as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
This is Simeona; she is 61 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to five children. All of her children already have their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Simeona operates an ornamental plant business. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and orchids. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the community. She's been in this business for five years, earning a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will be use the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, plastics, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Simeona hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
Judit se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora en y tambien esta vendiendo pasamaneria como escobillas,espejos,botones,agujas entre otros productos junto a su hija,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de pasamaneria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar botones,agujas,hilos y espejos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Judit is still working as a teacher and still selling notions like brushes, mirrors, buttons and needles among other items with her daughter.  She supports her children through these businesses and she wants to expand the business so is asking for a loan to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35 year old business man, who lives in Juba.  He is married and has three children between the ages of 17 and 10.  All of them go to school. 

Joseph runs a bar business, and he has been in the business for 5 years.  He has one employee.
Peter heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion and marketing done by the loans officers.  He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.  Joseph has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Joseph would like to increase the size of the business.

His major challenges include home expenses and a low income rate.

Joseph says that he is happy to see MFI's operating in South Sudan and helping them with loans, which means the country is developing.

loans.use: to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, tiene un puesto de ventas de artículos de cristal, como ser vasos, jarras, jarrones. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital, comprar más mercadería y aprovechar las ventas de navidad. Maria  es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona 16  de Julio  de la Ciudad de El Alto. La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, que llegan a cinco, completamente pagados, ya que le ayudo a incrementar su capital y así tener mayores ingresos para la sustento de su familia . Es la tercera vez que su solicitud se canaliza hacia  Kiva.
texts.en: María has a stand where she sells crystal items like glasses, jars and jugs.  She needs the loan to increase capital and to buy more merchandise to take advantage of Christmas sales.  María is married and has four children.  She lives in her in-laws’ house which is located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.  She is very satisfied with the loans she’s gotten previously, which number five, completely repaid and which helped her increase capital to earn higher income for her family’s support.  This is the third time her request has been channeled toward Kiva.

loans.use: to buy glassware to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PARAISO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teodora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida rápida, ferretería de herramientas, tejidos de mantas, hilado de lana de vicuña, tejido de mantas, venta de coca, comercio de ají y otros.

La señora Agustina,  indica que hace un año trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de vent5a de ají y otros que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ají) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The El Paraiso Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. There are eight members in the group led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teodora. The members have a variety of businesses such as selling fast food, running a hardware store, weaving blankets, spinning yarn from vicuna wool, selling coca leaves, and selling chili peppers.

Sra. Agustina began working with Pro Mujer a year ago. She joined the institution at the invitation of another member. Currently she runs a business selling chili peppers as well as other businesses she has had for several years. 

The loan she is seeking is for working capital so that she can buy more chilis from la Ceja which she will then sell in various markets. The income from her business enables her to support her family; she lives with her partner and their two children. Agustina tells us that she most enjoys the service provided by and the meetings organised by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy chilis

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 31 years old and married with two children who are three and nine years old. He owns a butchery. He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed four people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy his own cows. He hopes to buy a plot and expand his butchery shop in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Heisell Maria

texts.es: Heisell de 25 años de edad es casada, trabaja como responsable de sucursal de la Cruz Lorena. Solicita su 4to   crèdito para comprar material didactico y para pagar mensualidad de ella y de su esposo en la Universidad URACCAN, ademas desea ayudar a su hermana con los gastos de bachillerato. Esta joven pareja  ha sido muy responsable y bien trabajadores,han luchado juntos para obtener su propia vivienda. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su esposo encuentre trabajo ya que ha quedado desempleado, culminar sus estudios universitarios y gozar de salud y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Heisell, 25, is married and manages a Cruz Lorena branch office.  She’s asking for her 4th loan to buy school supplies and to pay her and her husband’s tuition at URACCAN University; she also wants to help with her sister’s high school costs.

This young couple has been very responsible and hardworking; they have striven together to obtain their own house.  Her greatest dream in life is that her husband finds employment since he is currently unemployed, to finish her university training, to enjoy good health and that her family stays together.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Yomar Alonso

texts.es:
Yomar es un joven de 24 años que aprendió la actividad de la venta de CD desde los 14 años de edad. Debido a que no proviene de una familia con grandes recursos económicos, Yomar ha tenido que trabajar para poder aportar a los ingresos del hogar y últimamente lo ha hecho con el ánimo de poder pagar sus estudios universitarios. Yomar ha trabajado en la calle durante todo este tiempo y ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, pues ha visto en varias ocasiones como su mercancía se le han decomisado por estar situado en lugares donde no es permitido comercializar. Yomar espera que estos problemas se resuelvan y espera seguir trabajando para pagar sus estudios universitarios. Yomar, con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad de CD’s que ofrece a sus clientes, espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de CD’s para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de sus productos.

Yomar espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá ofrecer productos que antes no tenía. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos pueda pagar su universidad y aportar a su hogar para contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yomar is a young 24-year-old who learned the CD retail business from the age of 14. Since he doesn't come from a family with a lot of financial resources, Yomar has had to work in order to be able to support his household with income, and lately he has worked in hopes of being able to pay his university studies. Yomar has worked on the street this entire time, and has had to face much adversity in his life, since he has had his merchandise confiscated several times for being situated in places where selling is not permitted. Yomar hopes that these problems may be resolved and hopes to continue working in order to pay for his university-level studies. Yomar, in order to increase the variety of CDs he has to offer his customers, hopes that a loan will give him the ability to purchase a greater variety of CDs to sell to his customers. 

Yomar hopes that in this way his income will grow considerably, since he will be able to offer products he previously did not have. Furthermore, he hopes that with greater income he will be able to pay for his studies at the university and support his household in order to contribute to a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase CDs so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Unidos, Plaridel. Fenie has a services business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Fenie is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services.  Fenie has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services

loans.name: Dieu Est Roi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST ROI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans la même association. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Silikatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Silikatou n’a pas fréquentée l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis treize ans dans son quartier. Colette est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Colette est mariée à un dépanneur du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Colette vend depuis treize ans des produits pharmaceutiques et cosmétiques. Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Colette ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST ROI, sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et pharmacetiques.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  is a widow woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasreen  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to install electricity in her compound

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charity would like to buy different varieties of bead materials for her beadwork business.

loans.name: No

texts.en: Miss K. No is 27, and her husband is 37 years old. They have two children between the ages of 11 and 5 who are going to school. They have only a hut, and they don’t have any land for cultivation. Miss K. No suffers from stomach ache, sinusitis, kidney stones, and a femaL. disease. In addition, she suffers from nebula, so she only does housework. Mr. Giang, her husband, is a sculptor. Before, they had to borrow a loan with 6% interest/month from money lenders. Their income increased by about $2/person/month from a loan from the project. Average income is now about $8.5/person/month. Now, he wants to borrow a loan of $75 so that he can buy a larger amount of wood by cash, which is cheaper.

loans.use: Buy a larger amount of wood

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh and her husband are separated. She brings her three children to her own mother’s house to be cared for while she sells fruit and soft drinks. Xinh's children are in school ( 8th, 6th, and 4th class). Her oldest daughter suffers from epilepsy. Their average income per person per month is $ 11.

Xinh wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her micro-business. She plans to pay it back over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: expand her micro-business

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun S. (51) and her husband (52, pictured here) live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their four children. The family have several sources of income, and like most families in Cambodia, they pool all their earnings. Yun S.'s husband earns $1 a day transporting passengers by horse and cart. Two of her children work at a garment factory, earning $50 a month each, whilst the other two are students.

Yun S. herself earns $2 a day selling vegetables which she grows on the family's land. She intends to use the loan to purchase a water pumping machine to irrigate the land and increase the amount of vegetables she is able to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a water-pumping machine

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
I have cement flooring in my house and would like to install tile flooring because it is easier to clean and is more hygenic for my family. I also need to plaster my walls to protect us in cold weather. I am asking for a loan of $700.00 to install flooring and plaster the walls in my house.

“Tengo piso de cemento en mi casa y me gustaría poner vitropiso ya que se puede limpiar mejor y es mas higiénico para mi familia, también necesito enjarrar las paredes para protegernos en tiempo de frío”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la poner el vitropiso en mi casa y enjarrar las paredes.

loans.use: To put in flooring and plaster the walls

loans.name: Makhadlatif

texts.en: Makhadlatif L. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005 and business stability allows him to increase the loan sum.  He is engages in the Oshkhona business (the national culinary). He prepares different kind of national courses using old traditional recipes. Having the Oshkhona he dreams to build a Chaikhona (from the old times, the resting place where you may try the national tea and culinary).Mr. Makhadlatif L. requests a loan a US$450 to expand the existing business wideness and develop the new one.

loans.use: To expand existing business and build new one.

loans.name: Maria Dina

texts.es:
Maria Dina is a founding partner of Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas (Communal Bank for Creative Women) and dedicated to the sale of diverse kinds of vegetables and citrus fruits wholesale and retail at a post she has in a local market in Moyobamba, in the San Martín region for Peru. She decided to start this business because she needed to earn an income and grow as a person and a woman and support her household economically.

With the $875 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase bags of cilantro, onion, corn, squash, peas, yucca, cabbage, carrots, lettuce, tomatoes and lemons, as well as other fresh produce of high quality to satisfy her clientele.

Maria is 54 years old and has three children, all who live with her and help her with the business and at home. She is content with what she does because she sells at a place where a lot of people gather and she can be in contact with friends and other people, so she enjoys her work. Her goal is to run a convenience store out of her home so she can take care of her business and her home at the same time and not neglect her household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Dina es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica a la venta de verduras en sus diversas variedades y limones al por mayor y menor en el puesto que tiene en el mercado de abastos del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Decidió iniciarse en este negocio porque tenía la necesidad de trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer y aportar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará sacos de culantro, cebolla china, choclos, zapallos, alverjas, yuca, repollo, zanahoria, lechuga, tomates y limones además de otros productos frescos y de buena calidad para atender a su basta clientela. Tiene 54 años y 3 hijos que aún viven con ella y son quienes la apoyan en el negocio y la casa. Está contenta con lo que hace porque vende en un lugar donde acude bastante gente y puede estar en contacto con las personas y sus amistades, por eso disfruta de su trabajo. Su meta es tener un negocio en su casa de venta de abarrotes para poder compartir las actividades de la casa con su negocio y sobre todo no descuidar su casa.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables (cilantro, onion, corn, peas, squash, yucca, etc.)

loans.name: Tweyambe C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sylvia B.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Sylvia is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 5 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Sylvia makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Sylvia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to expand business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sylvia is joined in her small group by Fida N., Melda B., Jennifer N., and Aliya N.. Fida N. has a business in Jennifer Nabatanzi and wants to grocery store. Melda B. is currently operating a business in hotel and wants a loan to add in business. Jennifer N. operates a business of retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge. Aliya N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to start a new business.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Freddy is 28 years old and lives with his wife in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood. This young couple does not have any children yet, as they have to establish themselves economically in order to then support their family. Freddy is the only income earner in the home, he works as a production worker in the free trade zone in Mercedes, so his wife is dependent on him. As fruit of his hard work, this young man has been improving the infrastructure of the humble home he shares with his wife. By financing, he has been able to build his home, which still isn’t complete. He still has to finish the back wall that leads to the patio of his small home, which he hasn’t been able to finish due to lack of capital. Therefore he is asking for a loan to finish enclosing his home by completing the back wall, providing a safe and secure home to live in so when they decide to have a family, his wife wouldn’t be able to work for fear of leaving their small home empty and returning to find themselves without their belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Freddy tiene 28 años habita con su esposa en el barrio 31 de Diciembre, esta joven pareja todavía no cuentan con hijos, ya que tienen que establecerse económicamente para después formar una familia. Freddy es el único proveedor de la casa, trabaja como operario de una zona franca en las Mercedes, por lo tanto su esposa depende de él. Fruto de su trabajo, es como el joven ha ido mejorando la infraestructura de la humilde vivienda donde habita con su esposa. Por medio de financiamiento es como ha ido levantando la estructura física de su vivienda, la cual todavía no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, ya que le falta terminar de levantar el muro de atrás que da con el patio de su pequeña vivienda, el cual no ha podido cerrarlo por completo por la falta de capital. Es por eso que él solicita un préstamo para sellar su vivienda, la cual desea que se encuentre segura de habitar y segura para cuando su decidan tener familia actualmente no podría trabajar su esposa por temor a dejar sola su casita y encontrarla sin sus pertenencias.

loans.use: Purchase blocks, cement, sand and steel to finish the back wall of his home

loans.name: Sikia

texts.en:
Sikia is 30 years old and is single. She takes care of 3 people, ages 52, 16, and 12. Sikia is a cereals seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy is adept and skillful at repairing and selling photocopiers. Thanks to the connections he has made over many years, his repair services are in high demand in the cities of Juliaca, Aqyaviri and Puno. Percy is originally from the department (state) of Arequipa, but he moved to Juliaca for the greater employment opportunities there. In Juliaca he decided to rent a space and open a small company called Copier Computer Services SRL* with the goal of providing repair services and selling photocopiers. Percy would like to increase his investment capital to improve his revenues.

* Sociedad de Responsabilidad Limitada (SRL) is equivalent to Limited Liability Corporation (LLC)

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Percy, es muy ágil y hábil para la reparación y venta de máquinas fotocopiadoras, gracias a los conocimientos que adquirió durante muchos años es que sus servicios de reparación están siendo muy solicitados en la ciudad de Juliaca, Ayaviri y Puno.Percy es natural del departamento de Arequipa, pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde decidió alquilar un establecimiento para abrir su pequeña empresa denominada “Copier Computer Service S.R.L” con el fin de brindar sus servicios de reparación y ofrecer sus máquinas fotocopiadoras, el deseo de Percy es aumentar el monto de su capital, él considera que haciendo tal inversión mejorarán sus ingresos.

loans.use: Additional capital for improving his business

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mr. Von V. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Sambath Nhem, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs. Sambath Nhem's business is doing well, so she wants to expand it. Mr. Von V. is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his wife's grocery business. Mr. Von V. and his wife have a child who is a garment worker.

loans.use: To buy more stock for grocery store

loans.name: Chanbunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chanbunthoeun N., 32,  and his family live in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  Chanbunthoeun and his wife, Mrs. Chinda Dok, 27, have been married since 2001 and have one daughter.

Mr. Chanbunthoeun has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for seven years. His wife is a garment factory worker. Phnom Penh may well be one of the world’s largest cities, but it doesn't have even one municipal bus.  Motorbike taxis and tuk-tuks, with the rare exception of an automobile taxi, are only way to get around.  On a good day, Chanbunthoeun can make about 25,000 Riel (US) $6.  

He is requesting a loan of US$1000 to fill up the ground around his house and lift it higher so his family can keep dry during the rainy season.

loans.use: To fill up the ground and lift his house higher

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Born circa 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Louise K. is married to Mr. Barthélémy HOUSSOU and the mother of three children she has to support. She's a trained seamstress and has a sewing workshop in which she sells sewing sundries. Mrs. K. specializes in sewing women's clothing. She's very well regarded by her customers and she faces an increasing demand that she has problems meeting. To safeguard the trust reposed in her by her customers and to meet their demands, she's seeking this loan of $250.00 (100000.00 XOF) to increase her stock of sewing sundries.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1973 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame K. Louise est mariée à monsieur HOUSSOU Barthélémy et mère de 3 enfants tous à charge. Elle est Couturière de profession disposant d'un salon de couture dans lequel elle vend des articles de mercerie. Dame K. Louise est spécialisée dans la confection des tenues dames. Très appréciée par sa clientèle, elle reçoit de plus en plus une forte demande ce qui justifie les difficultés qu'elle éprouve actuellement à satisfaire sa clientèle. Dans le but de préserver la confiance que sa clientèle a placé en elle et de satisfaire à leur demande, elle sollicite ce prêt de 100 000 francs qui va aussi l'aider à augmenter son stock de produits de mercerie.

loans.use: To buy 2 rolls of fabric, 10 small rolls of trim and 3 boxes of sewing thread

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Lê Thị Xuân(Ms 23070055), sinh năm 1964, tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi. Chồng cô làm công nhân có lương ổn định theo tháng, hai con cô đã lớn và đi làm. Do đó thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ / tháng.Trong nhóm vay còn có:
Nguyễn Thị Đông(Ms 23070059), sinh năm 1974, tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để mua bò về nuôi.
Đào Thị Loan(MS 23070056), sinh năm 1964, tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đi chợ cá.
Đào Thị Thanh(Ms 23070058), sinh năm 1970, tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi cá, gà.
Lê Thị Thu(Ms 23070057), sinh năm 1963, tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà, vịt.
texts.en:
Lê Thị Xuân (Ms 23070055), born in 1964, participated in a 4,028,000 VND loan to rear livestock. Her husband is a police man with a steady monthly salary. Her two children are grown and employed. From all this, the family's average income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. The other group members are: Nguyễn Thị Đông (Ms 23070059), born in 1974, participated in a 4,028,000 VND loan to purchase cattL. to raise. Đào Thị Loan (Ms 23070056), born in 1964, participated in a 4,028,000 VND loan to sell fish. Đào Thị Thanh (Ms 23070058), born in 1970, participated in a 4,028,000 VND loan to raise fish and chicken. Lê Thị Thu (Ms 23070057), born in 1963, participated in a 4,028,000 VND loan to raise poultry (duck and chicken).

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise livestock.

loans.name: Guilherme Filimone

texts.pt:
Guilherme Filimone M. natural de Boane um dos distrito da província de Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade é casado maritalmente e pai de dois filhos, o primeiro com 6 anos e o segundo com 1 ano de idades respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Guilherme estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, nasceu na vila sede do distrito de Boane e neste momente vive a 25 km desta vila, tendo se mudado quando foi contratado pela empresa de gestão da barragem dos pequenos libombos e lá se casou.

Trabalhador dos pequenos libombos a 12 anos como observador na barragem, ainda nao tem casa própria vive na casa dos serviços, para Guilherme este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva e nunca teve noutras instituições. Constitui sonho para Guilherme abrir um negocio qual consistira na vende de produtos de primeira necessidade e diz conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Guilherme Filimone M. was born in Boane, one of the districts in the province of Maputo. He is 32 years old, married, and father of two children – a six-year-old and a one-yea-old. He only provides for his family. Guilherme studied up to the 12th grade and then stopped due to lack of funds. He was born in the main village of the Boane district, and now lives 25 km from that village. He moved away when he was hired by the dam management company on the small “libombos.” He also got married there. Guilherme has worked on the small “libombos” for 12 years as an observer on the dam. He does not yet have his own house, so he lives in a house on the work site. This is Guilherme’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, and he has never taken out a loan before with any other institution. It is his dream to open a small business selling basic goods with this credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. sells buttons, lining, pans and other sewing materials at Zion Park in Cape Coast. Celestina has received junior high education.  She is married and has 4 dependants and her husband is a salesman. Celestina has been selling buttons, linings and other sewing materials since 1999. She is responsible for meeting the financial needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support in her children's education and also save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials and other goods of high demand for sale.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Суфанкулов Ахмадджон житель города  Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. анимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует на рынке продуктами питания.Этому бизнесу уже 3 года.  Имеет столик . Хочет увеличить торговую точку и товарооборот. Для этого он решил получить кредит . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon S. lives in Vahdat. He is 45, married, and has three children. He works in sales. He sells food in the market. He has been doing this business for three years. He has a little stand. He wants a bigger shop and more sales. To get this, he has decided to take out a loan. He can pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Gbojouma

texts.fr:
Cette jeune demoiselle de 21 ans est très travailleuse et dynamique, elle réside dans le quartier hedzranawoè à Lomé au Togo. A ce jeune âge elle a déjà entamée son propre commerce qui n’est autre que la vente de tissus et de lins qui est très confectionné et utilisé dans la couture au Togo, elle exerce ce commerce de façon ambulante. La demande de tissus est très élevée en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Elle approvisionne son stock au grand marché de Lomé, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.
Gbodjonu est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
This young lady of 21 is very hard-working and dynamic. She lives in the Hedzranawoè neighborhood in Lomé, Togo. At this young age, she has already set herself up in business, selling fabrics and linens, which are much used in sewing clothing in Togo. She sells her wares as an ambulant sales person. The demand for fabrics is very high during this period of end-of-year festivities. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market in Lomé, and she began her business in 2007.

Gbojouma is single and is supporting herself and one other person.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics and linen

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., age 34, lives with her niece and has a business selling grocery products from her home. She earns, on average, US $3 a day. Chea S. is single and lives in Battambang province. She would like to use this loan to increase her supply of grocery products to meet her client’s demands.

loans.use: To increase her supply of grocery products.

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
Nosir E. is a young, married man who breeds calves, in the small village of Spitamen, in the region of Sugd.  Nosir is young, but full of energy. He works each day to improve the life of his family. Nosir started in this cattle business a year ago. He has continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Nosir has great experience in cattle breeding because he has observed it since his childhood. 

Nosir would like to expand his business by purchasing more calves. This would help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su madre que es una persona de la tercera edad; viven en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de llantas para su movilidad para seguir trabajando.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado por Rolando.
texts.en:
Rolando works as a rickshaw driver transporting passengers. He has an inter-city service in La Paz El Alto. This is his main source of income, with which he covers the cost of caring for his mother, who is elderly. They live in a rented house located in the zone of Rio Seco in the city of La Paz. The credit will go towards purchasing tires for his vehicle so he can keep working. This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation performed qualifies him so he can receive his requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his transportation service

loans.name: Monica Mariela

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Monica es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Monica se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del colegio Virgen del Carmen, también prepara bocaditos que vende ahí mismo, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Monica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas, aceite, sal.
Los sueños de Monica son tener casa propia,
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the Communal Bank Florecer. Monica is 23 years old, lives with her spouse, and has one child. Monica sells candy from a cart every day outside the gates of the Virgen del Carmen school. She also makes snacks that she sells there. Monica needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy candy, oil, and salt. Monica hopes to have her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, oil, and salt

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalina B., 63 years old, is married and lives at Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She has four children. Her husband is a farmer.

At her age, she really wanted to help her husband, that’s why she opened a “sari-sari” (general) store to provide additional income. This will help in the daily consumption of her family. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative and became a member in February 2006. She's thankful to this co-op, because she was able to send her children to school and was able to finance their farm. Aside from that, she learned the value of savings.

Today, she applies for PHP 14,900 to buy additional goods for sale. She hopes that throughout the years, their family will live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es: El Señor Jorge Emilio A. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Jorge es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que dio inicio con pocos productos, y con los pocos ingresos que obtuvo de su antiguo trabajo logro establecerse en su vivienda, y con los financiamientos recibidos ha realizado las mejoras a su negocio. Don Jorge es un Hombre muy amable y trabajador es por esto que el propósito de Jorge para su negocio es aumentar cada di en sus ventas garantizándoles a sus clientes sus productos. Con el dinero que solicita compraría más productos necesarios para su pulpería como granos básicos, golosinas, jabón, sal y otros productos. El mayor sueño de Juan es incrementar al máximo su negocio con los productos necesarios y predominar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge Emilio A. R. is 49-years-old and married. He has owned a small grocery store for more than 5 years. He started with few products, and with the little income he made from his old job, he was able to start his business in his home. With the financing he has received, he has been able to make improvements to his business. Don Jorge is a very friendly and hard-working man, and this is why his goal is to expand his sales every day and guarantee his products to his customers. With the money he is requesting, he will buy more products that he needs for his store like basic grains, candy, soap, etc. His biggest dream is to expand his business as much as he can with the products he needs to ensure his clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Savriya

texts.ru: Косимова Саврия проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 53 года, замужем и меет 5 детей. Саврия имеет торговую точку на рынке "Корвон". Она продает женскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается вместе с сыном. Бизнес существует более 25 лет. Еще один сын в России на заработках. Муж занимается земледелием. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит чтобы звкупить новую одежду.
texts.en:
Savriya K. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 53 years old, is married and has 5 children. Savriya has a sales location at the “Korvon” market. She sells women’s clothing. She works in this business with her son. The business has existed for more than 25 years. Another son is in Russia earning money. Her husband works in agriculture. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase new clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Ulloa 1 Group

texts.en:
Tomasina has been with Esperanza for almost four years now and has proven to be very faithful with her attendance and repayments. Tomasina has a small store named Colmado Orquídea where she sells fruits and vegetables as well as basic household products. Tomasina is a mother of four and hopes that one day her store will reach a big enough size that the profits would be able to sustain her family. 

Please help Tomasina increase the size of her business.  Thank you.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables and other items for a family run grocery store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
When Analyn B. bought a rice farm, she was confronted with big challenges in running the business: insufficient funds to run the business, more expenses at home and more priorities in their home. She always dreamed of having a sustainable business for her family, a business where she could realize the plans she has for her children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase a quart of Nominee herbicide and three sacks of Ammosul for fertilizing. The loan will truly help her increase their yield.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and three sacks of Ammosul

loans.name: Simona Dominga

texts.es: Simona Dominga O. tiene la edad de 43años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y ademas elaboracion y venta. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Simona inicio este medio de vida, por su Mama ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a este oficio, y fue con el paso del tiempo que adquirió conocimiento, y decide mantenerlo. Simona es una muy buena mujer ha tenido varios prestamos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que han sido de gran ayuda para su vida. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Simona Dominga O. is 43 years of age, she is a single mother. She has two children under her care. Her economic activity is the butchering, preparing and selling of pork. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years. Simona got started in this business through her mother who had been working as a butcher, along the way Simona acquired knowledge about the business and decided to keep this profession. Simona is a very good woman who has had many loans from Fundación León 2000, which have been a great help in her life. The money she requests is for working capital to buy raw material. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Алибой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Абдурахимов Алибой – мужчина 42 лет , женат имеет пятерых детей. Алибой имеет высшее образование, сейчас работает в колхозе «Урунходжаева» заведующим фермой.
Его заработная плата хватает на минимальное проживание, поэтому уже много лет как Алибой занимается бизнесом животноводства. Он в сезон дешёвого скота закупает несколько десятков голов скота и откормив их продаёт за хорошую цену. Алибой хочет на полученный кредит закупить несколько коров и бычка. Алибой хорошо разбирается в породистых быках.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Mr. Teofilo is 43 years old and has been married to Mrs. Antonia Ramona Benitez for more than 14 years, together they have two children, one is 10 years old and the other is 20 years old and is in his second year at a Business Institute en the area. 
Mr. Teofilo is a native of the city of Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz, he began to work at a young age with his father making agricultural products, which they took to sell in the local markets. 
More than  8 years ago Mr. Teofilo began working independently because his father could no longer work due to his age.  Thanks to his strength and his work he made the money and was able to buy a small truck to distribute the merchandise in other cities.  
He is applying for this loan to buy merchandise (tomatoes, onions, carrots, milk, fruits, and others)

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, milk, fruits, and others.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth P. N. reside en Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Ana tiene 40 años de edad,  vive con sus padres para estar cerca de ellos y cuidarlos por ser adultos mayores. Ana posee una tienda en su casa con la cual logra obtener ingresos necesarios para ella y las necesidades de sus padres , el crédito que solita Ana es para comprar productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth P. N. lives in Colon in the La Libertad department. Ana is 40. She lives with her parents to be near them and to take care of them because they are elderly. Ana has a store in her house, which gives her the necessary income for herself and her parents. The loan that Ana is asking for is to buy products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian W. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, groundnut phase etc and is requesting a loan to stock more cooking oil to sell. 

 Lilian is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy F. is now 30 years old. She is now happily married to Alfredo F. who is now 34 years old the father of her two beautiful daughter Antonette 12 years old now studying as first year high school and Anjanette now in grade 6 at the age of 10. Amy’s husband is now work as a fisherman so one source of their income is come from fishing, and aside from that she run a variety store business that also give them extra income for their daily expenses. But Amy does not stop there, because she has a talent in sewing different kinds of clothes she decided to start a business which is sewing business.
 
Now in the 5th times of making loan in Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she will use this loan in buying things needed in her sewing business like sewing machine, some oil for the machine and different color of threads. She was sure it will help her business to be more productive also with the effort she will exert in sewing all kinds of dress.   

Amy has a full determination that her businesses will grow to the point that it will give them enough income for all their expenses including expenses in schooling of her 2 children. Now one of her dreams is to have a car that she was sure can really help them for their business. She will work hard for it to make it possible.

loans.use: Will be used as additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya N., 34, is single and lives with her family in Sa Ang, Cambodia. In total there are three members of her family, and N. has to take care of her elderly father. To make a living, N. runs a business designing and sewing clothes for people in her village. She is able to earn approximately $8 USD per day in revenue.

N.'s family is assisted by her younger sister who works as a hairdresser, earning an income of $6 USD per day. N. is seeking to improve her standard of living and expand her business during this economically difficult time. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more fabrics for designing clothes to meet customer demand. She hopes that her future business plan will be successful so that she is able to generate more income for household use.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Guljan, is forty-six years old. She has one child and her husband works as a security guard in the Chui electric power plant. He gave Guljan freedom of choice to choose between working and staying at home and Guljan chose to work. Her relatives advised her to engage in farming. Guljan managed to obtain a three-hectare (7.5-acre) piece of land and made a start by investing $50 in buying clover seeds. So, for ten years she has been growing clover. As many people have cattle and need to prepare forage for winter, Guljan quickly started making profits. Now, she trades in clover at the market. Guljan’s work has been a great asset to her family’s budget as, together with her husband, she has been able to buy a house in Tokmok city. Recently, Guljan harvested the clover and now needs some funds for fertilizing and working the land before winter comes. Therefore, she has applied for this loan as she does not have much time to collect a sufficient amount of money. Guljan’s partners are Gulzina, Dinara and Sabyrbek: Gulzina, 23, is married and her husband works at a tannery. Gulzina works on her land: she has one-hectare (2.5 acres) of land and grows hay. She has already harvested and stacked the hay and now is preparing to start selling it. Gulzina hopes to get this loan and invest it in working the land and fertilizing it. Dinara, 43, is divorced. She plans to get engaged in animal husbandry. Her colleagues have advised her to start this occupation as it brings good profits. Dinara has applied for this loan to purchase a calf. Now, she is planning to equip her house with the necessary facilities. Sabyrbek, 46, is a father of four children. His wife works at Kyrgyz Post as a logistics manager. Sabyrbek trades in cattle at “Murok” market and manages to earn $185 a month. Now, he needs to obtain this loan to invest it in purchasing cattle. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To fertilize and plough fallow land before winter comes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her arable land and buying farm supplies

loans.name: Iggo

texts.en:
Iggo M., currently in the business of selling beer and soft drinks such as sodas, packaged juice, water, etc., is requesting a loan to stock wines and spirits in her bar to sell. Iggo, 38 years old and widowed, has four children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a book shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock wines and spirits in her bar to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 41, is married and blessed with five children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Jocelyn owns a Calamansi (a citrus fruit) farm and also raises pigs. She works hard for her family and to give her children proper education. She also hopes to expand her business.

Jocelyn is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and this is third time to apply for a loan. Her previous loans were used to finance her farm and her hog-raising business. She is now applying for 9,000 PHP. This loan will be used for feed and other farming needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En R. lives in Neasa Kiri village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has owns a 1-hectare field on which she grows rice. In this plantation, she has some obstacles because her soil is infertile and has lots of insects so she wants a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide, and to pay for laborers. Her husband, Mr. Phos Cheung, is also farmer. Mrs. En R. is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children, one who works in a garment factoR. while the other three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide, and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en: Ruel M. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. He is 24 years old. Ruel is single. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services used to transport passengers in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Ruel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ruel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 59 years old. Carmelita is widowed and has 5 adult children. Carmelita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Carmelita joined ASKI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell
