loans.name: Etimad

texts.en:
Etimad is a housewife with two children whom she takes care of in addition to her household duties. She is from a small village called Ni'leen in Ramallah district.

Etimad's husband is a construction worker in the Occupied Palestine Territories (Israel). Due to the non-stable work situation there, Etimad's husband had to borrow money from relatives and friends. Therefore she has asked for a loan from FATEN to pay off her husband's debts.

Etimad appears in the picture above.

loans.use: Pay off debts

loans.name: Elvira Carmela

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, de quienes recibe apoyo en cuanto a la vivienda, en el distrito de Reque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de un año se dedica a la venta de comida en el frontis de la casa en donde vive: por las mañanas ofrece ceviche (plato típico del país) acompañado de papitas, humitas y tortitas, mientras que por las tardes, vende postres típicos del país (arroz con leche y mazamorra) en el parque que queda a una cuadra de su vivienda. Este negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos.

Este negocio también es de mucha ayuda para su economía y la de su familia, sus padres ya son de edad avanzada y dependen de los ingresos que ella perciba para vivir. Por este motivo Elvira desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos para ofrecer a sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Elvira es una mujer responsable y que dia a dia se esfuerza para salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus padres una mejor calidad vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 57 years old and lives in the home of her parents, from whom she receives support in terms of housing. She lives in the Reque district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year she has sold food from the front of the house where she lives. In the mornings she offers ceviche (a typical dish of the country), along with chips, tamales and pancakes, while in the evenings she sells traditional Peruvian desserts (arroz con leche -rice custard, mazamorra - purple corn pudding) in the park that is a block from her house. This business enjoys a very good reception due to the flavorful food that she prepares. This business is also a big help to her and her family economically, as her parents are of an advanced age and they depend on the income that she earns to survive. For this reason Elvira wants to expand her business with the purchase of more supplies that will allow her to prepare more food to offer her customers. To do this she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that she will use to achieve this goal. Elvira is a responsible woman who, day by day, works hard to get ahead. Her main wish is to offer her parents a better quality of life. She has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her food sales business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz M. is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family through her general store and hog-raising business. She lives in Brgy Bangquerohan, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 4 school-aged children who are between 1 and 16 years old. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and hog-raising businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Luz is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can buy additional products for her general store and feed for her pigs . This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Luz aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn N. is a villager in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province and she was born in 1983. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband is a fisherman who is able to earn some money from selling fish to support his family. Her husband is on the left in the photo

Although this family tries to work hard, they earn a low income. Accordingly, they want to start a new business but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Thorn N. decided to ask for a loan to construct a pigsty for raising pigs. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy a battery for her husband's fishing business.

Mrs. Thorn N. is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local public school..

loans.use: To construct a pigsty for raising pigs plus a battery for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.en:
Alejandra C. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Alejandra is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alejandra is married and has 2 school-aged children. Alejandra owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells fresh fish. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Беков Сухроб проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец работает в России. Сам Сухроб открыл фотосалон, где обслуживает клиентов. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для расширения деятельности (бизнеса).
texts.en:
Suhrob B. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. He lives together with his parents. His father works in Russia. Suhrob opened a photo salon, where he serves customers. He has been in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting this loan for business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto N. is from Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 61 years old. Crisanto is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Crisanto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Crisanto has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 45000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Crisanto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Crisanto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Crisanto is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Crisanto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with five children, who all attend school. She resides in and owns a three room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Josephine also takes care of additional family members. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Josephine is a tailor working at her home in Kyebando Nsooba Kawempe Division. She has been in the business of making uniforms for all schools around her home for eight years. Josephine sells these uniforms at both wholesale and retail levels. She works six days a week. Her business challenges are defaulters and transportation of the uniforms from Kiyembe in Kampala city to her home in Kyebando Nsooba. Josephine wants to use this loan to buy more school uniform materials. She hopes to see her business grow big and to start employing three girls. Josephine joined MCDT to boost her business by acquiring additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more school uniform materials

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee S. lives with her two children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her children live together in a house. Her elder daughter attends a local middle school while her husband works in South Korea.

Chimgee operates a small cafe in her town. She began her business in 2009 as a food retailer. After years of successful business, she planned to operate a fast-food service to her customers at local businesses and at the market. Her cafe specializes in a variety of meals.

Chimgee is now thinking about expanding her business. She hopes to increase her working capital and open a bigger and popular fast-food center in her town. Chimgee is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT loan to purchase kitchen equipment, tools and supplies to start her new venture.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen equipment, tools and supplies

loans.name: Keyling Vanessa

texts.es: Keyling es una madre de familia de 21 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad por lo que su pulpería está establecida en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado para adquirirlos. Ella se encarga de que sus clientes encuentren los productos que necesitan en su establecimiento, por ello trata de ofrecerles productos de buena calidad, esto y el trato amable con el que los atiende han hecho que actualmente cuente con un grupo de clientes fieles que mantienen una preferencia por su negocio.Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes entre otras.Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Keyling is a 21-year-old mother. She has a grocery store installed in her home where she sells basic needs items. She stocks all kinds of daily use items that customers would have to go all the way to the market to get. She sees to it that her customers find everything they need in her store so tries to offer high quality items. This and the kind manner in which she helps them have led to her having a large base of regular customers who prefer her store over others. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store like: soft-drinks, juices, sweets, basic grains, detergents, etc. She has collaborated in the past with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with respect to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her house such as: cements, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee B. is from the village of Taguanao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Imee is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imee owns & operates a "repair shop" business providing mechanical services to local community members. Imee has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Imee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Imee is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Imee from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas V. is from the village of Santa Cruz. He is 56 years old, married, and has six children. To make a living, he sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jonas has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jonas joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish products to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn G. is from the village of South Cogon, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Genelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Genelyn makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Genelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Genelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her food business

loans.name: Gladwell Wambui

texts.en: Gladwell is 51 years old and married to George Gathua Njoroge.  She has been operating her butcher shop in the town of Naivasha since 2004. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, and paid back her first loan from them in good time.  This will be Gladwell’s second loan from KADET.  She plans to use the money to add mutton to her stock of meat for sale in her butcher shop.  In the future, she hopes to start selling live sheep and goats in the local market, as this kind of business is highly marketable in her area.

loans.use: to buy mutton for sale

loans.name: Arturo Orfilio

texts.es:
Arturo de 47 años, tiene una pequeña tienda. vive con su esposa y tres hijos  en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Cuando el fue despedido y con el dinero de la liquidación decidió comprar vivieres y ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Ha venido trabajando con la ayuda de su esposa e hija desde las 06h00am hasta las el anochecer. 

El quiere seguir con su tienda para seguir manteniendo a su familia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos para así surtir su tienda y que mujeres compren también. En el futuro quiere terminar de surtir su negocio y vender carnes.
texts.en:
Arturo is 47 years old and owns a small store. He lives with his wife and three children in Las Orquídeas ("orchids") de Guayaquil (urban area, called "las orquídeas" because in its discovery they found many "orchids"). 

When he was let go, he decided to use the settlement money to buy supplies and open a small store in front part of his home.  He has been working with the help of his wife and daughter from 6:00 am until dusk.  

He wants to continue with the store to continue providing for his family.  Also, he wants to buy cosmetics with the loan so that he can stock his store with what women buy. In the future he wants to finish stocking his store and sell meat.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
This is thirty-five-year-old Iye F.. Born in Karena village, this wife and mother of three children is a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni city. Her husband is a retired and her children are all attending primary and secondary schools. 

Iye wants a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to invest in her business. She sells locally dyed cloth (gara lappers). She has been in this business for seven years now. However, her business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. Thus she has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy “brillians” (white cloth), inks, caustic soda, powder and pay artists to make special designs on the white cloth.

loans.use: Buy white cloth, inks, caustic soda, powder and pay artists to make special designs on the white cloth

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José, es empleado y tiene una tienda, vive con su esposa Sandra Elizabeth y sus dos hijos José Arístides de 18 años y Wilber Alexander de 16 años de edad, además junto a ellos vive la madre de Sandra, residen en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, él tiene una tienda en su casa donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, además es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal de San Carlos como promotor, el negocio es atendido mayormente por su esposa y sus clientes son todos los vecinos cercanos a su vivienda. 
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, sus planes son comprar de aquella mercadería con la que aun no cuenta pero que es demandada por los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a contar con variedad de productos y que las personas que le compran encuentren todo lo necesario para el hogar, su compra será de papel higiénico, aceite, pollo, maíz. 
Para Juan José su objetivo primordial es contar con fuentes de ingreso para dar a su familia lo necesario, además invertirle al negocio para mejorar su servicio y atención a los clientes de esta manera estar asegurando estabilidad a sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juan José works and also owns a small shop.  He lives with his wife, Sandra Elizabeth, his two children, Jose Aristides of 18 years old and Wilber Alexander of 16 years old, and Sandra's mother.  They reside in San Carlos, a department of Morazan.  He has a shop in his house where he sells basic household products.  He also works for San Carlos City Hall as a developer.  The business is mainly run by his wife and his customers are all close neighbors that reside nearby.  He is seeking a loan to invest in his business.  His plans are to purchase merchandise that he still doesn't have yet, but which his customers are asking for.  This loan would help him obtain a variety of products so that his clients will find everything that they need for their home.  He plans to purchase toilet paper, oil, chicken, and corn.  For Juan Jose, his main objective is to generate income in order to provide for his family and improve his service and attention to his customers to assure that his business and earnings are stable.

loans.use: Purchase toilet paper, chicken, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
M. Peace is an individual client from Rukungiri. She is a business lady involved in agriculture, where she has been dealing in the sale of matooke at Nyabikuku centre for 10 years. 

She is 43 years old and married with 5 children.  She works with family members to ensure that their plantations give high quality yield for sale.  She also has another business selling used clothing.  

At the moment, she needs a loan to be able to improve her banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulch. Her previous business was selling second-hand shoes until she moved.  She is a trustworthy person. She works hard to ensure the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and mulch

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, oil, onion, salt, pepper, tomato etc

loans.name: Rosario Pastora

texts.es:
Rosario de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares comenzó a vender productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ha trabajado con las ventas de productos de uso personal desde tiempo atrás dando créditos por la comprar de sus productos. Realiza la venta de los productos sola pero cuando es de cobrar el dinero que le quedan debiendo le ayuda su esposo. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, cosméticos. 

Para seguir trabajando con diligencia y a una cantidad mayor sus productos quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere incrementar las ventas de los productos y tener una cartera de clientes grande.
texts.en:
Rosario is 56 years old and is a hardworking woman. To help her husband with the family expenses, she began to sell Yanbal products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to start independent sales).

Living in an urban area called Guasmo, she has worked with personal products sales for some time, leaving her products on credit. She sells her products alone but her husband helps her when it comes to collecting the money that her customers owe. Rosario sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, and cosmetics.

In order to continue working diligently and with more products, she wants to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she wants to increase her product sales and have a large client list.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en: Shabana lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Kirpa ram with her family in a two-room brick house. She moved here four years ago. She is 35 years old and married to M. W. who works in a government organization on a monthly wage. After his day job, he runs a butcher shop in the community where he sells chicken meat to his customers. People prefer buying meat from him because of his good quality and freshness. Shabana supports her family by doing sewing work. She takes orders from her neighbors and earns a good income by completing them on time. She uses her income to pay off the utility bills. Shabana is the mother of two children: a three-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. They need full attention from her and Shabana tries her best to fulfill her duties. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in bulk and increase his sales. Shabana is very hopeful that her husband’s business will expand further after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With the previous loan, she established good credit and never missed any meeting. Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shabana”.

loans.use: To buy chickens in bulk

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for ten years. She has employed one farmhand and sells her milk to a local tea estate. She also earns income from the sale of maize and tea to the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says that her major challenges have been the lack of a proper market for milk and her lack of knowledge on animal diseases and feeds. 

In the future, she would like to increase the number of her dairy cows and improve the quality of her animal feeds to improve her dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Marina is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling hot dog and sausage kebabs in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Marina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aurelia Lucia

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de san Jacinto,  es casada con 2 hijos, los que estudian en colegios de león, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de primaria, ubicada en el colegio Sara maría parrales, con el cual se firmo convenio de financiamiento, esta señora tiene 25 años de desempeñar dicha actividad, en cuanto a los financiamientos es el segundo que obtiene atraves del convenio, el cual le han venido ayudar a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of San Jacinto. She is married and she has 2 children, both of whom are in school in Leon. She works as a primary school teacher at the Sara Maria Parrales schools and it is how she is able to take on this loan. She has had her business for 25 years and this second loan will help her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
El señor Orlando B. tiene 57 años de edad, vive en San Marcos de Colon y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado actividad que realiza desde hace varios años. El ganado que compra lo distribuye a varios
clientes de San Marcos de Colon y San Lorenzo. sus clientes los prefieren ya que el compra buenas reses a buenos precios y las revende a un precio moderado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ganado para venta.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio para obtener buenas ganancias y asi darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Orlando B. is 57 years old and lives in San Marcos de Colon. He has been buying and selling livestock for many years. The cattle he acquires is sold to various customers in San Marcos de Colon and San Lorenzo. His customers prefer to buy from him because he gets a good deal when he purchases the animals and resells them at a reasonable price.

This loan will be used to buy cattle to sell. His goal is to grow his business so that he can generate good earnings and provide a better quality of life for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Real Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Real” tiene 12 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses) entonces tiene 4 años juntos como grupo,  el banco comunal está conformado por personas amigables y carismáticas. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en los diferentes distritos de la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es una de las ciudades más visitadas de nuestro país. El Cusco cuenta con una infinidad de atractivos turísticos cercanos que han encantado al mundo entero. Uno de los principales es Sacsayhuamán, que posee murallas de 300 metros de longitud hechas con rocas de hasta 5 metros de altura y 350 toneladas de peso. 

Los socios son personas que se sientes muy orgullosos de vivir en la ciudad del Cusco y aprovechan las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de cosméticos, comestibles, artesanía, ropa, zapatos, accesorios para celulares y otros se dedican a brindar servicios.  
 
La socia Tula nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente, Tula vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad  del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Tula es la venta de accesorios de celulares, cargadores, y otras cosas más, ella vende los días sábados en la feria sabatina del “Baratillo” de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Tula requiere el préstamo e igual que sus compañeras del banco comunal para incrementar capital del negocio pero ella desea comprar accesorios de celulares como por ejemplo audifonos, cargadores, etc. (Los socios que faltan en la foto no están porque pidieron permiso para no estar presente en la reunión). 

Las dos socias que aparecen junto al grupo pidieron permiso para no estar en la reunion es por este motivo que se les saco la foto en otro momento.
texts.en:
The Real communal bank has been active for 12 loan cycles (each lasting 4 months), thus the group has been together for 4 years.  The group is comprised of friendly, personable people.  The Real communal bank holds meetings every thirty days in the central office of the Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco.  The majority of the members live in different districts of Cusco, which is one of the most visited cities in the country.  

Cusco features endless nearby tourist attractions that the entire world has grown to love.  One of the major attractions is Sacsayhuamán, which is made of rock walls that are 300 meters long, almost 5 meters high and weigh 350 tons. The Real communal bank members feel very proud to live in the city of Cusco and they take advantage of opportunities to make a living and with daily effort, to give a better future to their children. 

An example of the type of work some of the members do is; cosmetic sales, fuel sales, traditional craft sales, clothing, shoes, cell phone accessories among other services.  

One member, Tula, was born in Cusco and is 40 years old.  Currently, she lives with her husband and three children in Cusco.  Primarily, Tula works selling cell phone accessories, such as chargers, among other items.  She works on Saturdays in the “Baratillo” market in Cusco.  

At this time, Tula is requesting the loan, like her fellow group members, to increase her business capital.  Specifically, Tula plans buy headphones, chargers etc. The members who do not appear in the photo were granted permission to be absent from the meeting. The two members who appear in the small photo asked for permission to be absent from the group meeting and that is why the picture was taken of them at a different moment.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories such as headphones, chargers, etc.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla M. G. is 31 years old. She is married to James, and they have been blessed with three children.

She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for the last six years.This marks her second loan from KADET, and she plans to purchase sugar, flour, rice, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpaste and bread to add the stock to the shop.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Priscilla’s dream is to own a scrap metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpaste, and bread

loans.name: 0410016- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Đức P. Thị (112) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Hoằng hoá-Thanh Hoá. Đức is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0410016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường (0410016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường). 

Đức is married and has four adult children. Đức has a store which mainly sells confectionary products in the local community. Đức has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Đức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Đức has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đức plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 

1. P. Thị Lan (2) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her general store. 

2. T. Thị Thuý (3) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

3. N. Thị Thu (110) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her general store. 

4. P. Thị Hằng (99) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

5. Lê Thị Vân (116) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

6. Lê Thị Cúc (111) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

7. N. Thị Nga (119) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: 

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

Đức P. Thị (112) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng hoá-Thanh Hoá. Đức là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có eight các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0,410,016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường (0,410,016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường). 

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Đức thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn five năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Đức kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND. Vào 2010, Đức đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/anh ấy. Đức đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND. 

Khoản vay sẽ là second khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 

one. P. Thị Lan (two) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 

two. T. Thị Thuý (three) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

three. N. Thị Thu (110) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 

four. P. Thị Hằng (99) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

five. Lê Thị Vân (116) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

six. Lê Thị Cúc (111) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

seven. N. Thị Nga (119) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: 

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. 

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch.. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Timoteo Rumaldo

texts.es:
Timoteo de 42 años de edad, es soltero. Vive en su casa propia en la zona rural, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de agua, ubicada en Corral de Arena a unos 20 minutos del distrito de Olmos y a una hora al departamento de Lambayeque.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería fundamentalmente.

Timoteo se dedica desde hace algún tiempo como estibador (persona que lleva sacos con productos  en la parte posterior de su moto lineal), esta labor lo realiza en las diferentes tierras que cultivan productos comestibles pero en menores cantidades y él se encarga de llevar estos productos a la ciudad para que los vendan, también le encargan traer sacos con fertilizantes para los dueños de las  tierras de cultivo para las cuales trabaja.  Esta actividad le ayudado para poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Por eso ha visto necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su moto lineal ya que es su único medio de trabajo que tiene y necesita tenerla en buen estado para seguir prestando sus servicios eficientemente como hasta el momento.  Timoteo es conocido en la zona por ser una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de seguir superándose en la vida.
texts.en:
Timoteo, 42, is single.  He lives in his own house, which only has water, in the rural zone located in Corral de Arena about 20 minutes from Olmos District and an hour from Lambayeque Department.  Throughout this zone residents are fundamentally farmers and raise livestock.

For some time now, Timoteo has worked as a stevedore (a person who transports sacks of products on the back of his motorcycle).  He carries out this work in the various fields where foodstuffs are cultivated but in small quantities.  He takes care of transporting them to the city to be sold.  They also ask him to bring back sacks of fertilizer for the owners of the farmland that he works for.  This activity has made it possible for him to cover his personal expenses.

He now has the need to request a 700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to service his motorcycle since it’s his only means of work and he has to have it in good working order if he’s to continue providing effective service as he’s been doing so far.  Timoteo is known in the area for being a responsible, hard working person with a strong drive to continue doing better in life.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aydalina del Carmen  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 38 años. Ella tiene un taller de calzado el cual inicio hace 8 años junto a su esposo y su hijo mayor quienes levantaron el negocio actualmente cuenta con cinco trabajadores y hace tres meses tiene un tramo en el mercado.
Ella con el crédito compra materia prima para realizar más calzado y en tramo para surtirlo más.
texts.en: Aydalina del Carmen is a hard-working and enterprising 38-year-old woman. She started her own shoemaker's shop eight years ago along with her husband and her eldest son, who built the business. Today she has five employees, and for the past three months she has had a spot at the local market. She plans to use the loan to purchase raw materials (glue, leather, insoles, etc.) to make more shoes and to better stock the sales post in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (glue, leather, insoles, etc.) to make more shoes and to better stock her sales post.

loans.name: Shovkhat

texts.ru:
Shovkhat was born in 1955. She is married and has 6 children. Her daughter helps mother in her work and Shovkhat teachs her a good sew. Shovkhat, her husband and children live in Baku region. 
Now Shovkhat needs 2000 ANZ to buy a new sewing machine for improving her business. Her old sewing machine machine was spoiled. She started this business 11 years ago. She learned sewing business from her mother.
texts.en:
Shovkhat was born in 1955. She is married and has six children. Her daughter helps mother with her business and Shovkhat teaches her how to sew well.  Shovkhat, her husband and children live in the Baku region. She started this business eleven years ago. She learned about sewing business from her mother.

At this time Shovkhat needs 2000 ANZ to buy a new sewing machine to improve her business. Her old sewing machine has worn out.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells foods like spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spices & food seasonings.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices & food seasonings.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: Claudia Azucena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios con el objetivo de buscar apoyo con los gastos del hogar. Pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido sacar adelante su medio de vida. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido importante para mantener 2 hijos a su cargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas. Sueña con aumentar su negocio y mejorar cada día más el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en: Claudia Azucena has a business selling general merchandise.  She started the business with her own funds because she was looking for a way to help with the household expenses. But over time she has been able to make progress with her business.  She has been doing this work for more than 12 years, and it has been an important means of support for the two children in her care.  The loan that she requests will be used to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets and towels.  She dreams of expanding her business and providing better service each day to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets and towels

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 35 years old and married with one child who is attending school. He is a very hardworking and cooperative man with a poultry-keeping business from Bugongo Cell that has been running for one year. Medard is grateful that in his one year, he is now able to earn 400,000 shillings weekly. He says that keeping chickens involves too much work, but he is happy that he works together with his wife as he (Medard) leaves home during the week to go to work. His other source of income is his monthly salary, from which he got the capital to start the poultry business. Some of the benefits of taking loans have been buying land for agriculture as well as building his own home, hence putting a stop to renting. 

He needs a loan to be able to stock more chicken feeds as well as buying day-old chicks for business expansion.

loans.use: To stock more chicken feed as well as buying day-old chicks for business expansion.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella realiza movilidad escolar, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de movilidad escolar. La socia solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro y también para pagar la mensualidad de educación de su hijo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SANTO DOMINGO” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Celia. She is 28 years old, single, and has 1 son. She works in the transportation business, bringing children to and from school. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Celia wants to get her son ahead with this job and she wants to improver her transportation service. She is asking for the loan to do maintenance o her car and also to pay for her son's monthly tuition.  

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her car and also to pay for her son's monthly tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more jewelry for his business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 46 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la negocio y le va muy bien.

Lucila requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo naranjas, piñas y otras frutas más. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department (Perú) and is 46 years old.  She’s a single mother of two children.  She currently lives in the city where she was born and where she carried out her activities.  She sells fruit in a market in Cusco.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  Lucila needs the loan to buy more merchandise like oranges, pineapples and other fruit, for example.

The “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is noted for tourism, commerce, for its traditional “Inty Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like oranges, pineapples and other fruit, for example.

loans.name: Rudella

texts.en:
Rudella is 50 years old and married, with three children.  Rudella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rudella has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.  Rudella aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her  store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55, and has five children. Four of her children are married and one is still single and works. She is married, but her husband is not with them due to his furniture shop business at the village of Diffun Quirino. 

Josefina has been operating her general store for almost 15 years. She is thankful because, through this business, she has been able to raise her children and let them finished their degrees. According to her, she opens her store at 4 o'clock in the morning due to those costumer who go to the rice fields. Many of her customers are farmers so, she wakes up early to supply their needs. Her profit increases during crop season because her products sell out immediately and credit is not allowed during crop season.  

One of her greatest problems in managing her store is credit of some of her costumers. This is why she is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP25,000 to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients and vegetables needed in her retail store.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients and vegetables needed in her retail store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 51 years old. She is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 21-year-old artistic young lady, who inherited her talent from her mother, Fathiya. Since she was young, Walaa has had a hobby of playing and shaping stuff using clay and gypsum. Having artistic talent and learning more about it from her experienced mother has given her the courage to start a small business at a young age, making decorative items using clay and gypsum. She also added drawing on glass to what she does.

At this point Walaa is selling what she makes to decoration shops, hoping that one day she will have her own workshop with her mother and have their own store selling these items.

In order to do that, Walaa has applied for this loan to buy more materials and paints to make more and more products so she can have the required amount of money to get a store.

Since Walaa is a conservative person, her mother Fathiya has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy new materials and paints to make her gypsum crafts.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
This is 44 year old Massa. She is divorced and has five children. She has two additional dependents who live with her. They help her elder sister and assist in schooling.
In 2005, Massa established her provisions and drinks business. She started by selling drinks and then provisions. Working six days a week and ten hours a day. She earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Massa has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans. She requires this new loan in order to buy drinks and provisions, such as milk, sugar, margarine, tea, coffee etc, for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for drinks and provisions, such as milk, sugar, margarine, tea, coffee etc, for her business

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 24 years old and lives with his mother in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His mother is a retired woman who stays at home. He started his cell phone repair business in 2009 by renting a counter in a cell phone store. He's one of the few people in the store who has technical education, which gives him an advantage over competitors. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Now cell phones are getting advanced. Therefore, my equipment is not able to fix them." He is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his phone repair center.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for phone repair

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es: La señora Marta Lucia a sus 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo para con esta labor conseguir sus propios ingresos y brindarle a su hijo de 7 años la educación y bienestar que él necesita. Actualmente la señora Marta Lucia desea comprar mercancía para la venta como calzado y prendas de vestir para dama  y caballero con el fin de diversificar su negocio y conseguir mayores ingresos para brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Marta Luica is 30 years old and does catalog shoe sales.  This allows her to generate her own income so that she can provide an education and see to the well-being of her seven year old son.  Marta Luica now wants to buy merchandise, such as shoes, and men’s and women’s clothing, in order to diversify her business and increase her income, so that she can offer her son a good quality of life and care for his well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ushindi A Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Ushindi A Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Josephine as the facilitator. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

She takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund's best prices offered and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 30 bags on 1 1/2 acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on 1 1/2 acres of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Josephine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business. In 2012, the members of Ushindi A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Bartola

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de frutas al mayoreo, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene muchos años de estar en este negocio, lo inicio con su esposo, no hay un horario fijo y actualmente necesita dinero para invertirlo en mercadería.
Con el préstamo comprara frutas al mayoreo como las naranjas, guineos, manzanas, ya que ella les distribuye a pequeños comerciantes de frutas, permitiéndole este préstamo para que el negocio siga su curso normal.
La aspiración de María es tener siempre disponible mercadería para los clientes, vivir con su familia y trabajar juntos para poder properar.
texts.en:
María's business is selling fruit wholesale.  She lives with her husband and children and has been in this business for many years.  She started the business together with her husband.  María does not work regular hours and currently needs money to invest in buying merchandise.

María will use her loan to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas and apples wholesale.  She distributes the fruit to small-scale fruit vendors.  This loan will allow her business to continue working as normal.

María's aspirations are to always have merchandise available for her customers, to live with her family, and to work together so that they can do well and prosper.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and apples

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: La señora Diana tiene una bodega desde hace cuatro años en la cual distribuye cerveza en el municipio de San Rafael localizado al oriente de Antioquia, ha presentado dificultades en el abastecimiento de su bodega puesto que la vía de acceso al municipio ha permanecido cerrada por el invierno varios días lo que le ha generado escasez de producto y bajas ventas. La señora Diana requiere de la compra de una estantería que le facilite un mayor almacenamiento de producto y así poder surtir en mayor cantidad su bodega y no tener que sufrir con el cierre de la carretera. La señora Diana sueña con tener una gran distribuidora a nivel departamental y brindarle a sus hijos y esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For four years Diana has had a warehouse in which she distributes beer, in the town of San Rafael located to the east of Antioquía.  This has presented difficulties in storage because the access road to the town has remained closed for several days because of winter, which has caused product shortages and low sales.

Diana needs to buy shelves that will allow her greater storage of her product, and in that way she will be able to supply her warehouse with greater quantities and not have to suffer from the highway closure.

Diana dreams of having a large, department-wide distribution company and of giving her children and her husband a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shelves for her products in the distribution company

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una persona trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora a pesar de su edad , se dedica a la venta de comida la atención es por las mañanas donde ofrece caldos y sopas  a medio día prepara  almuerzos completos entre otros ; su pensión esta ubicada en su mismo domicilio son  7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, , actual mente se encuentra viviendo en casa familiar en  una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba ubicada al sud,  el destino del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como arroz, papa , carne , aceite, para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos,  la señora indica que el crédito otorgado  le ayudara a seguir desarrollando su actividad económica.
texts.en:
In spite of her age, Felipa is a hard-working, responsible, and enterprising woman.  She works selling food.  In the mornings, she offers soup and broth, and at mid-day she prepares full lunches and other items.  Her restaurant is located in her home.  She has done this work for seven years.  She currently lives in her family home in the peri-urban area to the south of the city of Cochabamba.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients such as rice, potato, meat, and oil to make her rich dishes.  Felipa says that the loan provided will help her continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, potato, meat, and oil to make her rich dishes.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: Evaristo, de 43 años, esta casado con Aurea de 37 años y tienen 04 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa donde ronda la felicidad. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, hoy es campesino y cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva plantas de cacao. Viene trabajando 15 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y frutos de piña. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este será el crédito número 01 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles; comprará plantas de cacao para amplir la producción.
texts.en: Evaristo is 43 years old, he is married to Aurea, who is 37 years old. Together they have 4 children. They have their own house where they live happily. Since he was a child his parents taught him to work on the farm, now he is a farmer and he has his own land where he grows cocoa trees. He has been working his own land for the past 15 years. During harvest times he has help from his children and other hired laborers to be able to pick the fruit more quickly. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his plants because he can see that his months of hard work have resulted in the reward of good fruit. The hardest thing is to transport his products from the farm to the warehouse that is located in the city of San Francisco; this is where he is able to get the best price for his grains and pineapples. His difficulty is that he does not have enough economic income to be able to cover the advance payments to the hired laborers that help him during the harvest. It is for this reason that he came to the institution of MFP. But right now what is of higher priority is to plant more cocoa trees in a hectare of uncultivated land that he has. This will be his first loan with MFP. Evaristo feels that the money from this loan will help him greatly in the progress of his work. In his community bank he is a member that is very well liked by the rest of the members; he is well integrated with them. With the loan of 1,500 nuevos soles he is going to buy cocoa trees, which will increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met, 58, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over 20 years, earning approximately 2 USD per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately 5 USD per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Met is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm to generate extra income to support the family and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra en la selva peruana, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo por sus paisajes bellos y por la generosidad y alegría de sus pobladores. Ronald es un joven muy optimista y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante por ello con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyarse con los gastos de sus estudios ya que él se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración y ya va por el último año.

Día a día Ronal trabaja en una empresa como empleado, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y por las tardes el va a su centro de estudios; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con sus compañeros y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Ronal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar utensilios de panadería como batidoras, moldes, planchas, entre otros, ya que va iniciar su negocio de panadería, de esta manera el podrá tener los implementos necesarios para su negocio y así poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Ronald lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city located in the Peruvian jungle, noted for its hot, welcoming climate as well as for its beautiful scenery and for the generosity and joy of its residents.  Ronald is a very optimistic young man who above all wants to get ahead.  He’s in the last year of his business administration studies and he pays for his education with the fruits of his labor.  

Ronald is employed by a firm and works about 9 hours daily; he attends classes in the evening.  He believes he does well in his work because he’s very kind to his coworkers and above all because of his drive to get ahead.

Ronald is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy baking utensils like mixers, molds and griddles, among others because he’s going to open a bakery.  In this way he’ll have the necessary tools for his business and will be able to continue striving every day to make his greatest dream reality: to have better quality of life and to support his parents.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
We had an opportunity to meet 37-year-old Fridah Kaari, a farmer who hails from Nkubu.  She has two children and has been actively involved in farming for five years.  She has a farm where she grows tea and other crops and also rears cows and poultry, which also serve as a source of income.  She says that she enjoys the output produced and that the biggest challenge she faces is exploitation from middlemen who bridge the gaps with customers.

This loan will enable her to purchase water pipes that will ensure an easy flow of water to the farm, creating a continuous flow of water to her crops and animals.  This will allow her to bring in more income and thus improve her family’s living standards.

Fridah said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because it is the best institution that finances low income earners.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine aged 31 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 9 years. 1 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: A university student living in Phnom Penh city, Sophal is 19 years old. Nowadays, he is involved in his parent's business as a grocery seller and he add up time as a security guard to get salary to support on his study life. This is his first loan with VisionFund and he will use his loan portion to pay on tuition fee and prepare some needed document to study Marketing skill at abroad. Sophal hopes that this loan can help him to finish his education successfully and can help him to get a good job to support on his family’s living in the future time.

loans.use: To pay on tuition fee and prepare some needed document to study Marketing skill at abroad.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hard working and enthusiastic person. Some time ago she lost care of her children to her ex-husband because she did not have a job and she was unable to financially support them. This painful episode in her life was the source of her motivation, and with a heart full of love she started her own business. Her business is a fashion clothing boutique, and day after day Lorena earned more and more clients and greater sales. Today Lorena is remarried and she has her three children.

She requires a loan of $925USD to buy more merchandise, such as fashion clothing for ladies and gentlemen, to increase her selection especially during this holiday season when the potential for earnings is at its best.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, hace tiempo tuvo su primer divorcio donde se ex-esposo se quedó con sus hijos porque no podía encargarse de ellos económicamente, ya que Lorena no tenía un trabajo, fue esta la razón por la que ella se lleno de fuerza y amor para emprender su propio negocio. Este consiste en un espacio donde vende ropa de moda, y día con día el negocio de Lorena toma fuerza con más ventas y clientes. En la actualidad se volvió a casar y tiene 3 hijos.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar mercancía como ropa para dama y caballero que le permita tener una mayor variedad de sus productos, ya que estas fechas navideñas es la mejor temporada del año para obtener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married with four children, all in primary school. In 1996, he started his business which includes selling second-hand clothes. He gets the clothes from Nairobi.

Isaac completed his first loan with Pemci of $159 successfully. He is a committed member of his community-based development group which mobilizes the community for poverty eradication. Through his business, he has been able to sustain his family, buy himself a piece of land, and contribute to the group. He has also gained knowledge and skills. With this second loan of $375 he plans to increase his stock further to take advantage of the growth in his business.

Isaac has a very progressive mind and his success will be an encouragement to his local community, especially the youth and numerous school leavers/dropouts. We believe that by working with individuals like Isaac, Pemci can use them as a development catalyst, thus achieving one of our key goals. Well worth the support of Kiva.

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Sanimah

texts.en: Sanimah  is 48 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her husband' s income, Sanimah raise goats as the main business. In a day Sanimah  can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $50 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more baby goats and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more baby goats

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Maria sells household objects such as presents, work books, glue, combs etc. She also sells water in cups, gallons and bottles. She has been working independently from her home for 6 years. She works every day from 7am – 8pm and thanks to the effort of her wonderful children they have kept the business afloat, selling household objects and water.

Loan Use

Maria World like a loan to buy more articles to sell in her bazaar and therefore to make more money and so that her clients will be happy with the range of products she offers. The number of clients that she has has increased so much so that she needs to increase her number of products to keep up, and this is a result of hard work each day.

Personal Information

Maria is 37 years old and she lives with her 4 children who help her with house work and her business. Their house is made of cement and is very solid. Thanks to Maria’s efforts 3 of her 4 children are studying and, despite the fact that her husband does not live with them, Maria has brought her family forward. Maria’s dream is to have a large business which will be a source of employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Maria se dedica a la venta de bisuterías como: Regalos, cuadernos, gomas, prestobarbas, etc…. Además a la venta de agua, en presentaciones de pomas, galones y botellas. Teniendo como experiencia 6 anos, trabajando independientemente en su local ubicada en su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto con sus bellos hijos a llegado a mantener el negocio a flote, tanto en el bazar como en la venta de agua.

Uso del Préstamo

Maria solicita el préstamo para la compra de más artículos de bazar y así tener más surtido el negocio, de tal modo que la clientela se sienta a gusto con la variedad de productos que Maria les demuestra y ofrece. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Maria necesita incrementar su bazar de tal manera que esta obligada a cumplir con sus necesidades, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Maria tiene 37 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a sus 4 hijos, quien les ayuda con las labores del hogar y negocio, por lo cual tienen su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada. Gracias al esfuerzo que Maria realiza a llegado inclusive a mantener 3 de sus 4 hijos estudiando, a pesar de que esposo no vive con ella, Maria a llevado su familia a delante. Los sueños de Maria es llegar hacer una gran empresaria y generar mas fuentes de trabajo a la gente necesita del sector.

loans.use: To be able to buy more merchandise for her bazaar/Poder comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio

loans.name: Ketut Nonti

texts.id:
As Ketut Nonti is only a secondary school graduate, it is difficult for her to get a job, especially in a remote village where she lives. Nevertheless she is not desperate in living her life.
