With her full willingness and the money from DINARI, she decides to grow pigs.

She allocates Rp 1,000,000 (US$ 105) to buy piglets and another Rp 300,000 (US$ 31.5) to buy the pig feed.

After 6 month period, the pigs will be ready to be sold. The estimated net profit from this 6 month work is Rp 800,000 (US$ 84). From this she will be able to provide her family's daily needs.

While the profit is not tha big, she will keep to do this business as she can get additional income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Karena pendidikan yang hanya sampai SMP saja, tidak memungkinkan untuk bisa mencari pekerjaan dikantoran, apalagi didesa terpencil ditempat dimana Ketut Nonti tinggal, walau demikian, Ketut Nonti tidak putus asa dalam mengarungi kehidupannya. Dengan kemauannya yg tinggi serta dengan modal yang di dapat dari DINARI Ketut Nonti memilih untuk memelihara babi. Uang dengan jumlah Rp.1.000.000,- dialokasikan untuk membeli bibit sebanyak 5 ekor, dan yang Rp.300.000,- digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Kadang Ketut Nonti mencari batang pisang untuk makanan tambahan. Setelah pemeliharaan selama enam bulan babi siap dijual. Keuntungan yang didapat sebanyak 800.000/enam bulan dan dari hasil jerih payahnya itu Ketut Nonti bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Usaha ini akan terus dijalani walau keuntungan yang didapat tidak begitu besar, namun usaha ini bisa memberi tambahan untuk keluarganya

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Lucila Oralia

texts.es:
Lucila is an active, hard-working, responsible, enterprising, and strong person. After working several years as a teacher, she decided to take advantage of her love for sales and try her luck selling beauty products, because the money she was making was not enough to cover her expenses.

In 1997, thanks to an invitation from a friend, Lucila thought she could obtain better income and establish her own work schedule. Since then, she has been getting ahead in her business so she does not regret having taken that opportunity.

However, during Christmas season, her clients start buying products as gifts and for personal use, and that is why Lucila is requesting a loan for US$1,125, to be paid within 6 months. With this money Lucila will be able to buy merchandise to offer a great variety of products to her clients. With your help, Lucila will be able to make her dream of growing in the world of sales come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Lucila es una persona activa, trabajadora, responsable, emprendedora y fuerte. Que después de trabajar varios años como maestra, decide aprovechar su gran gusto por las ventas y para probar su suerte en la venta de productos de belleza, puesto que el dinero que ganaba no le rendía para sus gastos. En 1997, gracias a la invitación de una amiga Lucila pensó que podría obtener mejores ingresos y establecer su propio horario de trabajo. Desde entonces ha ido ascendiendo dentro de su actividad por lo tanto hoy no se arrepiente de haber intentado esta oportunidad.

Sin embargo en la época navideña, sus clientas comienzan a comprar productos para regalos y/o de uso personal, es por eso que Lucila está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,125 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Lucila podrá comprar mercancía para ofrecerles una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Lucila podrá cumplir su sueño de crecer en el mundo de las ventas.

loans.use: Buying seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma M. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 2 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005 and business stability allows him to increase the loan sum. Juma M. is engaged in business of selling men's and children’s wear. He is experienced in business for 10 years. Despite the fact that Mr.M. is an invalid (he has not a right arm), he works intensively to ensure his children a happy and reliable future. He dreams to give his children a good education and profession. Mr. M. requests a loan of US$725 to widen his existing inventory with new imported clothes. This would allow him to increase the family income and to ensure his children a good and happy future.

loans.use: To widen inventory

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Miss Abra K. is 25 years old and single. She has been a hairdresser for almost 3 years and plans on using the current loan to remodel her studio in order to make her customers feel more at ease.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle Abra K. est âgée de 25 ans , non mariée. Elle exerce la coiffure bientôt 3 ans et compte mieux aménager son atelier pour mieux mettre à l’aise ses clients avec le présent emprunt

loans.use: To remodel her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif K. is a 43-year-old married man and he has two children. He lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Vasif and his wife (who is pictured) run the family business together. Vasif's wife cares for their only cow, while Vasif sells the cow's milk in town. Unfortunately, the income generated from the one cow is insufficient to support the family. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of $500 from the Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch to buy one more pure-bred cow, which would increase the business's monthly income. In the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is approximately $800-$1,000, so he would supplement the money he hopes to receive from the the Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch with his own funds to enable him to purchase another cow.

loans.use: To purchase another pure-bred cow

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda, who has 3 kids, has been sewing potatoe, maze, onion and other earthy vegetables in the land that she rents since she was young, and each year she increases the amount of products she sews. Thanks to her perseverance and impetus she has been able to improve the quality of life of her beloved family and she has helped out her husband too. She wants to fertilize the land that she has just rented to sew potatoe and maze and this is why she wants a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Clorinda, tiene tres hijos y se dedica desde joven a la siembra de papá, maíz, cebada y otros vegetales en sus tierras de cultivo y en las tierras que alquila año a año para obtener mayor cantidad de productos; luego de haber concluido la siembra espera seis largos meses para la cosecha y comercialización de sus productos; gracias a su perseverancia e ímpetu ha podido elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia y ha contribuido con el trabajo de su querido esposo. Desea abonar las tierras que acaba de alquilar para la siembra de papa y maíz y a esta razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer/Compra de abonos.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 35 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 8 to 15. Bahati is a vegetables seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Zayda De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Zayda is a hard working woman who has dedicated her life to the store she runs with her two children. Her children are school-aged and she has some humble needs for her home.

Nowadays, she's been able to improve her living conditions thanks to the loans she has acquired through Ciprodel. She currently qualifies for two loans which she has paid on time and has helped her improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Zayda es una persona muy trabajadora el cual se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería con el que mantiene a sus dos hijos en edad escolar y suple las necesidades de su humilde casa de habitación.

Hoy en día ha mejorado en parte la situación de su pulpería debido a que a través de los años ha invertido en el mejoramiento por medio de la diversificación de sus productos. Para esto se ha avocado a Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado créditos que han sido utilizados directamente en la adquisición de los productos para el negocio. Actualmente ella posee un record de dos créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her store

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Umeda S. is a businesswoman, married but without children, who took up business three years ago to help her parents. She sells children’s clothing at her stall in central market of the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She has a very cheerful personality, and shows great friendliness toward her customers. Now she would like to increase the volume of sales at her stall, which will only be possible with the help of a loan. With a loan, she will be able to expand her range of goods. This will help her attract new customers and increase profit. She will repay the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодиева Умеда бизнесмен. Занялась бизнесом три года назад, для того , чтобы помогать родителям. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района Абдурахмони Джоми. Торгует детской одеждой. Сейчас хочет увеличить товарооборот, но для этого ей может помочь только кредит. Получив кредит она сможет завести новый ассортимент товара . Это поможет ей привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить свои доходы. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.Она очень жизнерадостна и добродушно относится к своим покупателям.

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group is called “El Amanecer” (the dawn), all of us are merchants and have small businesses, which we manage.  Thanks to these businesses we can contribute to our family expenses and offer our children a better education and lifestyle.  Considering that the economic situation in our country gets more difficult every day, we decided to look for a way to finance our businesses.  We currently need more merchandise to be able to offer our clients a variety of products.  

These are the activities we work on:

Ana H.:  I have a small store were I sell agribusiness products, located in the downtown area of my community.  I’ve worked on this activity for several years, I use the income to help my husband with the family expenses.  I am married and have three children that are in school.

Elizabeth R. H.:  I work making and selling delicacies, I sell them in my community.  I have two children who are in school; thanks to this business they have the opportunity to study. 

Fidelia F.: Hello, I make and sell delicacies, I sell them in a Basic Education Center located in my community.  I have two children.  At this time I need to purchase more products to make more food and this way be able to offer more variety and increase my income, which I need to provide for my family.
Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

hola nuestro grupo se llama EL AMANECER todas nosotras somos comerciantes y contamos con pequeños negocios los cuales son administrados personalmente por nosotras y gracias a estos negocios podemos colaborar con los gastos de nuestras familias y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros hijos una mejor educacion y estilo de vida. 
Tomando en cuenta que la situacion economica en nuestro pais es cada dia mas dificil por lo que decidimos trabajar y buscar financiamiento para nuestros negocios.
Actualmente necesitamos surtir mas y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros clientes una mejor varidad de productos.

estas son las actividades que nosotras hacemos:

Ana H.: cuento con una pequeña tienda de venta de agro insumos agropecuarios la cual la tengo ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, soy casada y tenemos tres hijos los cuales los tres estan en la escuela.

Elizabeth R. H.: me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas, las que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo 2 hijos los cuales los tengo estudiando, y gracias a este negocio mis hijos tienen la oportunidad de estudiar.

Fidelia F.: hola me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas las que distribuyo en un centro de Educacion Basica de mi comunidad, tengo 2 hijos, actualmente necesito comprar mas producto para hacer mas golosinas y asi poder ofrecer mas variedad de golosinas y tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesito para alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase wheat and corn flour, sugar, basic grains, dairy, deli, tortillas, meat and agribusiness products.

loans.name: Naren

texts.en:
Mrs. Naren S., 36, and her husband Mr. Sovan Tuy, 38, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have no children.

Mrs. Naren has been selling dessert for twelve years. She cooks many types of dessert to sell at Olympic Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh as well. The couple wants to buy a motorbike to drive to work and sell dessert. Naren is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Ankadjidja (Let's Redouble Our Efforts) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankadjidia est composé de femmes mariées vivant en générale dans des foyers polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 4 enfants et résidant dans le village de Farakala sous préfecture de Nièna de Sikasso (troisième région économique  de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes exercent le commerce de patates douces, de pommes de terre, d’ignames, des condiments alimentaires et divers autres articles. Unies par des liens de parenté et d’alliance, les femmes du groupe décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire) et  le précedent a été remboursé sans difficulté.
 Elles comptent achèter avec ce nouveau prêt,  3 douzaines de tasses, 50kg de sucre, 100 kg de piments, 100 kg d’oignons, 4 paniers de soumbala,  25kg de sel et 20 sachets d’autres produits. Tandisque les tasses sont achetées au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès de grossistes du domaine, les autres articles eux sont achetés sur place  au marché de Farakala et dans les villages environnants.  Ensuite elles  revendent ces articles dans le village soit à domicile ou soit de façon ambulante et dans les marchés hebdomadaires de Farakala et des villages voisins. Les ventes sont en majorité au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. La clientèle est composée essentiellement  de  femmes.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA, lequel sera utilisé pour payer les intêrets du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités. Chacune de ces femmes souhaite diversifier leur activité en se spécialisant afin de devenir une commerçante grossiste.
texts.en:
The group Ankadjidia is composed of married women living in general in polygamous households with an average age of 49, 4 children, and residing in the village of Farakala, Sous-Prefecture of Nièna of Sikasso (third economic region of the Republic of Mali).

These women sell sweet potatoes, potatoes, yams, condiments and various other items. United by ties of family and marriage, the women of this group decided to become members of the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second group loan, the former having been reimbursed without difficulty.

They expect to buy with this loan: 3 dozen cups, 50 kg of sugar, 100 kg of hot peppers, 100 kg of onions, 4 baskets of soumbala (a condiment made from tree leaves), 25 kg of salt and 20 envelopes of other products. Whereas the cups are purchased in the big open-air market of Sikasso from wholesalers who handle that sort of merchandise, the other articles are bought right where they live, in the market of Farakala and in the surrounding villages. Then they sell these articles in the village, either out of their homes or door-to-door and in the weekly markets of Farakala and the surrounding villages. The sales are mostly for cash and occasionally for credit. Their clientele is essentially made up of women.

They hope to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which will be used to make payments on the loan with the remainder invested in their businesses. Each of these women hopes to diversify her business and specialize in order to become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various merchandise

loans.name: Raul Boris

texts.es:
Raúl Ibañez es soltero,  vive en casa de sus abuelos en la calle Sánchez Lima de la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz., trabaja como portero en una iglesia donde le pagan un sueldo mínimo, hace lo que puede con tan miserable paga (550 Bolivianos mensuales o 67 dólares al mes). Es por eso que solicita crédito  para tramitar sus documentos de bachiller y así poder estudiar en alguna universidad. Desde muy pequeño Raúl ha sido independiente (sus padres nunca lo apoyaron), ahora quiere ser profesional.

Su historial es bueno y puede acceder al crédito.
texts.en:
Raúl Ibañez is single and lives in his grandparents’ house on Sánchez Lima street in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. He works as a doorman at a church where they pay him a minimum salary. He does what he can with such miserable pay (550 Bolivianos per month, or $67.00 per month). Because of this, he is requesting a loan to process his high school graduation documents so that he can study at a university. Raúl has been independent since he was very young (his parents never supported him). He would like to be a professional. His credit history is good and so he can obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is married and has one son. He is a young entrepreneur who owns a store that sells cell phone and cell phone minutes. He also activates and repairs phones. Edgar tends the store himself. He told us that there is a lot of competition in the telephone business, and he has to offer great service to compete, especially by responding to the requests of potential clients as quickly as possible. Edgar has invested past loans in purchasing cell phone minutes and accessories. Because of this he’s been able to keep his store well stocked and offer a variety of products and services. Edgar is contemplating moving closer to the center of the city, because there is more traffic. He is asking for a loan to buy cell phone accessories and minutes.

Translate from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Edgar, es un microempresario joven, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo, el es dueño de un negocio que se dedica a la venta y activación de celulares, como así también tarjetas, en algunos casos también realiza reparación de celulares, el negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad de Caacupé, la atención de la misma lo realiza el personalmente, comenta que en el rubro de la telefonía actualmente hay mucha competencia y para hacer frente a esto uno debe ofrecer una muy atención y por sobre todo debe evacuar lo mas rápido posible los pedidos de los potenciales clientes.nLos préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de tarjetas para celulares y accesorios, esto le permitió tener bien surtido su negocio y así poder ofrecerle las variedades de productos y servicios que hoy día tiene el mundo de la telefonía celulares. nEl señor Edgar comenta que tiene pensado habilitar mas adelante una sucursal cerca de la basílica de Caacupé, ya que es el lugar mas visitados de la ciudad, por lo que la posibilidad de poder vender es mucho más que en cualquier otro lugar. nInvertirá su crédito en la compra de accesorios y saldo para celulares.n

loans.use: Buy phone cards and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Geoffy

texts.en:
“I am always bothered about how am I going to manage our family finances especially sinceI have 2 children who are still studying ”, says Geoffy M., 35-year old mother and food stall owner from Tibungco District, Davao City.
She is requesting a loan from CEV of $125 to purchase food ingredients as well as materials for her small food stall. Her husband has been helping her run the business which they hope will have them bigger earnings for their family. 

In an interview Geoffy said, “Our participation in the CEV program has helped both of us to work hand-in-hand to grow our investment”. She further states,  “ Now that we have joined CEV, we have easy access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance benefits they offer”.

loans.use: To purchase additional  ingredients and food materials

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia  y departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que mantiene económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró productos de belleza y joyas para venderlos ya que es consultora de belleza y distribuidora de joyas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive en casa alquilada con su familia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener más ganancias con las que  cubrirá las necesidades de su familia.
Yanet desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y sean profesionales
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the "Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo" Community Bank in Puno. She is 34 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 3 young children whom she supports. With her first S/. 300 loan, she purchased beauty products and jewelry to sell since she is a beauty consultant and a jewelery dealer. She has worked with the community bank for almost 2 years. She tells us that she lives in a rented house with her family. With this S/. 1,700 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase a larger quantity of beauty products to earn more income to cover her family's needs. Yanet wants to keep working so that her children continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Suciastini

texts.id:
Suciastini pada pinjaman periode kedua dari yayasan DINARI hanya dipergunakan untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Saat ini Suciastini sudah disibukan dengan memelihara tiga induk. Suciatini memiliki dua putrin yang masih balita, sehingga membuat ia belum berani untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Kedua putrinya Media dan Nadia masih memerlukan perhatian lebih.

Penghasilan dari suaminya kadang tidak cukup untuk keperluan setiap harinya.Dari penghasilan ternaknya Suciastini dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya. Dari ketiga ekor induknya dalam enam bulan dapat mendapatkan penghasilan bersih sekitar Rp. 4.000.000 s/d Rp.5.000.000 setelah menjual bibit babinya. Dari hasil ternak babi inilah Suciastini dapat memperoleh tambahan penghasilan.
texts.en:
Suciastini is planning to participate in her 2nd term of loan program with DINARI foundation. She is planning to use the loan money to buy pig feeds. At the moment she already has 3 breeding pigs.

Suciati is a mother of two toddlers, Media and Nadia, who require most of her time. Therefore she doesn't have enough time to expand her business.

Her husband's income is not enough to support the family, therefore her business in this pig raising activities helps her family a lot. She can earn a net profit of IDR 4 million to 5 million per 6 month period (around USD 380 - 480 semi annually).

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame    Safiatou  Djourté  est âgée de 39 ans, mariée elle vit  dans une famille monogamique avec  son mari et  ses 6 enfants dans le quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école, elle fréquenta la medersa et l’abandonna tôt. Elle s’initie au commerce auprès de sa maman qui vendait des habits. Rapidement  elle a compris les rouages du commerce. Après avoir mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenu, elle opta pour le commerce de chaussures qu’elle  mène depuis 2 ans dans le quartier Secoura près de l’usine GDCM. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une notoriété sans pareil car, elle est la seule vendeuse de chaussures dans cet environ. 
C’est dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande de sa clientèle qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est en relation  depuis 42 mois. Après avoir  3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et 2 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter 100 paires de chaussures, sur place au grand marché de Ségou auprès des grossistes.
Madame  Safiatou  Djourté  vend  en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra d’acheter une charrette et un réfrigérateur. Son ambition est d’avoir une compagnie de transport public (Djourté trans.)
texts.en:
Ms. Safiatou Djourté, age 39, is married and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and six children in the Sébougou district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, she attended the medersa and soon abandoned it. She got introduced to commerce by her mom, who used to sell clothing. She quickly understood all the ins and outs of the business. After having done many kinds of income-generating work, she opted for commerce in shoes, which she has been doing for two years in the Secoura district, near the GDCM factory. She enjoys a large customer base and unparalleled distinction because she is the only retailer of shoes in this area.

With plans to increase her working capital for coping with customer demands, she is turning to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she has been associated with for 42 months. After having received three solidarity loans (group loans) and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes, locally from wholesalers at the grand marketplace of Ségou. Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will enable her to buy a chart and a refrigerator. Her ambition is to have a public transport company (Djourté Trans.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a forty-nine-year-old businesswoman. She is divorced with three kids who are in school. She trades in students’ foam mattress and pillows. She obtains her supplies from the manufacturers and sells at retail prices. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of foam mattress and pillows to increase her stock.

Christiana says most of her customers are students. She makes good sales when the academic year begins. Her dreams are to expand her business to include additional stock like door mats, bedspreads, curtains etc. to meet the needs of her customers and make increased income.

Christiana aspires to give her children the best of education she can afford. She is a member of the community group called Miracle Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To procure students’ mattresses etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres. En los años de su niñez, conjuntamente con su padre lideraba la labor agrícola en sus tierras, mientras que sus hermanos eran fieles colaboradores, ahora que ellos formaron sus propias familias, su dinámica de trabajo ha mermado por la falta de apoyo; pero igual sigue esforzándose al lado de su padre. En la temporada anterior ha sembrado alverjas y su cosecha le ha sido muy gratificante, con las ganancias pudo comprar un becerrito para que luego de dos o tres años le supla en el arado a su toro actual. Javier está muy contento y no piensa dejar sus cultivos, ya que la mayoría de las veces le ha resultado ser rentable, lo que le ha permitido vivir tranquilamente. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para abonar sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Javier is 33 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house. In the years of his childhood, he helped his father lead the agricultural work on their land, while his brothers were loyal employees. Now that they have their own families, his work dynamic has weakened for lack of support, but he continues working alongside his father. In the previous season, he planted peas and his harvest was very rewarding--with his earnings, he was able to buy a calf that can pull his bull plow after two or three years. Javier is very happy and has no plans to quit agriculture, since the majority of the time it has been very profitable and has allowed him to live a quiet life. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he has always demonstrated punctuality in his payments. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en:
Dulmaa D. is 38, married and the mother of three. Dulmaa's family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian housing tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her youngest two sons attend elementary and high school.

Since 2002, together with her husband, Bat-Ochir, she has been running a clothing stall at the local market. She is a hard-working woman who tries her best to make a better life for her children. From her profit, she has bought electronic goods for her home and plans to buy a car soon. When she began her retail business, her working capital was 500,000 tugrugs and now as a result of hard work, it has increased to 2,000,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1,450 MNT).

She requests a loan to buy more men's and women's apparel to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Tomasa Virginia

texts.es: La Señorita Tomasa Virginia es originaria del la comunidad del Canton Paqui del departamento de Totonicapan, ella es operario en una tejeduria en donde se fabrican cortes, manteles, y otros los patrones se han dado cuenta que es una persona muy trabajador, le digieron que consiguiera capital que hiciera su propio negocio. Y que ellos lo estarian llevando con los clientes, para entregar su producto ella muy ilucionada necesita el apoyo de la institucion en un credito para la compra de materiales y herramientas.
texts.en:
Ms. Tomasa Virginia is a native of the Canton Paqui community, in the department of Totonicapan. She works in a textile factory, where she makes traditional skirts and tablecloths. Some of her supervisors noticed that she is a hardworking person, so they advised her to obtain capital so that she can start her own business. They said that they would sell her merchandise to the customers. She is very excited about this business, but she needs support in the form of a loan from this institution so that she can purchase work tools and materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. Bella is married and she has 6 school-age children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens and ducks for sale.

Bella joined ASKI to gain much-needed access to capital so that she could improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in various business activities. Bella is thus requesting a loan via ASKI in the amount of $100 (4,000 PHP) which will be invested in order to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines. ASKI is committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: La señora Olimpia G. reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, tiene 43 años de edad, con tres hijos uno independiente y dos que cursan sus estudios. Su negocio es  una pulpería que desde hace seis años logro poner a mucho esfuerzo, con ahorro de las tortillas que vendía, sus planes para su familia es poder ayudar a sus hijos  que sean unos profesionales para que puedan tener un nivel de vida mejor. Este crédito en Afodenic es el décimo ciclo el cual va invertir en comprar granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz y productos de limpieza para ofertar a sus clientes variedad, con esto espera aumentar las ventas y poder obtener mejores utilidades. Da las gracias  ala institución por los beneficios que ha obtenido en las mejora de su vivienda, a si como en el incremento de su inventario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olimpia G. lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is 43 years old with three children. One is independent and the other two are studying. Her business is a general store. After six years and a lot of effort, she has managed to open it with savings from the tortillas she used to sell. Her plans for her family are to help her children get a degree so they can have a better standard of living. This Afondenic loan is in the tenth cycle. She is going to invest it in the purchase of basic grains, such as beans and rice, and cleaning products to offer her clients variety. She hopes to increase sales and make a better profit. She thanks the institution for the aid she got for home improvements as well as to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains: beans, rice and cleaning products

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Обида Рахмонова  1965 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Муж Обиды не работает. Поэтому Обида устроилась продавщицей в магазине торговать одеждой. Со временем накопив не большой капитал ,заняла недорогое место для продажи начала с торговли мелочей носков , платков и различных вещей.  Вот уже пятый год торгует на рынке женской одеждой. Ей необходимо для развития торговли кредит, поэтому она решила получит кредит на  покупку летней одежды.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Obida R. is married and has 3 children. Obida’s husband does not work. This is why Obida got a salesperson job at a clothing store. With time, having saved a small capital, she got an inexpensive retail location and started with the sales of small items, such as socks, scarves and various things. It is now the fifth year since Obida started selling women’s clothing at the market. She needs a loan in order to grow her sales, thus, she decided to obtain this loan to buy summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Francisco Raul

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Raúl vive en compañía de su esposa la señora María de los Ángeles y un pequeñín hijo de edad escolar, la señora María de los Ángeles es empleada de una maquiladora con una antigüedad de 12 años como supervisora de línea, con una gran constancia siempre en lo que se propone. 
Don Francisco Raúl es chofer de un camioncito de transporte escolar desde hace 3 años. La gente lo conoce y confían en el ya que ha demostrado una gran responsabilidad hacia sus hijos.
La  solicitud de este crédito ya que su proyecto es liquidar la compra de este transporte, ya que meses anteriores lo compro porque el transporte que tenia ya era muy viejo y necesitaba un automóvil mas reciente.
texts.en:
Francisco Raúl lives with his wife, María de los Ángeles, and his small, school aged son. María de los Ángeles has worked for a factory for 12 years as a line supervisor. She always has great perseverance in what she does. Francisco Raúl has been a small school bus driver for three years. People know him and have confidence in him because he has demonstrated great responsibility with their children. He is asking for this loan to pay off this vehicle. He bought it months ago because the vehicle he had was very old, and he needed a more recent automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off his vehicle

loans.name: Zalmai Group

texts.en:
Zalmai is the group leader of the Zalmai group. There are three members in this group. They want to take a loan to progress their businesses and to make the businesses larger. They have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. 

Zalmai wants to take a loan for his taxi business. Shaema wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a fruit and vegetable shop. Raema wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a general store. They are very thankful for Kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: For expanding the businesses

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est née vers 1960 à Adjohoun au Sud du Bénin. Micheline est veuve et mère de huit enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Tous les huit enfants de Micheline ont été scolarisés, mais elle-même est analphabète. Micheline vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis quarante cinq ans. C’est la pâte de maïs que Micheline vent à son domicile. Micheline achète ses provisions à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Micheline a dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Micheline est à son sixième crédit avec ALIDé et rembourse bien ses prêts. Micheline sollicite ce prêt pour acheter en gros des sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Micheline was born around 1960 in Adjohoun in the south of Benin. Micheline is a widow and the mother of eight children whom she no longer has to take care of. All of Micheline’s eight children have received an education but she is illiterate. Micheline has lived with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin, for forty-five years. Micheline sells corn pasta from her home. Micheline buys provisions from Dantokpa, Benin’s big international market. Micheline has ten years’ experience in the business. This is Micheline’s sixth loan with Alidé and she repays her loans on time. Micheline is requesting this loan to buy sacks of corn in bulk.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn

loans.name: Emma Laura

texts.es:
La señora Emma  Gutiérrez P. es madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene que mantener, ya que desde hace años se separo de su marido aunque le ayuda no es mucho para el sostén de ellos. Emma trabaja en un correo como secretaria, aparte de esto renta local para las personas que venden pulga. Ahora tiene como proyecto construir varios locales para que las personas que venden estén en un techo sobre todo para que no sufran las inclemencias del tiempo. 
Para empezar este proyecto necesita material para la construcción y pagar mano de obra. Aparte de ayudar a estas personas en dar mas barato el local, tendría más ingresos para poder mantener a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Emma Gutiérrez P. is the mother of two children who she cares for. A few years ago she separated from her husband because he wasn't doing enough to help support the family. She works as a secretary for a post office, aside from this she also rents a location for flea market vendors. Now, she has a project to construct various places for the merchants to sell their wares in a fashion that they have a roof over their heads and don't suffer from the weather. To start this project, she needs money to pay for construction materials and labor. Aside from helping make the area cheaper to live in, she would have more opporotunities to care for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build sales stands

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en: Hasifa N. is a hard working and determined 41 year old. She is married and has eight children ranging from age 25 to 4 years, in addition to caring for orphans. She has been the proud owner of a retail shop and a bar in Kiyindi for eighteen years, although the bar started up later because of public demand. From both businesses, Hasifa earns about $156 a month that helps to care for her family, including the payment of school fees. She is helped greatly by the loans and is able to balance her account books. She wants to become big in business, educate her children to the higher levels, and also to build rental houses from which her children will earn something even after she is gone. Hasifa needs to recapitalize her business so that she will be able to save more.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more products and drinks.

loans.name: Jinja Misindye B Mirembe Robinah Group

texts.en: M. Robinah is the chairperson of her group loan. She is 38 years old and blessed with five children, two of whom are schooling. She has one dependent in school, too. She has been operating a canteen so far for three years and now she is requesting a loan to purchase canteen items, mostly edible items such as bread, milk, donuts, cakes, juices, sodas, biscuits, sweets, chocolates, etc., for sale. She wants the loan to help her to stock more and more canteen items for a large profit. Her future hope is the education of her children and well being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase food items for resale

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Parents are so concerned with the future of their children; they exert effort and sacrifice their time to earn a living for the sake of their children. Likewise, Mrs. Charlita M., with her husband, Mr. Benjamin M., of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya, are striving hard to support the education of their five children. Despite the economic crisis, they still have the strong faith and determination to uplift their standard of living and give their children a better future.

The couple earn a living through farming. They cultivate their farm by planting fruits and vegetables for two harvests. Since harvesting takes a long time, they need to have another source of income to finance the schooling of their children. In this regard, Charlita engaged in selling vegetables and fruit in their village. She sells them through house to house delivery and also to the market through retail. Every week, she earns a net income of Php 700 which they utilize to acquire their daily basic needs and for the schooling of their children.

Since her weekly income is not sufficient for the needs of the family, Charlita wants to sell more vegetables to earn a higher income. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital of Php 5,000 from ASKI to be used in acquiring more products for her vending business. She hopes that, through the continuous support of ASKI, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin C. is a responsible father who lives in a village located at Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Pacita C. and they are blessed with three children. They aim to uplift their living conditions to give their children a better future. They work hard and help each other to earn a living.

Franklin is a farmer. He tills their farm, planting rice and corn. After planting he uses his tricycle (local three-wheeled transport) to earn additional income while his wife is engaged in selling vegetables in their village. They earn an average income of P 6,000 a month which is used for their basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they want to earn more income to meet their basic needs. Franklin is applying for a loan from KIVA amounting to P 5,000 to be used in the maintenance of his "tricycle" and for the maintenance of his crops. He believes that this will be a great help for the improvement of their standard of living.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Canan

texts.en:
Canan A. is currently in the business of selling beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer. She is 42 years old and widowed; she has 7 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and the empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She is 47 years old and married with four children. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. This is the high season for her sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Victoria is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 50-year-old married woman, blessed with four children. Her oldest is now 23. She lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur, where most of the people are farmers. She is also a farmer. She cultivates her land, raising rice crops. She also makes ice candies and sells them to her neighbors. She believes that if she works hard enough, she could be successful someday.

Rosela joined CEVI in 2008. She likes its program and said that it is a big help to farmers like her. She is now applying for a loan of Php 9,000. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Chheuy

texts.en: Chheuy S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 2000, she has been selling fish at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about $8 a day. Her husband is a rice farmer, and on average he is able to make $2 a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students and one who is a receptionist at a local hotel. Chheuy S. is asking for a loan of $800 so that she can purchase a motorbike for transporting fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is from the village of Padul, Solana, Cagayan. She is 33 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Elizabeth is married and has three young children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma Q., age 40, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alberto Q., a self-employed man, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own burger shop while selling other products.		

Alma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance on her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.	     

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buy raw ingredients that she needs for her burger stand and other products that she is going to sell.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her burger stand and other products to sell.

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en:
Cesarie is 28 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 4 years old. She and her family live in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Cesarie is a proven entrepreneur wholesaling cartons of clean water and hygiene paper. She has been in this business for about twelve years. She is very enthusiastic about her business because it helps in her daily life. Her business hours are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Cesarie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. She plans to add to the quantity of her existing business and also add a new business wholesaling some cosmetics products including soaps, body lotions, etc.

If this plan is successful, Cesarie will hopefully earn more profits than with her previous business. With these profits, she will use one portion for further reinvestment in her business and the other portion will be used in building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her business and for a new wholesale business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto C. López, es  una persona de 58 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, el tiene cinco   hijos a su cargo,  y tres de ellos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es acompañado, ha trabajado once créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para el cambio de techo de su casa de habitación, por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ernesto dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ernesto C. López is 58 years old. He works as a security guard in the Iván Montenegro de Managua market. Ernesto has 5 children in his care, 3 of them school-aged, and has a partner. Ernesto has worked with 11 loans from CEPRODEL in 8 years. In this period of time he has invested 11 loans in improving his home where he lives, thanks to the finance granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is seeking is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, tiles, and paint, to change the roof of his house as it is in bad condition. The objective of improving his house is to give better security and standards of living to his children. Ernesto said that the loans granted to him have been to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 38-year old talented lady. She prepares handmade items Chingair (It’s an urdu term used in Asian countries for keeping breads hot). This is a high demand in people and it looks attractive when the bread serves in it to the guests. She prepares veritable chingairs with different designs and colors. She prepares 5 sets per day and sells to the community and generates income.

Her husband name is M. A. who has a furniture selling business. He sells specifically chairs and tables in the market. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 10,000 on every month. Asia is applying for a loan to buy furniture to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy furniture (wooden chairs & tables)

loans.name: Samol

texts.en:
Mrs. Samol P. is 55 years old and lives in Lvea Sa Leu village in Kandal province. She is a food seller who is able to earn some money from this business to support her family.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Samol P. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy food stand supplies for selling food.

Mrs. Samol P. is a widow with two children who are all seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy food stand supplies for selling rice

loans.name: Francacio

texts.en:
Francacio G. is from the village of Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old and is single. Francacio owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Francacio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Francacio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his sixth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Mavlakat

texts.ru: Баротова Мавлакат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж, работает водителем. Сама Мавлакат более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Сначала торговала на рынке. Сейчас у нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Mavlakat B. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. Mavlakat has been involved in retails sales for over 10 years. She first started selling at a market and now has a store, where she sells food products. She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is currently in the business of selling bags of groundnuts and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize to sell.  Grace is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a real store for her goods.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Unity Family Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Unity Family” group. They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 600,000 each from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni. 

Mabinty O. (pictured second from the right) is the leader of this group. Mabinty was born in a village near Magburaka. She is approximately 45 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have seven children. Mabinty sells poyo (palm wine – wine tapped from palm trees), palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and groundnuts (peanuts). She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Mabinty would like to buy gallons of palm wine and palm oil and bags of groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm wine and palm oil and bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Adriano S. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, é casado pai de 7 filhos de 18,20,22,26,28,30 e 32 anos três mais novos é que vão a escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, responsabiliza se pelos seus dois netos que vivem com ele.


Adriano sai de Gaza para Maputo aprocura de emprego, apos sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregado doméstico e estudava de noite,hoje é docente já reformado a mais de 8 anos recebendo 3.034.36mt mensalmente. Para alêm da reforma, trabalha na quinta como jardinheiro auferindo 1.800.00mt por mês. Também é criador de pintos, proprietário de uma capoeira onde cria em média 3 caixas alternadamente gastando 20.000.00mt e tendo de lucro 9.000,00mt caso não haja muito frio, o mesmo aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.   

Já teve empréstimo no BIM no valor de 30.000.mt que esta quase a findar. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Adriano na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos de criação para revenda. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo, e na base deste empréstimo, analizar se vale a pena criar com empréstimo para poder aceder a outros.
texts.en:
Adriano Hortencia was born in the Province of Gaza, South of Mozambique. He is married and father to 7 children who are 18, 20, 22, 26, 28, 30 and 33. The three youngest are the ones who go to school. He lives in his own home with his family. He also supports his two grandchildren who live with him. Adriano left Gaza for Maputo looking for a job. After getting there he stared working as a domestic worker and studying evenings. Today he is a retired teacher and has been making 3,034.56 meticais per month for more than 8 years. Besides earning his pension, he works as a gardener making 1,800 meticais per month. He also raises chicks owning a chicken coop where he raises on average 3 boxes. He spends 20,000 meticais making a profit of 1,800 meticais per month in case the weather is not too cold. He uses the money for household expenses and manages to put some money in his savings account. He has had a loan in the amount of 30,000 meticais with BIM, which is almost paid for. This is loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais, is Adriano's first with Hluvuku and Kiva. He intends to buy chicks to raise and resell. He is confident that he will pay the loan back ahead of time. Based on this loan, he will assess if it is worth it to raise chicks with loans before requesting others.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Juana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Juana del Pilar T. P. tiene 33 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 niños, de casi 3 años a 14 años.

Juana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Juana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas y Pechincha cada 6 meses (hay 2 cosechas al año aquí en la Costa). 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos, semillas y abonos. Piensa que su vida cambiara con apoyo del préstamo, porque el interés es mínimo con la Cooperativa y la ganancia es mayor que los otros prestamos afuera. Sus sueños son tener su negocio propio (una tienda) y tener una casa propia (ahora vive en la casa de sus papas). Enfrenta enfermedades en el maíz (langosta) 

Le gusta leer la Biblia, ver la televisión, escuchar música y ayudar a los deberes de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana del Pilar T. P., age 33, lives in a common-law marriage in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. She has three children ranging in age from almost 3 years to 14 years. Juana is a member of the “Recinto San Ramón” (San Ramón Neighborhood) Communal Bank. It is located in Nuevo San Ramón 20 kilometers from Venanas. There are 20 members in all. They are working with short growing cycle crops (harvest in six months). This is their first loan with the Cooperativa. Juana works in agriculture; she grows corn and rice. She makes her sales in Ventanas and Pechincha every six months (in La Costa there are two harvests a year). She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer. She thinks that her life will change with the help of the loan. She thinks this because the interest with the Cooperativa is minimal, and the gain is greater than other outside loans. Her dreams are to have her own business (a store) and to have her own house (now she lives in her parents’ house). The corn crop faces diseases (locust). She likes to read the Bible, watch television, listen to music, and help her children with their chores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. C. lives in the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old, married and has six grown children. To make a living, she runs a general store where her customers come buy items they use daily such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 110,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Nem S., 63, is a motor-taxi driver in the local market of Kampong Cham province. His wife is a farm worker, growing rice and vegetables. On average, she is able to make less than US$ 1 per day. This couple has one child who is employed as a worker. Nem S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase another motorbike so that his son can operate a motor-taxi as he does.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila M. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Dometila owns & operates a food business, making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Dometila has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Dometila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Dometila is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people make up this village bank loan located in Slab Ta Aon village, Kandal province. Koem C. is a 52-year-old married woman and was selected as the village bank president by the members. The members of this village loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Koem C. earns her living by selling fruit in the local market, while her husband, Mr. Aem Sarin, works as a soldier where he receives a small salary to support the family. In order to increase the family's income, Koem C. will use her portion of the loan from AMK to buy more fruit to sell. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy pig food and piglets for raising. 

This couple has four children. Two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the others are students in the local school. They also help their mother with her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell, and to buy piglets for raising and pig food.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Juvelyn is married and has one child. To make a living, Juvelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products. Juvelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juvelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juvelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan is her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help field partners post their loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of food supplies for her business

loans.name: Jaime Jorge

texts.es:
Jaime Jorge C. A. tiene 25 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

JAIME  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

JAIME se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa, carro y terrenos para tener sus animales.
Le gustaría que la cooperativa le siga apoyando.
texts.en:
Jaime Jorge C. A. is 25 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and  two children in Guaranda canton in Bolívar province.

Jaime is a member of the Casaiche Chilipamba solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs.  The group has 20 members.

Jaime grows corn, beans and potatoes and raises dairy cows.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for sowing corn, beans and potatoes and also animals to fatten and then sell.  The support of the loan will help him to fulfil his family's financial needs.  His dream is to be able to buy a house, car and land for his animals.  He would like Cooperativa San José to continue supporting him.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  To buy animals to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora; La socia tiene 44 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la venta de útiles escolares, ella aprovecha las campañas para comprar al por mayor los diferentes útiles y venderlos en la época adecuada. La socia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, ella desea el crédito para comprar en esta campaña escolar y de este modo tener almacenado los útiles. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de útiles escolares.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This individual is part of the “Los Diamantes” [Diamonds] communal bank.  The communal bank is in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province in Cusco.  Her name is Dora and she is 44 years old.  She is single and has three children.  She sells school supplies, and takes advantage of sales campaigns to purchase different items wholesale, and then sell them in the appropriate period.  

Dora is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman who wants this loan for purchases during the school campaign period, so that she will have school supplies in storage.

She appreciates and values the loan and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45-year-old married man, the father of three children, who has been working for 30 years as a car mechanic. This business is his only source of living. 

What differentiates his business from others is that Mohamad doesn’t have a maintenance garage; he is a mobile mechanic. When others call him for help, he goes to fix their cars. He believes that for a person to succeed, he must provide good service for his clients, and that’s what he provides.

Mohamad's long experience makes him recommended by most of his clients all over the region. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools for his business. Mohamad hopes to open his own mobile car mechanic services that can cover a wider area with a big number of employees.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is 30 years old and married to a primary school teacher. They have two children who are two and six years old.  Ange sells women clothes, and she has been doing this business for eight years. 

Ange decided to request this loan due to the growth of her business, and she needs to buy more women's clothes to sell. She said that the profit from her business will be used for savings because she has a lot of things to pay for in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson S. M. tiene 53 años y vive con su esposa y una nieta en la urbanización Villas De San Pablo de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Logró adquirir su casa a través de un subsidio que recibió del estado. Esta urbanización es  el primer macroproyecto de vivienda  en Colombia liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en asocio con el gobierno local y nacional. El microempresario es albañil de profesión y desde hace 18 meses tiene una pequeña ferretería que funciona en su residencia y en la cual vende materiales de construcción, artículos eléctricos y herramientas. En un principio el inventario y las ventas eran bajos, pero han crecido mes a mes porque cada vez hay más familias viviendo en el barrio y casi todas remodelan sus casas. En la atención del negocio, se turna con su esposa quien también presta el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos fijos y celular. Este es el primer crédito que tramita en la Fundación y planea invertirlo en comprar cemento,  ladrillos, láminas para techos y accesorios para tuberías en P.V.C. Esos son los artículos que más vende. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 120.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 35%.  El señor Nelson se declara un hombre afortunado porque ha sobrevivido a dos graves accidentes en motocicletas que le produjeron varias fracturas. Hoy está plenamente recuperado y no le quedaron secuelas. A principio del próximo año visitará un hijo que vive en la ciudad de Cali y su compañera quedará al frente del negocio por una semana.  En un futuro no muy lejano piensa construir un segundo piso en su residencia para separar su vivienda del negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mr Nelson S. M. is 53 and lives with his wife and a granddaughter in the Villas de San Pablo development of the city of Barranquilla. He was able to acquire his house through a subsidy that he received from the state. This development is the first housing macroproject in Colombia lead by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in association with the local and national governments. Nelson is a bricklayer and has had a small hardware store in his home for 18 months, where he sells construction materials, electronic items and tools. In the beginning the inventory and sales were low, but they have grown month by month because each time there are more families living in the neighbourhood and almost all of them are remodeling their homes. He and his wife take turns working in the store. His wife also provides a landline and cell phone service. This is Nelson's first loan with the Fundacion, and he plans to invest it buying cement, bricks and laminates for roofs, and accessories for PVC tubes. These are the items that he sells the most. His daily sales average $120,000 COP and the margin of utility is 35%. Nelson says he is a lucky man because he has survived two serious motorcycle accidents that left him with various fractures. Today he is fully recovered and he has no lasting consequences. In the beginning of next year he will visit a son who lives in the city of Cali, and his wife will stay and look after the business for one week. In the near future he plans to build a second floor in his home to separate the living area from the business, thus improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and laminates for roofs and accessories for PVC pipe

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a 38 years old housewife and lives with her family in a 3 room brick house in a city Faisalabad which is a well known for its textile industry in Pakistan. Her house is located in the area of Mai-de-jughi where she came with her family 09 years ago. 

Her husband’s name is M. B. and he is a fruit vendor by profession. He puts the fruits on his four-wheeled cart on every day morning and sells by visiting different streets of the city. His fruits are fresh and of good taste and that’s why he makes good sales every day. 

Perveen has given birth to 7 children, 4 sons and 3 daughters. All of them study except the eldest and youngest one. Her eldest son helps his father in his business while her youngest son is 8 years old and has not started attending school yet. Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband for the expansion of his fruit selling business. By utilizing the loan money her husband will buy some fresh quality fruits for selling through his four-wheeled cart. Perveen is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will be increased.
