She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. With her previous loan, she has built a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Perveen”.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits for selling

loans.name: Bellaflor

texts.en:
Bellaflor A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Bellaflor is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Bellaflor operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Bellaflor has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bellaflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bellaflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Bellaflor is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be Bellaflor's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Mr. Chreng Y. and his wife, Mrs. Kheang Oum, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They and have five sons and one daughter. 

Chreng and his wife produce rice wine and have raised pigs for 15 years. He applied for a Kiva loan once before; he hopes to continue expanding his business so he is applying for his second loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Producing rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 48 años, está casada hace 29 años con Marcelo; con quien tiene 4 hijos. Pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Perene (selva central peruana). Como madre dedicada al progreso de sus hijos. Desde hace 10 se dedica a la venta de tamales, como también a la siembra de productos de pan llevar como: plátanos, yuca. Según afirma ya es conocida por su trabajo, pues ella misma prepara los tamales que vende de casa en casa a los habitantes de su localidad, vendiendo un promedio de 50 unidades diarias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, son los halagos que recibe por su exquisita sazón. Mientras que por las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, los cuales le ayudan a solventar algunos gastos extra, ya que los mismos compradores llegan a sus terrenos a comercializar su cosecha. Su principal  dificultad es solventar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ahora está invirtiendo en la culminación de los estudios de mecánica de uno de ellos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los integrantes de su asociación. Esther, está pensando renovar sus cultivos, por ello con el crédito comprará varias plantitas de toda variedad de cítricos con los cuales hará injertos para que obtenga variedad en sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and has been married to Marcelo for 29 years.  They have 4 children but only live with 2 of them.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of Perene (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Esther is a mother who is committed to the progress of her children.  For 10 years she has been selling tamales.  She also grows crops such as bananas and cassava.  She tells us that she is well known for her work since she prepares the tamales that she sells door to door to local people herself.  She sells, on average, 50 units a day.  What Esther most likes about her work is the praise that she receives for her delicious seasoning. 

In the mornings, Esther takes care of her crops which help her to cover some extra expenses.  Her purchasers come to her to buy her harvested crops.  Her main difficulty is paying for her children's university studies.  She is currently paying for the end of a degree course in mechanics for one of her children.

Esther is a member of the 'Los Soñadores' (The Dreamers) community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the support that she receives from the members of her association.  Esther is planning to renew her crops.  She will use her loan to buy several small plants of different varieties of citrus fruits which she will graft so that she can obtain variety in her plantings.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 50 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ofelia de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Jairo de 8 y Angy de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Raúl ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Raúl is 50 years old and a very hard-working and happy person. He lives in his own home along with his wfie Ofelia, 35, and their two beloved children, 8-year-old Jairo and 5-year-old Angy, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Working arduously, Raúl has been able to make progress with his fields of crops. He gets up early every morning to water and provide the proper care to his banana and coffee crops, which he later will sell in the city of Pichanaki, since that's where his products fetch the best prices. What he likes most about his job is the freedom of working out in the lush fields. He has 24 years' experience in this activity and the thing he considers to be the most difficult is working on the land all day and not having much time for other interests. In the future, he wants to adapt his lands to raise citrus crops, since at this time those are the best products to sell. This is his fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that the loan will really help his business' progress and development. It's for this reason he is ready to make all his loan payments on time. He is a very responsible and respected member of his community bank. With the loan of 2,500 soles, he plans to purchase fertilizer for his his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child.  He runs a boda boda (motorbike) transport business.  He was previously working as a driver.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business record keeping.  This has helped him to run his business well.  He hopes to build apartments within five years.  He has requested  70,000 Kes to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a young mother of two daughters and two sons. Sabah wants to purchase beds and daughters' room items as they are growing up and need to have a proper room.

Sabah took out a loan from FATEN to pay for those items as her husband is an employee with a very decent salary and can only afford a small payment every month that FATEN helped him get.

Sabah's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for their daughters' bedroom.

loans.name: Ufani Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad nació en la ciudad del Ayacucho, tiene 43 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace varios meses atrás que trabaja como ejecutiva en la Organización Clásica (Clásica se encarga de vender utensilios de cocina). Ella también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Desde hace 10 años que tiene la tienda y por el momento en las mañanas sus hijos atienden el negocio y ella por las tardes. Ella siempre compra mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en tarro y otras cosas más para así abastecer la tienda.   

Ella tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar y otras cosas más.

Soledad es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante sus hijos y su sueño es abrir una distribuidora de venta de utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in the town of Ayacucho. She is 43 years old and lives in Cusco with her three children. She has worked for several months as an executive with Clásica, a company that sells cooking utensils. Soledad also runs a small grocery business from her home. She’s had this business for ten years, and right now her children look after the store in the morning and she does the afternoons. She buys merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and canned milk to sell in the store.

Soledad has a loan with Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is very happy to know that she has this financial support and has always been very responsible with paying back the loan. She is also pleased to be part of the ‘Templo del Inca’ Community Bank because the members are responsible people and very committed.

Soledad wishes to thank all those who contribute to her loan which will be very useful in helping her with the business. With the money she will buy rice, sugar, pasta etc.  She is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is helping her children make their way in the world. Her dream is to open a distributorship for the sale of cooking utensils.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta etc

loans.name: Julio Demetrio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio Demetrio; el tiene 71 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería y el negocio de internet, el socio en el negocio de librería vende lapiceros,colores,cuadernos y entre otros útiles escolares y el negocio de internet trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de internet y negocio de librería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos repuestos de su computadora y para comprar mercadería para la librería.
                                          
              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julio Demetrio belongs to the Kanchary Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Julio Demetrio, age 71, is a widower; and he has six children.  He alternates his daily activities with his bookstore and his Internet business.  He sells pencils, crayons, notebooks, and other school supplies.  He works in his Internet business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  It is through these small businesses that he gets his children ahead.

He wants to expand and improve his Internet business and his bookstore business.  He is requesting the loan to buy some computer replacement parts and to buy merchandise for his bookstore.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy some computer replacement parts and to buy merchandise for his bookstore.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 59 years old and widowed.

Merlina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Merlina has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chuo

texts.en: Mr. Chuo, 36 years old, lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh. He has a small kiosk where he sells Khmer noodles to his neighbors and other people in and around his community. He generates a profit about US $3 a day to help support his family’s expenses. Mr. Chuo was married but he is divorced from his wife and now lives with his mother, a homemaker, who controls the household and the cash flow. Mr. Chuo has four teenaged children, two of whom are employed in different jobs. Mr. Chuo will be using all of this requested loan money to purchase a pumping machine and to plant lotus.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine and to plant lotus.

loans.name: Fatima De Los Angeles

texts.es: Fátima madre soltera, humilde trabajadora, emprendedora tiene su propio negocio desde hace un tiempo iniciándolo con fondos de micro créditos. Sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, seguir mejorando  su negocio es unos de los principales planes. Como dificulta ha encontrado el alza de precios.  A corto plazo la construcción de su vivienda siendo de urgencia para la protección de su familia. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedrines, bloques, piedras cantera, arena, tablones de madera, estribu, alambre de amarre entre otros materiales.  Para la construcción del muro. Obteniendo seguridad.
texts.en:
Fátima is a single mother.  She is humble, hard-working, and enterprising.  She has had her business for some time.  She started it with funds from micro loans.  Her children help her financially.  One of her main plans is to continue improving her business.

A difficulty she has encountered is the rise in prices.  In the short term, building her house is urgent in order to protect her family.

She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement, iron, gravel, cement blocks, quarry stones, planks of wood, struts, and support straps, among other materials.  These materials are to build a wall in order to be safe.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás oriundo de valle grande, vive con la Sra. Yanet y tienen un hijo, su domicilio es alquilado vive en la zona el torno, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja en el torno, hace unos tres años se dedica a esta labor, donde le va muy bien con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, ahora su esposa esta queriendo incursionar en la venta de ropa, así de esta manera poder colaborar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, por este motivo solicito el crédito  para compra de mercadería para que venda su esposa, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Nicolás is a native of the grand valley and lives with Yanet and their son in a rented home.  He lives in the Torno zone and drives a moto-taxi.  He works in El Torno and has been doing this for about three years.  Things are going well for him and he supports his family.  Now his wife wants to begin selling clothing so that she can also contribute to the household expenses.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise that his wife can sell.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given him.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and separated from her husband. She has one daughter who lives separately from her. Her occupation is selling clothes, specifically women's undergarments. She sells a wide variety of underwear and brassieres and also some pajamas. She sells her merchandise in a large market in the city of Quillabamba. 

Dominga has had this business for over ten years and is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise. Dominga is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Erna has a tailoring shop that repairs and sews office and school uniforms. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for tailoring. Erna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy material needed for tailoring

loans.name: Tuana

texts.en:
Tuana is 26 years of age and married with one child. Tuana owns and operates a taxi-driving business venture. She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Tuana is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase car parts for her vehicle. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Tuana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tuana's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase car parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 52 years old and married with six children.  He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream for his family is to construct a better house for his family and also educate his children.  Stephen sells tea and has been in this business for the last twenty years.  He has not had any major hardships, and his dream is to be a tea wholesaler.  Stephen needs this loan to buy tea to sell.

loans.use: to buy tea to sell.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is 61 years old, married, and has three children. Romualda is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice to sell. 

Romualda is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a better income so she can continue supporting her family. She also wishes for her children to finish their studies and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is a married man. He has 4 children with two currently enrolled in school. His wife works as a homemaker and does farming on the side. Nassoro operates a medicinal supplies business and sells his goods from home. He's worked in this business for 10 years and was previously employed as a religion teacher. His primary customers are neighbors and the surrounding community. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His other source of income includes construction activities. He describes his greatest business challenge to be customers' low purchasing power. His largest monthly expense is the water bill. 

Nassoro will use the Kes 30,000 loan to expand the business and purchase additional medicines. He aspires to open his own medicine shop in the future. He joined Yehu because they're clear and open about the provided services.

loans.use: To expand the business and purchase additional medicines.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with five children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanasiti has operated a leso (kanga, or traditional African cloth) selling business for the past nine years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its favorable policies.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of lesos (African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past year, Hellen has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells food.

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for cooking for resale, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and buy medication for her mother. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a big hotel. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hellen's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. María Eva pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de Café”, del Distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos, el  mayor tiene 26 años es independiente y la  menor tiene 11 años de edad y cursa el 5to de primaria.

Por iniciativa de su ex cuñada incursiona en la venta de productos de belleza,  tenía cierto temor y pensaba que no iba a vender nada ya que en ese entonces se dedicaba a la venta de pollos eviscerado, decide dejar de vender pollos por la competencia e iniciar otro negocio, vender prendas de vestir, pero no le fue tan bien. 
Actualmente vende productos de belleza por catálogos. Inició con un capital de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles de sus ahorros. Además vende chupetes (helado de hielo), gelatinas, flan y cocadas, buscando con ello generar sus propios ingresos y así  apoyar en la economía de su hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más cosméticos e incrementará su stock de productos como: lápices labiales, talcos para el  cuerpo, perfumes, colonias, suampos, cremas faciales, y así satisfacer sus necesidades a sus clientes, amigos (as), familiares y vecinos. 
La Sra. María Eva anhela adquirir más productos de belleza para generar más ganancias, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. María Eva is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Café” (Coffee Flower) which is located in the District of Soritor, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Her older child is 26 years old and independent, while her younger child is 11 years old and in the fifth grade.

María Eva began selling beauty products after receiving encouragement from her former sister-in-law. At the time, she feared that she would not be able to sell anything because she also had a business selling butchered chickens. She later decided to stop selling chickens because of the competition and to start another business of selling clothes, but that venture did not do well.

María Eva currently sells beauty products through catalogs. She started with capital of 700 PEN from her savings. In addition, she sells popsicles, gelatins, flan, and coconut candies. She looks for ways to generate her own income in order to help with the household finances.

With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy more cosmetics and increase her stock of products such as lip pencils, body powders, perfumes, colognes, shampoos, and facial crèmes so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers, friends, relatives, and neighbors.

Sra. María Eva wants to acquire more beauty products so that she can generate more income. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, body powders, perfumes, colognes, shampoos, and facial crèmes.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete Group in Western Kenya! Ruth is the facilitator of the Njete group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ruth takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a good maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Ruth will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Njete group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, Administra un taller de reparación de equipo electrónico, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos, su familia depende de él, este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, trabajando en su casa y a domicilio, no tiene un horario fijo. Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de herramientas para trabajar, ya que tiene que comprarlas porque se le están dañando las que tiene por la antigüedad.
Este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de la familia, ya que quiere comprar en un futuro su propia casa.
texts.en:
José runs an electronic equipment repair shop.  He lives with his wife and two children.  His family depends on him.  He learned this work on his own initiative, working in his house at home.  He does not have a fixed schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools for work, since he has to buy them because the ones he has are breaking because they are old.

This loan will help him improve his business and satisfy the needs of his family, because in the future he wants to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy tools for work.

loans.name: Ludys Estefany

texts.es: Ludys vive en el municipio de Malambo y es madre de 2 niños en las edades de 9 a 13 años; allí tiene dos negocios,  vende mercancía variada y también ofrece los servicios de telecomunicaciones, negocio que inició con el fin de apoyar a los gastos de su hogar y fortalecer su gestión de bienestar.  Cundo dio curso a su idea emprendedora,  arrendó un local e inició vendiendo minutos a celulares,  posteriormente como le fue bien, compró computadores y un fax para agregar a su oferta, dos servicios por los cuales sus clientes preguntaban usualmente y en el sector no había respuesta a ello. Su meta actual de crecimiento la inclina a solicitar un credikiva, para comprar dos computadores mas e incrementar su oferta, así mismo invertirá en lencería y artículos para el hogar, aprovechando la gran demanda de vacaciones y de fin de año,lleno de festividades familiares, que incrementan su demanda,en ambos negocios,  lo cual hace que el capital de trabajo sea  insuficiente para responder  a las expectativas de su clientela. Su sueño es educar con calidad a sus dos hijos ,para que en un futuro sean potencialmente exitosos, pues ellos son el mayor motor que los impulsa  a levantarse día a día, para  trabajar fuertemente con tal de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ludys lives in the municipality of Malambo. She is the mother of 2 children who are 9 and 13 years old. She has two businesses there. She sells a variety of merchandise and she also offers telecommunications services, which she started with the goal of helping out with the expenses for her household and to provide for their wellbeing. When she put her enterprising idea into motion she rented a location and started selling cell phone minutes. Later, since things went well for her, she bought computers and a fax to add them to her offerings. These were two services that her customers were always asking about and there were no other business with them in the area. 

Her current goal to grow her business has motivated her to request a loan to buy two more computers and also other things for sale. She will buy linens and items for the home, taking advantage of the high demand during the end-of-the-year vacations, which are full of family festivities that increase demand in both of her businesses. Her working capital is not sufficient to respond to the expectations of her customers. 

Her dream is to educate her two children well so that in the future they can be successful. They are what motivate her to get up day after day to work hard so she can achieve it.

loans.use: to buy two computers and also linens and items for the home

loans.name: Tatasia Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tatasia” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 4,800,000 SLL for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. Mabinty is thirty-six years old and married with three children. Mabinty sells market food – palm oil, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Mabinty will invest in her business by buying palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business.

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 27-year-old married man. He describes himself as a determined and ambitious man. He operates a motorcycle providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are residents and business people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent accidents along the road making it hard to pass restricted areas with customers. 

Stephen will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy another motorbike to meet customer demand. His business goal is to expand his business by running a motorcycle showroom for the display of motorcycles for sale within five years. He hopes to buy land for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 50-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. For the past 20 years, she sells dried fish to the community to earn a living with the help of her husband. She and her husband need to work everyday to support their children. Mercy is determined to continue improving her business for their future. She wants to have better lives. With the help of her loan, she will be able to buy more fresh fish that will be processed to make dried fish. She also buys additional dried fish to other vendors to sell. In this way, she will improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and dried fish

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Mrs Elise O. was born at Lome on June 10, 1959. Married and a mother of four children, she also takes care of two other children. She sells corn transformed into \"ama\" paste. She has almost ten years of experience in this area. She offers a good quality service and thus is appreciated by her clients. With her managment skills developed she manages to get an acceptable revenue from her little business which allows her to support her family (primarily, schooling for her children). Today Mrs O. has a strong customer demand which she cannot satisfy. The money that her husband a taxi driver offers, does not allow her to expand her production. Mrs Elise O. requests a loan of $750 which she will use to purchase a stock of corn in order to increase production of \"ama\" and to be able to satisfy her clients. That will undoubtly improve her revenue and improve the conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc, a Kiva Volunteer

Madame O. Elise est née à Lomé le 10 Juin 1959. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de maïs transformé en pâte « ama ». Elle fait cette activité depuis bientôt 10 ans et a acquis une grande expérience dans le domaine. Elle offre un service de grande qualité et donc apprécié par ses clients. Avec son sens développé de gestion, elle arrive à tirer un revenu acceptable de son petit commerce qui lui permet de participer aux charges du ménage (scolarisation des enfants notamment). Aujourd’hui, Mme O. a une demande très forte qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire. L’aide financier de son mari, chauffeur de taxi moto, ne lui permet pas d’augmenter sa production. Madame O. Elise sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et le stockage de maïs afin d’augmenter la production de « ama » et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. Cela améliorera à coup sûr son revenu et par ricochet les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a stock of corn

loans.name: Meshuge

texts.en:
Meshuge is a 68 years old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village. She is married and has 3 children.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $600 to buy a meaty calf.
The second loan of $800 she spent to buy 2 calves and a heifer. 
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.en:
Maria Estela is married with four children, two of whom are married, and the other two live with her. Ten years ago, Estela began her business in cheese sales, because at the time, her children were in school and her husband's salary was not enough to cover expenses. Little by little, she has grown her business and now she is a direct client of a cheese distributor because of her great sales.

Honesty, responsiblity and hard work are some of Estela's personal qualities. Now she needs a $475 loan which she will use to buy merchanside to meet the demand of her clients and continue growing her business. She is committed to repaying her loan in 6-12 months. Estela needs your collaboration, and she thanks you for whatever support you can offer. Choose to participate.

Translated by Bianca V., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Estela es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos están casados y los otros dos viven con ella, hace diez años Estela inició su propio negocio con la venta de quesos, ya que es aquel tiempo sus hijos se encontraban estudiando y el salario de su esposo resultaba insuficiente para todos los gastos. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora ya es cliente directa de la distribuidora de quesos, por lo que obtiene una mejor ganancia.

Honestidad, responsabilidad y mucho trabajo son algunas de las características de Estela, ahora requiere un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora con su negocio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Estela necesita de tu colaboración, y agradece cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarle, decídete a .ayudarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nhiem

texts.en:
Nhiem's family has 7 members; she and her husband grow rice and cassava and work as day laborers. Their land is far from their house so they bought a motorbike for transportation. They borrowed $ 321.50 from a bank for the poor for their farm. The children are all in school, except the youngest child who is 2 years old. One of their children (Anh) got a Viet Nam Plus scholarship last year. Their average income is $ 12 per month per person.

Nhiem wants to borrow $75 to invest in their cassava plants. She intends to pay back the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: planting cassava

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van Vannack, 28, and her husband, 25, live in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia with their child. Mrs. Van Vannack earns US$3 a day as a tailor, while her husband earns US$2.50 a day as a construction worker and a farmer. She would like to receive a loan of US$500 to purchase a water pumping machine and another plot of land to farm. This will help to boost the family's earnings by increasing the amount of vegetables her husband can grow and sell.

loans.use: Purchase of a water pumping machine and a plot of farm land

loans.name: Shukufe

texts.en:
D. Shukufa is a 42-year-old. She is from Corat settlement of Sumgayit City. She is the mother of three children. She is a farmer. She started his business in 2006 when she purchased five sheep with money she had saved up. She is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy.  She buys sheep and lambs and raises them in a half-year. The work is interesting, but it is time consuming and takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. 

She would like to receive a $400 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand this business, which will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat S., aged 25, sells fresh water and soft drinks at a stand and earns about $2.50 a day.  Her husband earns $2.50 a day as a taxi-conductor.  The couple has three young children.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase motorbike for her to start a taxi business.  They plan to save the additional income generated from the business to help fund their children’s education when they start school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Donatilda, Alfonsa, and Susana have been part of the community bank “Virgen Maria” for 5 years, 4 months, and 8 years respectively. In the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to invest wisely in their businesses. They have also learned how to care for their children, have a positive relationship with their husbands, and to always smile.

Donatilda is 60 years old and is a single mother. She has four children, two of whom live with her. Donatilda sells fruit in the markets in the towns of Pampas and Ceccelambras. At the market she buys grains to sell in Ayacucho; she has had this business for three years.

Alfonsa is 30 and lives with her husband and three children. She owns a booth in the high school where she sells cookies and soft drinks. Furthermore, during school vacations she travels to other markets to buy grains and animals, which she sells in Ayacucho.

Susana is 50 years old. She is married and has 10 children, six of whom live with her. Susana sells bread, fruit, and vegetables in the markets around Ayacucho. From the markets she buys cheese, sheep, roosters, and grains to sell in Ayacucho. She learned this business from her grandmother.

Their loans are for 400, 800, and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying bread, plantains, oranges, apples, avacados, sheep, pork, cheese, and potatoes.

They plan to use their savings to educate their children; decorate their homes; and treat illnesses. Donatilda dreams of having a roof for her house, and educating her children, while Alfonsa dreams of buying land to cultivate, having a bigger business, and having enough to eat. Susana dreams that her children will get married and be able to build their own houses.

loans.use: invest in and expand their various businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 cases of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Donatilda's Group

texts.es:
Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda have belonged to the Banco Comunal “Llapanchik”, which means "Everybody" in Quechua, for 8 months, 3 years, and 3 years respectively.

Sulma lives with her partner. She is 25 years old and has a son of 3 years old. Sulma sells cheese and meat. She brings her products from her town, Sachabamba, and sells them in the Nery Garcia market, although she also does home deliveries.

Donatilda, 37 years old, is married and has a 17-year-old son. Donatilda has a little store in a school where she and her husband sell candy, fruit, food.

Lucinda, 44 years old, is married and has 3 children. Lucinda travels to the fairs in her area and buys cereals that she sells afterwards in the Nery Garcia market. Lucinda also travels every two weeks to the Rumichaka fair where she sells bread and processed cereal.

Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda are asking for loans of 600 soles, 800 soles, and 800 soles. They will use the money to buy potatoes, cookies, rice, oil, bread, corn, fava beans, and carob beans.

They use their savings for their daily needs, to improve the capital of their businesses and for their childrens' education. Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda's dreams are for their children to be professionals, to improve their capital, to buy a taxi cab for her husband to work and to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 8 meses, 3 años, 3 años respectivamente.

Sulma es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, Sulma vende queso y carne, sus productos los trae de su pueblo Sachabamba y lo vende en el mercado Nery García, también reparte a domicilio.

Por otro lado Donatilda es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo de 17 años, Donatilda tiene un cafetín ubicado en un colegio, donde vende golosinas, frutas, comida, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.

Mientras que Lucinda es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Lucinda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra cereales, para luego venderlo en el mercado Nery García. Además Lucinda viaja quincenalmente a la feria de Rumichaka donde vende panes y cereales procesados.

Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, galletas, arroz, aceite, pan, maíz, haba, arveja.

Sus ahorros son para alguna necesidad, incrementar el capital de sus negocios y la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Sulma, Donatilda y Lucinda son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener más capital, comprar un taxi para que trabaje su esposo y comprar su casa.

loans.use: Sulma, Donatilda, and Lucinda are asking for loans of 600 soles, 800 soles, and 800 soles. They will use the money to buy potatoes, cookies, rice, oil, bread, corn, fava beans, and carob beans.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Señor Pablo M. M. is an elementary school teacher in one of the schools in Managua. He likes his profession because he feels that he is contributing to the intellectual and social development of children. He also likes to involve himself completely in the activities of his community, with the aim of contributing to the sports in his community to keep young people from vices and delinquency.

Don Pablo is single, is 49-years-old, and one of his biggest dreams is to someday see his house completely built and to live in a house worthy of all his efforts at work. He hopes to be able to use this loan to purchase construction materials to finish building a room. He will pay this loan back in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Pablo M. M. es profesor de primaria de uno de los colegios de Managua, le gusta su profesión porque siente que contribuye con la formación intelectual y social de los niños, además, le gusta involucrarse de lleno en las actividades de su comunidad con el fin de contribuir con el desarrollo del deporte de su barrio y de esa manera apartar a los jóvenes de los vicios y de la delincuencia.

Don Pablo es soltero, tiene 49 años y uno de sus más grandes sueños es ver un día su casa de habitación construida totalmente, para así vivir en una casa merecedora de todos sus esfuerzos de trabajo. Espera poder utilizar el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la edificación de un cuarto. Este préstamo lo pagará en cuotas mensuales a 12 meses de plazo.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a room in his home

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Sainbu-Bhaishapati is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband's name is Shiva Ram K. and he is an electrician. Her daughter and her son are studying in grade 6 and 2 respectively. 
Mr. K. is engaged in goat farming. At present she has 6 goats. She sells goats’ milk in the local market. Now she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk. So she is requesting for $450 loan to buy more goats for her business.

loans.use: To buy goats for her business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap L. (shown in the picture with her daughter, who is weaving), 45, and her husband, Mr. Ry Chan, 46, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, two weave silk at home, and the other three are still young and stay at home.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for twenty-five years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Ry has been a farmer for twenty-five years, and grows rice and raises cows. Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is 35 years old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods, cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies,  and biscuits in the local market of Koforidua, Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned foods, milk, food spices, washing soaps and powders in bulk to expand her business. Mina hopes to make good income from the expanded business to  support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods, milk, food spices, washing soaps and powders.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama D. is a young married woman, born in 1982 and mother of twins. She trades in a wide variety of products. She started her business activities by selling seafood, but at the same time she also sells fabrics and cosmetic goods.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

mama D. est une jeune femme mariée née en 1982 et mère de deux jumelles .elle fait du commerce de produits diversifiés:elle a commencé ses activités commerciales par la vente de fruits de mer ;parallèlement elle vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.use: For a small retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola M. es empleada en un salón de peinados, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Su esposo es empleado de costura en un taller particular, la pareja tiene un hijo pequeño y vive en la casa de sus padres (Yola tiene dos hermanos, los cuales ven en la fotografía) ubicada en la zona  Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para incrementar la mercadería de la tienda de abarrotes, así podrá incrementar sus ingresos en menos tiempo, lo que le permitirá mantener a su familia´.
 
Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Yola M. works in a hair salon and owns a small convenience store. Her husband works as a tailor in a private workshop. The couple have a small son and live in their parents' home in the Tahuantinsuyo district of the city of El Alto. (Yola has two brothers, who appear in the photograph.) The loan will be used to expand the merchandise in Yola's convenience store. This will allow her to increase her revenue in little time, which in turn will help her support her family. An assessment conducted by Impro qualifies Yola for her first loan with the organization.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: I Made Ardana

texts.id: Di dusun Taman, Desa Tuwed, Bali barat, sebagian besar masyarakatnya hidup dari hasil bercocok tanam khususnya tanaman jangka pendek seperti: padi, palawija dan sayur-sayuran. Begitu juga yang di tekuni oleh I Made Ardana. Meskipun tak memiliki lahan sendiri, suami dari Nyoman Desi ini juga sibuk mengurusi kebun sayur kacang panjang yang ditanam dilahan yang di dapatnya dari menegrjakan tanah orang lain dengan sistem bagi hasil. Tanah seluas kurang lebih 20 Are telah ditanami kacang panjang dan telah menyelesaikan panen pertama dan mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan. Namun I Made Ardana merasa sangat kecewa karena dari hasil yang di dapatnya habis untuk mengembalikan modal yang dia dapat pinjam dari seseorang dengan bunga yang sangat tinggi. Untuk itulah untuk periode penanaman berikut ini I Made Ardana ingin bergabung dengan Dinari untuk meminjam  modal dengan sistem pengembalian di akhir periode    yaitu 6 bulan. Modal ini oleh I Made Ardana akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit, pupuk dan biaya –biaya lain yang di perlukan dalam perawatan kebun sayurnya. Dengan begitu I Made Ardana bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik dan tentunya dapat merasakan hasil jerih payahnya.
texts.en:
Most of the people in Taman village of Tuwed West Bali are farmers. They mainly farms paddy, beans and veggies. I Made Ardana is also a farmer. However he doesn't have his own land, so he work as a farming labor on someone else farms. He works on a 20 are land. He will then get a part of the proceed from the farm. He is not satisfied with the result that he get so far as his part of the proceed usually goes for the repayment of loan that he took to finance his farming activities. The loan that he took charged a very high interest rate.

Therefore he wants to join the DINARI's 6 month program so he can get cheaper funding to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He really hopes to be able to get a better result this period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli bibit, anti hama, pupuk dan biaya pengolahan tanah)

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap N. is 39 years old and lives in Kdol village in Takeo Province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Aum Lo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Despite their hard work, rampant inflation has made it difficult for them to improve their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap N. is seeking a loan to buy lumber to contribute to building a house for her family. She has five children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy lumber to contribute to building a new house

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Dangbo dans le departement du plateau, K. Immaculée s'est mariée avec monsieur BOKO Geoffroy et de cette union est issue deux enfants Alain et Aline, des jumeaux  agés de 8ans et en classe de CE2.  Elle fait la location de baches et chaises lors des cérémonies et elle vend aussi des poissons frais congelés. Dame Immaculée avait commencé par les locations mais vu l'emplacement de sa boutique et  sur la demande de ses clients elle a sollicité  auprès de notre institution un second pret.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Dangbo in the Plateau department, Immaculée K. is married to Mr. Geoffroy Boko and has two kids, Alain and Aline, 8-year-old twins who are in the 3rd grade. She rents out tarps and chairs for ceremonies and sells frozen fish. Ms. Immaculée had started with just the rentals but given the location of her shop and her clients’ demand, she is seeking a second loan with our institution.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of fish and 20 chairs

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum N. is a farmer in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays much money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one in order to plow the filed. Her husband, Mr. Sim Thuoy, is a chicken breeder. Mrs. Chum N. is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one in order to plow the filed.

loans.name: Juliet C.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the District Education Committee Primary School, Fadugu (D.E.C). It was built by the government in 1950. It has a total of twenty-one staff and 535 pupils. D.E.C is one of the three primary schools in Fadugu (a small town about twenty-five miles from Kabala).

D.E.C is the most popular primary school in Fadugu. The school always gets a 100% passes at the National Primary School Exams (BECE). It is also victorious in quiz and cultural competitions organized by N.G.Os like Cause Canada and CADO. In sport, they also always triumph over the other two primary schools in the town.

As part of their constraints, D.C.E lacks sufficient latrines for the 535 pupils it has – they only have six pit holes. D.C.E. also lacks a good water well to serve the children of this school. The only water well they have dries up completely during the dry season. Accommodation is also another problem for the children of D.E.C. The building is too small to accommodate the 535 pupils. Staff of D.E.C are working hard to meet these challenges; they are currently seeking assistance from the various N.G.Os in Koinadugu district. Fortunately, they are very grateful to VDC (Village Development Partnership, an NGO of former American Peace Corps), who are currently constructing them a three class-room building, the first to benefit from VDC in the Koinadugu district.

Juliet C. Conteh (2nd from right) is the Deputy Head Teacher of the school. Juliet is married to a soldier and the two of them have four children together. One of their children is in college, and the others are in Senior Secondary School (SSS) I, II and III. Juliet will divide her loan into three partitions: 1) to buy building materials 2) to pay school fees for her children and 3) to invest in business.

loans.use: Buy building materials, pay school fees and invest in business

loans.name: Casaorcco Group

texts.es:
El Banco Casaorcco inicia su cuarto ciclo con  17 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Casaorcco que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Los pobladores D. la zona se dedican a la agricultura D. papa, maíz.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta abarrotes en general, cereales, lácteos, animales menores, comida y  también  a la agricultura y crianza D. animales.


Como es el caso D. Catalina que es casada, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales, animales, productos que venD. en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura D. papa y arveja.

Por otro lado Ana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene una tienda pequeña en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, además Ana por las noches venD. salchipollos en la puerta D. su casa.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 56 años, Lucia junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias, pueblos D. donD. compran animales que luego venden en la feria D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,750 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra oveja, cerdo, arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, maíz, trigo, abono.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propio y brndar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank of Casaorcco starts its 4th loan cycle with 17 members. The members are women from the community of Casaorcco, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The people in this area work in agriculture, growing potatoes and corn. The members have different jobs like selling groceries in general, grains, dairy, small animals, prepared food and also working on the farm and raising animals. Catalina, who is 55 years old, married and has 10 children travels to different markets to buy grains and small animals that she sells to the community. She also grows potatoes and peas. Another member is Ana, who is 29, lives with her common-law husband and has 2 children. Ana has a small store in her home where she and her husband sell groceries, fruits, and vegetables. At night, she sells “salchipollos” (a typical Peruvian food prepared with chicken and potatoes) from her front door. A final example is Lucia, who is 56 years old and married. She and her husband travel together to the markets and other towns where they buy animals that they later sell at the local animal market. Each member is asking for a different loan amount—for example, 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles or 900 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 9,750 soles. The loan money will be used to buy sheep, pigs, rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, corn, flour and fertilizer. The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, own their own homes and proviD. their children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals, cooking supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mrs. Mang H. has lived with her family of three in a medium-size wooden house along the street for years. She is 41 and currently makes a daily income by planting vegetables on her own farmland next to her house. She is married to Mr. Lab. They have one child, who is a student in primary school.

Mang H.'s husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. Recently, her husband hasn't been able to attract as many clients, because his motorbike breaks down frequently. As a result, Mang H. decided to ask for a $400 loan to buy another motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: Buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Salmina Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid has been a firewood and handbags seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and handbags for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwanaid is 40 years old, married, and has two children: ages 20 and 18. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Arafa, who also has her own small business dealing in tailoring and clothes selling in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En las cercanías del Mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Carolina G. se dedica a atender su negocio de joyería donde vende todo tipo de joyas para damas y caballeros y también brinda el servicio de reparación de joyas siendo apoyada por sus familiares y su hijo que tiene que mantener.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las joyas y ya que requiere adquirirlas para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para proceder en el negocio y así beneficiar a toda su familia.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of the wholesale market in the town of Managua, Carolina Garnero runs her jewellery business where she sells all sorts of jewellery for men and women and also offers a repair service, being helped by her relatives and her son who she has to care for. She has now approached Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan in order to purchase jewellery she needs to acquire for sale. It is for this reason that she confidently hopes to be a beneficiary of the aforementioned loan so she can proceed with her business and thus provide for her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewellery

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира Назарова  торгует на рынке. Продает капусту и зелень, которую она покупает у оптовиков - дехканинов.  Супруг Назиры Соли Назаров тоже торгует на рынке, он продает помидоры и огурцы.
У них трое детей, семья проживает в городе Истаравшане.
Назира в предпринимательской деятельности уже 10 лет, и имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере. 
Назира хочет разнообразить ассортимент своего товара, а значит торговать не только капустой и зеленью, но и болгарским перцем, чесноком и баклажанами. Для этого, ей необходима сумма в размере  1300 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazira N. sells cabbage and other greens at a market. She buys the vegetables wholesale from dehkan farmers. Nazira’s husband, Soli Nazarov, sells tomatoes and cucumbers at the market as well. They have three children and live in the city of Istaravshan. Nazira has been an entrepreneur for 10 years and has ample experience in this field. Nazira wants to diversify her product assortment so that she can start selling bell peppers, garlic and eggplants. She needs a loan in a sum of 1300 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify product assortment

loans.name: Patty Maribel

texts.es:
Patty es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Patty  es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Patty  tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, negocio que es administrado por su hermano, en donde también vende golosinas. Además Patty  vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Patty  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora.
Patty  sueña con ampliar su negocio con mas maquinas, locutorio, fotocopiadora e implementar una librería.
texts.en:
Patty is a member of the Communal Bank Corrí Ayllu, which means Family of Gold. Patty lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and has 1 child. Patty has Internet booths in her home, a business that is managed by her brother and where they also sell sweets. Patty also sells cosmetics through catalogs. Patty needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of a computer. Patty dreams of expanding her business by adding more computers, a telephone kiosk, a photocopier, and a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Gilmor

texts.en:
Gilmor P. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of products like canned goods, bread, coffee, milk and firewood. He is 42 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Barra, Opol , Misamis Oriental. Gilmor has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gilmor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Gilmor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gilmor is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his sixth loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family and to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a sari sari store

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
H. Đặng Thị (529980781) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4300000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1998, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by H. from TYM Fund.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Conslala Achieng

texts.en:
Conslala is a 38-year-old married woman who has seven children. She also cares for three orphans. Conslala sells small fish and vegetables that she buys in the city and carries to market on her head. Her husband does not have steady work.

Conslala hopes to expand her business so that she can feed her orphans well and enrol them in school. Right now she does not have enough money to pay their school fees. She also tries to help support her neighbors’ orphans as well. Conslala is a volunteer community health worker with K-MET, the NGO giving the loan. K-MET is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Conslala. For more information about K-MET, see the partner link on the lower right side of this web page.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of vegetables and fish

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes P. is single. She has received schooling through junior high. Agnes sells Hair creams, relaxes, shampoos and other cosmetics at Bla in Hohoe. Agnes is solely responsible for her feeding, clothing and other financial commitment.  With the high demand for Agnes cosmetics and hair product, she plans to use the loan to purchase more of the cosmetics and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest into the business.

loans.use: she plans to use the loan to purchase more of the cosmetics and sell.

loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.es: La señora Maria Marcela de 54 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monte Tabor en la capital de  Managua, sus hijos independientes, su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como enchiladas, tajadas con queso, tacos y otros, con bajos costos, son doce años los que lleva elaborando sus ricos platillos, el cual inicio en sociedad con su hermana con fondo propios, con este préstamo es su tercer ciclo el cual invertirá en comprar granos básicos, plátanos, repollo, queso, maíz y otros productos para mejorar las comida. Dando gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de incrementar su inventarios con productos para que no falte la comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marcela is 54 years old and lives in the Monte Tabor neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. All of her children are financially independent. Her business involves selling fast food such as enchiladas, fried plantains with cheese, tacos, and other low cost items. For twelve years, Sra. Maria Marcela has been offering these rich dishes. She started this business with her sister using her own money.

She is requesting her third loan, which she will use to buy basic grains, plantains, cabbage, cheese, corn, and other products used in making her dishes. Sra. Maria Marcela thanks AFODENIC for giving her the opportunity to increase her inventory so that she will never run out of food for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in her dishes

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
la sra. ANA VICTORIA NUÑEZ MENDOZA tiene un salon de belleza el cual opera bajo el nombre de Sala de Belleza "ANAS" mismo que se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, pero su esposo vive en NEW YORK USA, y es ella la que esta sosteniendo el hogar.
con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella cubre a un 100% los gastos del hogar, y sus gastos personales.
la Sra. N. a sabido ganarse su clintela por la especialidad que tiene en los cortes y secados de cabello, aplicación de tintes y tratamientos, los clientes la prefiren por la atención con que les atiende y el local es agradable e higienico.
ella esta solicitando el credito ya que necesita comprar shampoos, cremas, tintes, tratamientos para el cabello etc.

loans.use: compra de shampoo, tintes, tratamientos para el cabello, secadora, glasses, lipsticks, cremas, sandalias.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane N. is the leader of an entrepreneur group in Mukono. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven children aged 8 to 22 who are all still in school. She also takes care of orphans.

Jane works as a plantation farmer where she grows crops both for sale and home consumption. She also works as a poultry farmer and has raised chickens at her home in Kisoga for 20 years. She is able to generate 100,000/= in profits per week, which helps her run her home and save a little money.

Jane wants to expand her poultry farm so she can earn enough income to educate her children and enable them to get jobs in the future. She needs a loan to buy more chicken feed and fertilizer to help boost her farming businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and fertilizer for her farms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe C. is from the village of  Batangan , Valencia Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Mariafe is married and has 3 school-aged children. Mariafe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Mariafe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Mariafe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mariafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Scholastica K. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 9 and 19. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans.

Scholastica has been purchasing and selling clothes since 2003. She works at her business for between nine and twelve hours per day, six days per week. She currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Scholastica thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Ivunamba Group, Jinja

texts.en:
M. Mariam is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hardworking and devoted lady with a business selling new clothes from Ivunamba. Mariam sells mostly ladies’, children’s, and girls’ clothes plus bags and belts which she buys from Jinja main town and at times from Kampala, depending on the sales and the season.

Mariam needs to buy more new clothes and shoes for her shop to be able to make more sales during the Christmas season. The profits she makes from it would help to pay her children’s school fees and general welfare.

Mariam takes care of some dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Chuch

texts.en: Chuch C., 34, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she makes rice wine and raises pigs and is able to make about US $5 profit every day. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish at the local market for US $5 a day. This couple has three school-aged children. Chuch C. would like to take out a loan of US$350 to make two investments. She will use half of the loan to purchase more pigs and the left over to replace a motorboat for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and a motorboat.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling garlands and peanuts in the local community. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Leonardo joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Librada

texts.en:
Maria D. C., age 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She provides for her only child as well as she can. She has been selling detergent soaps, dishwashing liquid, and fabric softener for quite some time.

Maria has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow from CCT’s Cooperative quite a few times. She consistently pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This loan will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and raw materials needed to produce her soaps and other products. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money to provide her child with a comfortable and stable life.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buying ingredients and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
