Mrs. Yeng C., 51, and her husband, Mr. Saroem Ros, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, and two assist their parents with the farming business. 

Yeng and her husband have been farming since they were married. The couple wants to purchase a water pumping machine to spray their farm, but they don’t have the money. So, Yeng is requesting a loan of $350 in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
35-year-old Roseline is married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos where she does her business; she sells frozen food, vegetable oil and drinks. She has been in the business since 2002 and has been doing fine. She hopes for great improvement and expansion in her business in future. This will also improve her family's standard of living.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more frozen food, vegetable oil and drinks to sell and make more profit as well.  She plans for a brighter future for her children as she and her husband, who is also in business, use their income to educate the children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food, vegetable oil and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Darun

texts.en: Mr. Darun S., 24 and his wife, Mrs. Pisey Tep, 29, have been married since 2007 and have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Darun has been driving a motor taxi for three years, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He hopes to better organize his house and so is asking for his first loan of $700 to renovate it. The photo shows his wife, as Darun was not available.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet H. was born in 1959. He is married and lives in Noyemberyan city, Tavush region, not far from Ijevan city. His family consists of his wife, who works as a librarian, and two school-aged daughters. For about 20 years, Hamlet worked as a mechanical engineer in one of Abovyan's city factories, but since 2003 he has been trading in jewelry  and souvenirs. With the income from his business, Hamlet supports his family and has been able to buy new furniture for his house and improve his family's living conditions. Hamlet asks for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy chains and bangles to resell and also to increase the assortment of souvenirs in his shop.

loans.use: To buy chains and bangles to resell and also to increase the assortment of souvenirs in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to serve her customers.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto D. is from the town of Banga. He is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Norberto grows crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Norberto has been engaged in his business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Norberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Norberto is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norberto from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 30 years old and a single mother of one.  She runs a green grocer for a living.  She started this business ten years ago and wants to expand it so as to generate more profits.  Faith also does dairy farming together with her group members in Githunguri Wisdom group, part of Faulu Kenya.  She supplies milk to Fresh Milk processing company, a well-known milk processing plant in Kenya.  As a single mother, she has to work hard to provide for her child.  She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia C., from the village of Bigaan, is 52 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Apolonia owns and operates a fish-selling business in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Apolonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan, her 15th, for 10,000 PHP, to be used for house renovation.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Ana Maryuri

texts.es:
Ana Maryuri T. C. tiene 28 años. Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Ana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Ana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, cacao y plátanos para el consumo de la familia. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada mes para el cacao y cada 6 meses para los otros cultivos. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en ciclo corto: poner más arroz, comprando insumos, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a salir adelante trabajando.
Su sueño es trabajar para tener una casa arreglada. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia con su mama enferma y los cultivos con plaga y langosta.

Le gusta escuchar música (bachata).
texts.en:
Ana Maryuri T. C. is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Ana is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Ana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, cacao, and bananas for family consumption. She also sells her crops in Ventanas. The cacao is sold every month, while the other crops are sold every six months.

She is requesting a loan for her work in short cycle farming. Ana wants to plant more rice, so she plans to buy supplies, seeds, fertilizers, and compost. She believes this loan will help her get ahead in her work. Her dream is to have a remodeled home. Among the problems she has to confront are the poor health of her mother and diseases and locusts that harm her crops.

Ana enjoys listening to Bachata music.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, seeds, fertilizers, and compost for planting rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For cement, sand, rock and screws.

loans.name: Savann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. SaV. Y., age 54, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members who all live in Kaoh Kaev village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. SaV. Y. is a pig breeder at home and, aside from pig breeding, she also sells sour cabbage in the local market. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support this sour cabbage business, Mrs. SaV. Y. will use the loan to buy vegetables to make sour cabbage for selling. Mrs. SaV. Y. is widow with two children. One is a construction worker and one is student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to make sour cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita O. is from Baranggay 5, Tangub City. She is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like biscuits, sugar, food for snacks, milk, soap, shampoo and so on in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $700 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Agapita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon L., 29, is married with three young children living at home in Takeo province. She makes and sells brooms at the local market, typically making US$ 1 each day and her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes about US$ 3 each day. Thon L. would like a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike as currently this family spends a lot on transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and one son in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. Her son, age 6, attends a local kindergarten. Erdenechimeg operates a grocery business with help of her husband in the Bayanzurh market. They began this grocery business in 2007 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. After years of work, they could only increase their working capital to 700,000 MNT but still have not built sustainable operation yet. They have used their earnings to provide their family's daily consumption. In the future, they hope to expand their grocery trading business. She says, “All I want is to help my son lead a happy life and have our own home”. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more candies and sweets at wholesale price to resell for profits.

loans.use: To purchase more candies and sweets

loans.name: Piscis De Agua Escondida Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Piscis D. Agua Escondida porque  a todas las del grupo les pareció llamativo ese nombre. El grupo está formado por 9 personas, todas tienen su actividad económica, y se reunieron para obtener el crédito puesto que  todas se conocen entre sí además D.  que son vecinas.La señora ma. Guadalupe Hernández  es casada tiene cuatro hijos, ella tiene una actividad que es la siembra D. hongos zeta los tiene en cuartos obscuros los cuales son prestados, nos comenta que lleva un proceso muy delicado para su producción pues tiene que estar al pendiente D. ellos, después los cosecha y los venD.  en  su puesto  y la otra parte D. venta es por pedidos, la venta es diaria no pueD. quedarse tanto tiempo con ellos porque se hechan a perder muy rápido.Menciona  la señora que no nos permite sacarle fotografía ya que el hongo es muy celoso y se pueD. marchitar, hongos zetas crecen en un lapso D. quince días y promete darnos una fotografía a la hora D. la cosecha. La clienta hace mención que con su crédito está construyendo sus propios cuartos para ya no pedir prestado y seguir con el negocio D. los hongos zetas.
texts.en: This group is called Piscis D. Agua Escondida ["Pisces of Hidden Water"] because the name is striking to all of the members of the group.  The group is comprised of 9 people, all of whom have their own job.   They have meetings to apply for loans since they all know each other and are neighbors.  One of the group members, Guadalupe Hernández, is married and has 4 children.  She cultivates mushrooms in dark rooms that she borrows.  She comments that this is a very delicate production process and she has to be very attentive to the mushrooms.  After the harvest she sells a part of the mushrooms from her stand and the other part is used to fill orders.  She sells them daily and she cannot leave them for long because they go bad quickly.  Guadalupe mentions that she is not letting us take a photo because she is very protective of the mushrooms as they could wither.  The mushrooms grow in 15 days, and she promises to give us a photo when they are harvested.  With this loan, the client will construct her own rooms so that she can grow her mushrooms without having to borrow rooms.

loans.use: To prepare space for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel C. A. tiene 27 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Gabriel pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y dar la educación a los hijos.
Le gustaría que el monto del crédito sea más alto.
texts.en:
Gabriel C. A. is 27 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has four children.

Gabriel belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba Communal Bank, which is half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that works in agriculture and farming livestock such as dairy cows and pigs. The group has 20 members.

Gabriel grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. He also raises dairy cows. He buys them in Guaranda, and he sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his corn, wheat, bean, and potato crops. He also wants the loan to buy animals to fatten and later sell. The loan will help him provide his family with the necessities. 

His dream is to buy a house and to give his children an education.  

He would like the amount of the loan to be higher.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his corn, wheat, bean, and potato crops and to buy animals to fatten and later sell

loans.name: July Magdalena

texts.es:
July de 48 años, tiene una farmacia frente a un hospital. Vive con su esposo y dos hijas en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Ella es obstétriz desde hace mucho tiempo por eso le intereso mucho tener una farmacia como negocio. Una de sus hermanas le enseño como trabajar en una farmacia y le prestó un local frente a un hospital- maternidad. Ya tiene 14 años con su farmacia frente a un hospital vendiendo pañales, antibióticos, antigripales etc. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 18h00pm los pañales los vende a $ 0.25 c/u, sueros a $ 1.50, antibióticos a $ 0.20 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como antigripales, antibióticos, panales etc. En el futuro quiere surtir su farmacia con mas medicinas y que sus hijas que ahora están pequeñas se gradúen con éxito.
texts.en:
July, who is 48 years old, has a pharmacy in front of a hospital.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area in which most of the residents are businesspeople.

She has been a midwife for a long time, and for that reason she was very interested in having a pharmacy as a business.  One of July's sisters taught her how to work in a pharmacy and lent her a shop in front of a maternity hospital.  She has been running the pharmacy in front of the hospital for fourteen years, and she sells diapers, antibiotics, flu remedies, etc.  She works from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm and sells the diapers for $0.25 each, serums at $1.50 and antibiotics at $0.20 per unit.

With the loan she wants to buy medicines like flu remedies and antibiotics as well as diapers, etc.  In the future July wants to stock her pharmacy with more medicines.  She also wants her daughters, who are small now, to graduate from school.

loans.use: Antibiotics, medicines, diapers

loans.name: Oscar Kithenge

texts.en: Oscar Kithenge M. is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Oscar has been a retail shop owner and a mobile hawker for the last three years.  With his second loan from KADET, Oscar plans to purchase a mobile kiosk.  He will use his profits for his children's education.  Oscar's dream for the future is to own a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase a movable kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more farming supplies like hoes

loans.name: Alexandra Dolores

texts.es:
Alexandra de 31 años, es una joven emprendedora que está trabajando vendiendo productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 

Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y trabaja sola vendiendo los productos a sus vecinos, conocidos y recorriendo las calles. Vende productos como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, desodorantes a un precio muy cómodo para sus clientes incluso les da los productos con un plazo de pagos por cuotas. 

Quiere seguir ayudando a su esposo por eso quiere continuar vendiendo los productos Yanbal por eso necesita comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña y ladrillos.
texts.en: Alexandra, age 31, is an enterprising youth who works selling Yanbal products (Yanbal is a company that offers enterprising women a chance to start selling independently) to help her husband with the household costs. She lives in a periurban zone called Pariaso, and she works alone selling those products to her neighbours and acquaintances, and on the street. She sells products such as perfumes, creams, makeup and deodorants at a price that is very comfortable for her clients. She also offers products with a payment plan. She wants to continue helping her husband, so she wants to continue selling Yanbal products. Thus she needs to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she wants to finish building her home, as it is currently made of logs and bricks.

loans.use: perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Boshi

texts.en:
N. Boshi is 60 years old. He is married with 4 children. For more than 20 years, Boshi has arduously dedicated himself to the livestock business. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Boshi decided to construct a place to start the business of animal breeding. He started only with two sheep but now he has about 10 sheep. Now Boshi wants to expand his business and to buy more sheep. 

Trustingly he has sought IMON, believing that his loan request will be granted and with this he will be able to move forward in his work. Your support will really help to Boshi and his family to get ahead.        

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young livestock

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita O. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and manicure/weaving businesses. She lives in  Brgy. San Sebastian, Samboan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard at her   hog raising and manicure businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Agapita is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she  can continue to fund the operations of her business.   This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

 Agapita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

 About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to funds the operation of hog-raising
